loans.name: Reng

texts.en: Reng O., 43, produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of 1 USD per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of 2 USD per day. The family has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 40 USD on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. is not available so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya  Koné  est un homme marié de 34ans monogame vivant   avec ses  quatre  enfants dans le quartier Ouest de la ville de Kolondièba, troisième région administrative de la république Mali.
Yaya fait le commerce de bétails depuis maintenant quinze ans. Il est très sollicité et apprécié dans cette activité. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième cycle. 
Monsieur Koné compte achète des bœufs, des moutons et des chèvres, dans la ville de Kolondièba et environnants.  
Il vend ces animaux au marché à bétails de Kolondièba, au comptant et souvent à crédit.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCfa par mois. 
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans les frais  santé et le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya Koné is a monogamous, 34-year-old married man who lives with his four children in the western district of the city of Kolondièba (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Yaya has been selling livestock for the past fifteen years. He is in high demand and enjoys a very good reputation in this business.

To increase his working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on his second loan cycle.

Mr. Koné plans to purchase oxen, sheep and goats in Kolondièba and neighboring areas. He sells the animals at the Kolondièba cattle market for cash and often on credit. He expects to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health care and to fund his activities.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 32-year-old, married man blessed with a three-year-old child.  He is a hard-working businessman who does dairy farming.  He is also employed in a milk-processing company.  He has been farming in Kiambu for three years.  With support from Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and his financial status has risen.  He has requested 80,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Louella

texts.en:
Ma. Louella is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: the selling of chicken barbeque, a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Nilo, who is 31 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 8 and 12 years old. Ma. Louella joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Louella has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000, with which she intends to purchase additional stock for her business so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children and for home repairs. Ma. Louella is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn T. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Siem Reap province. She and her husband work together in their fishing business. They are good parents who are very responsible about their three children, all of whom study in a local school. This couple earns their income by catching fish, which they then sell. They always get up while the sky is still dark to go to fishing on Tunle Sap River, where the fish are plentiful. Currently, the family can't catch as many fish as they did before because their fishing tools often break. Therefore, Rorn T. is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing equipment for their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Abahujumutima Group

texts.en:
The President of Abahujumutima Group is Pollonette, pictured with the yellow shirt and red skirt, holding the group's blue passbook. Pollonette is 46, widowed, and has five children ranging in age from 4 years to 18 years old, all except the youngest enrolled in school.

Pollonette has been selling vegetables for 16 years, and will use this loan to buy additional inventory of fruit and vegetables. With any profits realized, she will feed her children, pay for their school fees, and improve her house.

loans.use: Additional inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido, de 41 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Virginia de 28 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad  de vida. Todas las mañanas Guido se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de sus cafetales y árbol de palta, en lo que posteriormente lo cosechará para venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y capital, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus plantaciones de café. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Guido is 41 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 28 year-old Virginia, and his five beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Every morning, Guido takes a lot of care in working his land and making it fertile since he knows that the quality of his coffee plantations and avocado trees depends on it.  After harvesting his crops, Guido takes them to the market in the town of Pichanaki to sell.  What he most enjoys about his work is the fact that he has a lot of freedom to work on his land since he can make use of his own time and capital.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be weeding his coffee plantations.

Over time, Guido would like to buy more land so that he can increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP and he feels capable of making all his loan repayments.  Guido is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.ar: مهدي عمره 28 سنة متزوج يعمل في جلي البلاط له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويطوره بشكل مستمر يسعى الى تأمين مستقبله من خلال تطوير العمل وزيادة المدخول طموح مجد ومحب للعمل له زبائن من خارج محيطه وجيرانه يتميز ياتقان العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جلاية للبلاط وتوسيع العمل كان للقرض السابق الأثر الجيد على عمله وزيادة مدخوله
texts.en: Mehdi is 28 years old and married. He works buffing tile floors. He has 12 years of experience in this field, and he likes his work. In addition, he is always developing his business. He is trying to secure a good future for himself by developing his business and by increasing his income. He is ambitious, just as he is serious about his work. He has customers from both outside his community and from among his neighbors. He stands out in his field by way of the excellent quality of his work. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy a new floor buffer in order to expand his business. His last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on his business and helped him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a floor buffer.

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; es  casada, la socia tiene 45 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (27, 22) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención de su restaurante; la socia  tiene un restaurante en el bello y típico pueblo del pan Oropesa, ella tiene dos personas que le apoyan con la atención del mismo, la socia desea el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, aceite, gaseosas y todos los insumos necesarios para poder atender en el restaurante, al socia desea comprar al por mayor para que los costos sean menores y las ganancias mayores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para el restaurante.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 45, is married and has two children aged 27 and 22. She is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”'; the bank is located in the Oropesa village of the Quispicanchis province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Alicia divides her time between her household work and her business of running a restaurant. Her restaurant is located in the beautiful and traditional bread-producing village of Oropesa; she works with two other people who help her with providing service to clients. 

Alicia is seeking a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, and all the supplies necessary to run a restaurant; she would like to purchase from a wholesaler because that allows her to have lower costs and increase the earnings. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a restaurant

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Sarah has a poultry business, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. He is 57 years old. Jesus is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jesus owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Jesus has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1995, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and threads. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jesus from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: L'eternel Est Mon Berger-Vedoko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe L'ETERNEL EST MON BERGER-VEDOKO est composé de huit personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier.  C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est née le 29 Février 1968 au  Bénin. Philomène est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Yves. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leurs charges. Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène vend de l'igname frit, des bananes frits et des beignets (faits à base de haricot) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Philomène vend des spaghettis. Philomène s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe L'ETERNEL EST MON BERGER-VEDOKO, un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
This group, L'Eternel est mon berger-Vedoko (The Lord is my Shepherd) is composed of eight persons who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fifth time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support, in order to raise their activity level. The group's representative, named Philomène, is the woman raising her hand on the picture.
Philomène was born in Benin on February 29, 1968. She is married to a retailer named Yves. The couple has four children, who all go to school; two of them depend on them financially. Philomène lives together with her husband and children. In order to provide for herself and her children, Philomène sells fried yams, fried plantains and bean-based fritters in her neighborhood. As a secondary activity, she also sells spaghetti. Philomène gets her supplies from a city in Benin.
Seeking customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and profit, Philomène is requesting a fifth loan together with the other members of the group L'Eternel est mon berger-Vedoko.

loans.use: to buy bags of yams, bananas, condiments, vegetable oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que esta en el colegio,patricia  vive en casa de sus padres,patricia recibe un dinero por parte de su ex pareja, para su hijo,patricia se dedica a la vender mazamorra, arroz con leche y dulce de camote, realiza esta actividad alrededor de la zona por donde vive, en el parque de comatrana, y en las afuera de la iglesia de comatrana, también vende sus productos a los trabajadores del hospital regional, los desafíos que enfrenta patricia es tener que dejar a su hijo  solo con su mama y así ella pueda dedicarse a trabajar para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar insumos para preparar su productos como arroz, leche, maíz morado ,canelas y los embaces descartables para la repartición de sus productos, patricia como toda joven tiene muchos sueños uno de ello es tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus producto y así atender mejor a sus clientes, patricia esta muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Patricia is a single mother and has a 6 year-old son who is in school. Patricia lives in her parents' home and receives money for her son from her ex-partner. Patricia's business is selling 'mazamorra', rice pudding and 'dulce de camote' (sweet potato candy). She carries out this business in the area where she lives, in Comatrana park and outside Comatrana church. She also sells her products to the people who work in the regional hospital. The challenge that Patricia faces is having to leave her son alone with her mom so that she can work in order to provide him with a better quality of life. Patricia is requesting this loan to buy supplies for preparing her products such as rice, milk, purple corn, cinammon and disposable containers for distributing her products. Patricia, in common with all young women, has a lot of dreams. One of them is to own her own premises where she can sell her products and better serve her customers. Patricia is very grateful for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as milk, rice, purple corn and disposable containers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
 
Marilou is providing a motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) service. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service.

Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 26 years old and married with three children aged  seven years to five months living in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. For two years, Julius has been dealing in the bar and lodging business and from this business he has been able to build a house, although it's not yet complete. He faces the challenges of the high labor turnover and bottles getting lost but hopes to put up another bar with a new pool table and employ skilled manpower. Julius wants a loan to buy a pool table.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for the bar.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь родом из Ивано-Франковска. Он зарабатывает на жизнь транспортными перевозками пассажиров по территории Украины. Он женат и у него двое детей: 11-летний сын и годовалая дочка. У Василя нет проблем с заказами – у него есть и постоянные клиенты и отменная репутация. На этом рынке услуг Василь работает уже 12 лет. Его доход составляет 5 000 гривен. На данный момент он работает на собственном автомобиле Опель Астра 2006 года выпуска, состояние автомобиля – прекрасное. 

Василю необходим кредит на сумму 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы установить газобаллонное оборудование 4-го поколения с впрыскиванием для работы автомобиля на сжиженной газе, а также для текущего ремонта машины. После переоборудования автомобиля для работы на сжиженном газе уменьшатся затраты на заправку, что приведет к увеличению прибыли. Работа Василя – главный источник доходов для семьи клиента. Раньше Василь работал в милиции, но потом рассчитался и начал заниматься пассажирскими перевозками, так как не было других вариантов обеспечить семью. Его главная мечта – дать детям возможность получить высшее образование в свое время. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Vasil was born in Ivano-Frankivsk.  He makes his living driving passengers around the Ukraine.  He's married with two children: an eleven-year-old son, and a one-year-old daughter.  He has no trouble getting business.  He has regular customers and an excellent reputation.  He's been in the business for twelve years and makes 5000 hryvni.  At present he uses his own car, a 2006 Opel Astra.  It's in great condition.

Vasil needs a loan of 10,000 hryvni to install a fourth generation fuel injection system so his car can run on LP gas, and also do some routine repairs. By converting his car to LP gas, he'll lower his fuel  expenses and increase profits. Vasil provides the primary means of transportation for his clients' families.  Earlier he worked for the police, but he left that and got into driving passengers, since there were no other options for supporting his family.  Vasil's biggest dream is give his children a chance for highest possible education when the time comes.

loans.use: to install a 4th generation fuel injection system so his car can run on LP gas, and to make routine repairs on the car.

loans.name: Maria Christine

texts.en:
Maria Christine is 27 years old and married. She has a 7-year-old child. Maria Christine and her family live in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Maria Christine's husband works as a farmer and a mechanic.

Maria Christine is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land and plant rice crops. Maria Christine sells their harvest at her town's market. She earns just enough to buy their basic needs.

Maria Christine is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. She hopes to earn better and save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Julia Del Carmen tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de productos varios, ya que en su casa de habitación posee una pulpería la cual es administrada por ella misma. Sus ventas son al contado y al crédito en parte. La señora está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo a su negocio, en la compra de productos de sabanas, toallas, cremas, bolsas, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en: Julia Del Carmen is 45 years old.  She is a single mother and has three dependent children in her care.  Julia sells a variety of products.  She has a grocery store in her home which she runs herself.  Her sales are for cash and some are on credit.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her business buying sheets, towels, creams, bags, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, creams, bags, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 23 and 20. Her husband works as a farmer.

Judith is also a farmer. She helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. Judith's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Judith, on the other hand, focuses more on her eatery and a small videoke shop. Judith cooks the food that she sells at her eatery.

Judith would like to request a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and raw ingredients for her eatery such as meat and vegetables. Judith hopes to prosper in all her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and raw ingredients for her eatery such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet of his business.

loans.name: C4603 Inganji Group

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 25 years old and he is married with 1 child who is 3 years old. He is the president of a group that is called "Inganji" in the local language. The group is composed of six people: four men and two women. (Jean Damascene is the first person on the right side in the photo) and he sells Irish potatoes, bananas, sweet potatoes etc. This business is well organized. He employs two people to help him. Jean Damascene has been in this business for about three years.
Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more quantity of bananas, Irish potatoes,rice,sugar and so on. With the resulting profit, Jean Damascene will be able to reinvest in the business and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To purchase more food products like Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Rofilo

texts.en:
Rofilo is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with four children.

Rofilo has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish.  He has had this business for five years.  He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

Rofilo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rofilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ivett

texts.es: Ivett, de 22 año es una mujer soltera que vive en compañía de su mamá  Dora, su papá Secundino y sus hermanos a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Como mujer responsable, ella aprendió hace algún tiempo la actividad artística de “bisutería”, donde realiza aretes, collares, pulseras y demás accesorios femeninos a base de materiales reciclables. Le va muy bien en su negocio; pues constantemente realiza nuevos diseños, muy vistosos y a la moda. Acondicionó un pequeño taller en su casa, donde realiza su trabajo; ella comenta que el dinero que invierte en ello es muy poco, por lo que recibe una buena ganancia si vende en grandes cantidades. Además le agrada negociar sus pedidos, pues es hábil en las ventas; por lo que ahora desea ampliar su negocio para tener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ivett de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales como: perlas, ganchos, y demás adornos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivett is 22 years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her mom Dora, her dad Secundino, and her siblings, who she cares for with a lot of love in their own home which is located in Tambo district.  As a responsible woman, she learned the jewelry trade some time ago.  She learned to make earrings, bracelets and other women's accessories from recyclable materials.  Her business is going very well as she is constantly making new designs which are very attractive and fashionable.  She set up a small workshop in her home where she carries out her work.  She says that the money she invests is very little but that she makes good profits if she sells in large quantities.  She says that she enjoys negotiating her orders as she is skillful in making sales.  She would now like to expand her business in order to make better profits.

Ivett belongs to the 'Rompiendo Fronteras' (Breaking Down Borders) community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She is happy to have financial support.  This will make her feel safer in making progress in her work.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Ivett enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Ivett will invest the money she has requested in buying materials such as pearls, hooks and other accessories for her business.

loans.use: to buy pearls, hairpins, and other accessories

loans.name: Aurelio Pantaleon

texts.es:
Aurelio, es un hombre soltero de 39  años de edad, el se dedica a la carpintería, eligio este tipo de trabajo porque lo aprendió de su padre
Aurelio es un hombre  trabajador, emprendedor y  muy responsable con muchas ganas de  salir adelante.
Aurelio,  empezó su negocio en el año 1998 , gana semanalmente S/.190 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 6 días a la semana. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Aurelio invertirá el crédito en la compra de materiales de carpintería (madera, laca, etc)  Su sueño de Aurelio es tener su taller bien equipado para que pueda tener mas rentabilidad, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .

Aurelio vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
texts.en:
Aurelio is a single 39 year-old man.  He is a carpenter, and he chose this line of work because he learned it from his father.  Aurelio is a hardworking and enterprising man who is very responsible and has a strong desire to get ahead.

Aurelio started his business in 1998.  He earns 190 Peruvian soles a week.  He works for about 10 hours each day, and he works 6 days a week.  With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva, Aurelio will buy carpentry materials (wood, lacquer, etc.).  Aurelio's dream is to have a very well-equipped workshop so that his business could be more profitable.  His loan officer believes that he is an excellent client.

Aurelio lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroying Camaná’s tourism industry.  Many people lost their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upside of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to start up their own microenterprise, like the one that Aurelio is pursuing today.

loans.use: to buy carpentry supplies (wood, saws and nails)

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Olive has a shop that sells used clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of used clothing.

Olive has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Olive hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos’s dream is to open his own furniture showroom. After moving to the US from his native Columbia, he worked for a company that builds and finishes all types of wood furniture, cabinets, floors, etc. Carlos fell in love with the job and decided to work for himself as a wood craftsman. He opened a carpentry business out of his home in Florida almost three years ago. Carlos is proud that he is able to support his family through his hard work while doing something he loves. He hopes this loan will enable him to expand by hiring employees, opening a store-front, and let him make a greater contribution to his community.

This loan from Accion USA will allow Carlos to build the credit history he needs in the United States in order to formalize his business. He then can take the necessary steps to move from his home to a store-front location. Carlos says this loan will help him to obtain the tools he needs to showcase his excellent work and access a greater number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry equipment.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is married to a farmer at Enyinase near Elmina. She sells powdered soap, sugar, and sachet water. She has done this for seven years.  Abiba uses her income to assist her husband to pay utility bills. 

Abiba will use her loan to purchase maize, soap, and sugar for resale. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, sugar, and powdered soap for resale.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  He is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marlon provides transportation services to local community members.  Marlon has been engaged in his business for 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marlon joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Marlon is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, to repair his motorcycle so be can improve is income.  He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es: Gliceria es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, tiene 47 años, y se dedica a la venta de cereales en la ferias, tiene 10 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, todo este tiempo pudo aprender muchas cosas para poder salir adelante y educar a sus hijos, no fue nada fácil, pero con la facilidad que le dan los prestamos le ayudaron a que su negocio pueda crecer y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella esta muy agradecida por la ayuda y las capacitaciones que le dieron, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para las ferias.
texts.en: Glicera, 47, is a member of the Estrella (star) communal bank and she has been selling grains at the markets for 10 years.  She has also been a member of Finca Perú  for 12 years and in this time she has been able to learn many things to help her get ahead and educate her children.  It hasn’t been easy but she is very grateful for the help that the loans have given her so that her business could grow and  give advantages to her children. She is happy with the help and the training that she has received and she will use the loan to buy grains for the markets.

loans.use: to buy grains to sell at the markets

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gilma hace 10 años se dedica a vender enchiladas y también se dedica a la agricultora en temporadas de siembras, tiene 54 años es casada y sus hijos son adultos, tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, vegetales, arroz etc. Sadia hace y vende tortilla y Rosario vende cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is Gilma. For ten years she has sold enchiladas, and she also works in agriculture during the planting seasons. She is 54 years old. She is married and her children are adults. She has been a customer of this institution for 4 years. She will invest the loan in buying basic ingredients such as corn, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, rice, etc. 

Sadia makes and sells tortillas, and Rosario sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, rice, etc., to make enchiladas

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. María, tiene 24 años y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pasajes interprovinciales, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, la socia espera poder seguir estudiando para así poder trabajar en una buena empresa, siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante,las socias desearon salir en la foto detras de la imagen del Señor de Huanca tomando el nombre del Señor para su grupo.
La socia solicita el crédito para sus estudios.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de comida y los demás a la venta de pasajes interprovinciales.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong the the Señor de Huanca communal bank. This bank is located in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The member requesting the loan is Maria, who is 24 years old and single. She works selling tickets for travel between provinces and has been doing this for years. She is good at her job because she works hard every day. At the same time, Maria is studying for a degree in accounting. She hopes to be able to continue studying so that she can get a job in a good business and be successful. 

The members of the group wanted to have their photo taken in front of the painting of the "Señor de Huanca" whose name they have taken for the group. The member is requesting a loan for her studies. The other members work selling food or inter-provincial transport tickets. The member who can be seen in the superimposed photo on the left was given permission  to arrive late at the meeting. Maria is grateful to all those who form a part of this dream and pledges to meet the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her accounting studies.

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Luis is a fruit vendor who sells his product from his tricycle cart. He found that there was too much competition in the local fruit markets and preferred to take his fruits directly to the homes of his clients. He has had success because it is more convenient for people to buy fruits when Luis passes by rather than going to the market. Two days a week he also sells ties, belts and other clothing accessories. He is seeking a loan in order to fix his cart that was damaged when it got hit by a car recently.

Luis is 46 years old and has one son. He and his wife have been able to buy and fix up their home through hard work and savings. He tells us that his wife and son are his inspiration to go out and work hard from 5 in the morning into the evening.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Fix the tricycle cart he sells his fruit from

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre A., age 35, lives in Agbanakin with his whole family. He was orphaned very early on, when his father died. To take over the responsibilities for his younger brothers, he started farming, especially sugar cane. Today, he has 10 years worth of experience in this domain and has reached a production level that proves his mastery of the business. He now plans on growing crops in the off-season to meet market demands in his area. Previous loans allowed him to grow his operation and to improve his crop yields through the use of herbicides. Presently, the procurement of selected cuttings and the purchase of a motorized irrigation pump are his concerns for which he is requesting a loan of $950. He can then increase his production. Accomplishing these goals will offer him a degree of financial stability that will allow his family to thrive and achieve its potential.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur A. Alexandre est domicilié à Agbanakin avec toute sa famille. Devenu très tôt orphelin de père, et pour prendre en charge ses frères cadets, il s’est lancé dans l’agriculture et spécialement la culture de canne à sucre. Aujourd’hui, il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le domaine et a atteint un niveau de production dont il n’a plus la maîtrise. Il projette faire des cultures de contre saison afin de satisfaire toutes les demandes sur le marché de la localité. Les crédits précédents lui ont permis d’élargir son exploitation et d’améliorer le rendement par les traitements phytosanitaires. Aujourd’hui, l’approvisionnement en boutures sélectionnées et l’achat d’une motopompe sont ses préoccupations pour lesquelles il sollicite un montant de $950 en vue d'accroître sa production. La réalisation de ce projet lui offrira une stabilité financière qui permettra à sa famille de s’épanouir.

loans.use: Acquire selected cuttings and to buy a motorized pump for irrigation

loans.name: Oam

texts.en:
Aom C. N. is a pharmacist and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She usually makes around $4.00 per day in revenue. Her husband is a security guard and contributes his entire salary to the household every month. C. N., in addition to her pharmacy, sells medicine and cooks to provide for her family. C. N. thoroughly enjoys her daily job, but still needs money to improve her business. N. hopes the loan will help her purchase a wider range of medicines to meet the great demand from her clients.

In the future, N. would like to own a simple clinic to provide all kinds of treatments to her patients, and if she can save enough money, she would like to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en:
Alexis L., originally from Haiti, is a single man who lives in a rented home without electricity or running water. With this initial loan, he will establish a clothing store by investing in a varied selection of essential clothing to sell to his community of La Union, in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic

Note: Alexis is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand inventory of pants to begin

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has his own small printing shop in his home in the Villa Juliana area of the city of El Alto. He also is employed as a printer and soon plans to go independent. Antonio lives with his wife and son, who helps with the printing.

He will use the credit to buy a printer and in this way he will be able to stregthen his business while saving money as he would no longer need to rent printers.

This would be his 7th loan with IMPRO (he has been our client since 2002 and has a great record with us); and the evaluation carried out means that he qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio tiene su pequeño taller de imprenta ubicado en su domicilio en la zona Villa Juliana de la Ciudad de El Alto; también trabaja como empleado en una imprenta y en corto tiempo tiene planificado independizarse. Antonio vive con su esposa y un hijo quien le ayuda con la pequeña imprenta. El crédito lo destinara para comprar un prensa, de esa forma fortalecerá su pequeña imprenta y al mismo tiempo podrá ahorrar el costo de alquilar los servicios de prensa en los que ahora incurre. Este será el 7mo. Crédito con Impro; (es cliente nuestro desde el año 2002 con excelente historial de pagos) la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a printing machine/Compra de maquina prensadora

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born on July 12, 1974 in Naimey, Niger, Mrs. Afi O. is married to a tailor who is out of work and they have five children to raise. She left school to learn to be a seamstress. After she completed her apprenticeship, she also learned to dye lengths of African print cloth. Now, lacking the necessary funds, she is doing nothing. Her business amounts to selling penny candies and such, which does not bring in any real income. The fact that her husband is also not presently working as a tailor makes it extremely hard for them to support their family. In order to get back into business and manage to support their children, Mrs. O. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 12 juillet 1974 à Niamey au Niger, madame Afi O. est marié à un couturier sans travail avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Elle a quitté l’école au collègue pour apprendre la couture. Après son attestation de fin d’apprentissage, elle appris également la teinture des pagnes. Mais faute de moyens, elle ne fait actuellement rien. Ses activités se résument à un petit commerce de bombons et autres qui ne lui procure aucun revenu substantiel. Son mari également n’exerce pas son métier de couturier, ce qui rend très difficile l’économie très précaire de la famille. Pour relancer ses activités commerciales et pourvoir aux besoins de sa famille, elle sollicite un prêt de $1000.

loans.use:
purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a tailor shop

achat de machine et ouverture d'atelier de couture

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is a seamstress who sews all kinds of dresses. She is well-known for sewing “kaba,” a popular Ghanaian dress. She also sews children's and baby dresses, too. Georgina is married and has two children ages 3 and 1. Her husband is a driver who has his own car. Georgina works very hard. To support the finances of her family, she also sells cloth, materials used for sewing dresses, thread, and tape measures. She also sells mineral water.

She is a member of the lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group,” and they provide support for each other. The members of the group have also known each other for a long time.

Georgina is asking for a loan of US $800 to enable her to buy an additional hand sewing machine and fill her store with cloths, materials, thread, needles, and tape measures.

loans.use: To buy an additional hand sewing machine and fill her store with cloths, materials, thread, needles and tape measures.

loans.name: Mapatano A Group

texts.en:
Bahati, age 27, lives with her parents and takes care of her 2 sons (ages 3 and 7). She has a retail business of selling cosmetics products. She began this business March 2006 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $280. She works from 11am to 6pm daily.

Bahati and her subgroup request a loan to expand their businesses. Bahati's fellow subgroup members have businesses in tailoring, quarry work, selling charcoal, and soft drinks.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: María Altagracia

texts.en:
Hardworking, positive and honest are just some of the countless qualities that María Altagracia, mother of three children, possesses.  The promising entrepreneur owns and operates a grocery store which she started six years ago.
María Altagracia says that her store is very profitable.  With the profits from her business, she supports her children’s studies and pays the rent for her house. 
María Altagracia hopes that her business can keep growing so she can improve her family’s living conditions. With her loan, she will buy a lot of products to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase goods to restock her grocery store

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto lives in a community that lacks industrial and commercial jobs. Due to these circumstances, he decided to become self-employed and thus not have to immigrate to the United States. He started selling clothes and other articles little by little. Soon he became known in his community and now sells blankets and clothing.

Rigoberto tells us that he has many pending blanket orders. This is the reason he is asking for a loan of $200 that he will pay back in 6 months. With this money, Rigoberto will be able to buy more merchandise in order to have a larger variety and fulfill his pending orders. With your help, Rigoberto and his family will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Rigoberto, vive en una comunidad en dónde no existen industrias u otras compañías para trabajar. Por falta de trabajo fue por la que decidió auto-emplearse y así no emigrar hacia Estados Unidos. Comenzó poco a poco a vender ropa y otros artículos. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido en su comunidad y actualmente vende colchas y ropa.

Rigoberto comenta que tiene varios pedidos de colchas pendientes. Y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rigoberto podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener variedad y surtir los pedidos que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda Rigoberto podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 36 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 7 and 15. Fausta owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en: Gulnaz A. was born in Multan, a city in Pakistan famous for its shrines. She has lived all her life in this city. Guianz was married seven years ago and is a mother of four: three daughters and one son. Two of her elder children attend school and the others are not of school age yet. Gulnaz’s husband has a mobile phones Sims dealership. His monthly income ranges between $175 and $200. Currently, they need a loan to expand this business further. Gulnaz has been joined in her loan group by few other women who are: Rukhsana P. requires her share of loan to expand her scarves business; Hanifa B. will invest her share in her family’s grocery store; Shahbaz S. sells oil; Sonia B. will buy a rickshaw and Zahida F. sells cloth.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro is a 53-year old farmer and has been married to his wife Juana for 24 years. They have six children between the ages of 14 and 24.

Teodoro has his own plot of land where he grows different kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, different types of peppers, lettuce etc. He sells all his produce in the Abasto Market in the capital city, so he has to transport the vegetables there every day.

He gets up very early to begin his daily activities. His children all help, and he also has a great deal of support from his wife.

As a result of all this hard work, he has managed to build his own house and to buy all the basic necessities for his home. He would now like a loan to buy items like fertilizer, insecticide, and tomato seed for his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Teodoro es un agricultor de 53 años de edad, está casado hace 24 años con Juana con quien tuvo 6 hijos. La edad de los mismos oscila entre los 14 y 24 años.

Teodoro tiene su propia chacra en donde cultiva todo tipo de hortalizas como:tomate, pepino, locote, lechuga, etc. Toda la producción la comercializa en el Mercado de Abasto de la ciudad capital, hasta donde debe transladarse todos los días con el fin de entregar sus productos.

Se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus actividades diarias. Todos sus hijos le ayudan en su labor y también cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa.

Gracias a su esfuerzo logró construir su casa propia y comprar todas las comodidades básicas para su hogar. En esta oportunidad necesita acceder a un préstamo para comprar insumos para su chacra como ser: abono, insecticidas,semillas para cultivar tomate.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide etc.

loans.name: Pamela Nansubuga `s Group

texts.en:
N. Pamela is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, a three-year-old and a 9-month-old.  She lives and works in Mpererwe, a neighborhood near the outskirts of Kampala.  She has a shop called Amoti’s Cosmetics where she sells hair relaxer, foundation, lipsticks, lotions, wigs and other beauty products.  She travels to downtown Kampala to get the products she sells in her shop and works seven days a week.  The weekends are her busiest time.  To get to work requires her to take two minibus taxis, and she finds transportation a challenge.
Although she had worked in cosmetics for a while, it was only after she got her first loan from MCDT in 2004 that she was encouraged to start her own business.  Since then, she has had six loans and reports that she has been able to develop her business solely because of the capital that they provide.  Currently, she rents the space that she is using and her goal is to buy a plot of land to build a business near her home.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian has owned a shop in Arusha since 2005. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children, ages 18, 24, 27, and 37. She also cares for one 23-year-old dependent. She works at her shop daily from 8:00am to 8:00pm and generates a profit of approximately $200 each month.

Lilian has taken out two previous loans from BRAC Tanzania. She paid them both back successfully and on time. With this loan, she hopes to buy more materials to help her expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her two group members, Frida and Grace. Frida owns a salon in Arusha, and Grace owns a butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa S. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Preak Talai Village in Kandal Province. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. Mrs. Soa S. is a pig breeder. Previously, she had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Soa S. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Gayratjon

texts.en:
E. Gayratjon is 26 years old. He is married with three children. Gayratjon raises and sells cattle. He purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Gayratjon has been in this business for 5 years. He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, generating a considerable, stable income for his large family. 

Gayratjon is planning to enlarge his stock by purchasing more small cattle. For this purpose he requests 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for the term of 12 months. Gayratjon has already taken one loan from IMON and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower with a positive credit history. You could become an important part of Gayratjon family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Mr. Pen Samuth's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen members of Chamka Tamao Village in Kampong Chhnang Province got together to form a group loan, which each will use for different purposes. Mr. Pen S. is the village bank president selected by the members. He is 37 years old and the father of three children, one of whom attends the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study, being just three and five years old. He is a motorbike taxi driver and pig breeder. Since his second business is doing well, he wants to expand it sois requesting a loan to buy two more pigs to breed. His wife, Mrs. Ti Back Theary, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household.

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs to breed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys K. T. is a hard-working businesswoman. She is 51 years old, and she is married with six children. For a living, she trades in fresh rice and sugar. To do so, she purchases her supply of rice and sugar from wholesale vendors in Tema (around the fishing harbor), and she later resells such goods to her customers.

She enjoys operating her business very much, but she says that commodity prices and transportation costs have gone up in recent months due to the current fuel crisis. As a result, her business has taken a hit because her working capital is inadequate to purchase appreciable quantities to sell. Therefore, she is now seeking a loan to inject additional capital into her business to enable her meet the demands of the marketplace. Specifically, she wants to use the loan proceeds to increase her stock of rice and sugar and to thereby increase her profits. In turn, Gladys hopes to accumulate more savings in order to pay for her children's education fees.

She is a member of the community group known as the Angel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: 11- Đông Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Loan Group 11 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in
Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.
Mrs. Trinh Thi Hue is the lead borrower of the group. She is 59 years old, married, and has three children: a 33 year old son who is a bus driver, a 30 years old daughter who works as a health advocate in the hospital and a 21 years old daughter who is studying business at Hanoi University.  
This is Mrs. Hue's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women("FPW"); one of her friends in Dong Thanh market, where she has a stall, recommended FPW to her.  Prior to discovering FPW, Mrs Hue's cost of borrowing was more than twice that charged by FPW. 
Mrs. Hue will use the proceeds from this loan to buy kitchenware for her stall where she sells pots, pans, scissors, teapots, mops, thermos flasks, rice cookers, washing up liquid, chopsticks, etc. Along with the pension she receives from the government (as a former government employee), she will use the profits from this loan to pay for her 21 years daughter's board and lodging in Hanoi, as well as her university fees.
The loan will be split equally between all six borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:
* Mrs. Trinh Thi Hue is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$93) to buy kitchenware such as pots, pans, scissors, teapots, mops,thermos flasks, rice cookers, washing up liquid and chopsticks for her market stall.
* Mrs. Ngoc is borrowing money to buy clothes for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lien is borrowing money to buy sugar, salt, towels, candies, biscuits, breads, etc. for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lam Thi Hue is borrowing money to buy bowls, dishes and spoons for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Loi is borrowing money to buy blankets, pillows and sedge mats for resale in Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Lanh is borrowing money to buy bread for resale on the street in the early morning.
texts.en:
Note: original loan description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bowls, dishes, blankets, pillows, clothes...

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Greetings from Clarisse I. in Gatsata Sector, Gasabo District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Clarisse is 22 and the mother of 1 child. She has one orphan to raise as well.

She started her business two years ago. She has a spare parts shop with capital of 1,000,000 RWF at Gatsata Sector where she has many customers. She wants to increase her working capital and she now understands how good it is to work with microinance like Vision Finance Company s.a. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwf with a loan period of 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a clothes seller in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She belongs to the Furaha loan group  (group code 2014).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. Every day she works at her business from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Halima is 33 years old, married, and has two children: ages 12 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
H. Marie est née vers 1955 à Abomey. Marie vit à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Marie est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants. Marie est une vendeuse de «monyo», pâte local à base de maïs, accompagnée de sauce de tomate. Cette activité que Marie mène avec  beaucoup de passion lui procure de revenus qui lui permettent de faire face à ses besoins et à ceux sa famille. Pour renforcer le niveau de son activité économique Marie exprime un besoin de crédit.  
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Marie was born around 1955 in Abomey. She lives in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Bénin, and is the married mother of three children. Marie sells "monyo", a local mash made from corn and accompanied by tomato sauce. This work that Maria performs with passion brings her the revenue enabling her to address her needs and those of her family. To bolster her level of commerce, she is expressing a need for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and condiments: tomatoes, chili peppers, fish, meat, onions, spices, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and married with six children. She is a tailor and she also sells sarongs and laces. She has been in this business for a long time.

Victoria hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purcahse more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Annete

texts.en:
Annette P. operates a small piggery business. She started her business last 2004. Currently, she has 3 pigs and a sow, which she raises at the back of her house. She used to be a vegetable vendor but stop selling vegetables because of low sales. "Having a piggery is much better business", she said. "Meat is constantly in-demand in the market and expensive. I have been raising pigs for 5 years already", she added.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets. The loan will help considerably with increasing the size of her business and meeting family needs..

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI provides loans, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Hương Lê Thị (634040440) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children. Hương owns and operates a general store in the local community, primarily selling both food and daily use products. Hương has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Hương joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Hương is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. Hương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Eufracia J. is a sari-sari store owner. She is 65 years old and has only one child. In addition to selling a variety of goods to her neighbors, she has been raising pigs to supplement her income. Her store opened in 2004. Now she wants to make it grow and prosper.

Eufracia would like a loan of 21,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for the sari-sari store. The loan will help her expand her business and sell more goods.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia P. is from the village of Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is 45 years old, married, and has five school-aged and adult children. Ofelia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ofelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol S., 47 years old, owns a small shop in the local Pursat Market where she sells food for people who come to buy things in the market. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. She was married, but divorced her husband when her three kids were very young. Although she is now a single woman, she is a fantastic mother who has tried to send all her children to attain the highest of education. One of her children has graduated from the university and is working as an internal staff for a micro finance institution. The other two are still studying. Pol S. will be using this Kiva loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for her cooking foods.

loans.name: Tejuosho

texts.en: Tejuosho is 48 years old and married with four children. He sells welding gas. He hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more welding gas to sell. He says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more welding gas to sell

loans.name: Cagrielo Group

texts.en:
Frola is a member of the Cagrilo borrower group,she is 27 years old woman.She is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 7 and 2 years.

 Frola started her own saloon business 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tsh.

This is Frola`s first loan from BRAC.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy commodities for her business.

With the profit she use from the use of this loan Frola hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Elizabeth is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 3200,000 from BRAC in order to expand her clothing business

loans.use: To buy more goods for her saloon business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. est parent bénéficiaire dans la zone de camberene depuis 1993.son activité principale est la vente de petit déjeuner.mais parallèlement elle évolue aussi dans la vente de savon en poudre.elle a une expérience de cinq ans dans son activité.elle sollicite un prêt de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour accroitre son fond de roulement et ainsi faire face a la forte demande.elle contribue beaucoup a l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. has been a client in the Camberene area since 1993. Primarily she sells breakfast, but at the same time she is evolving in the sale of powdered soap. She has five years of experience in her occupation. She is requesting a loan of fifty thousand (50,000) francs to increase her working capital and thus meet the high demand. She contributes much to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: small restaurant

loans.name: Inspiration Plus Group

texts.fr:
Inspiration Plus est une Banque Communautaire constituée de 32 membres dont Alphonsine est Présidente. Ces membres sont solidairement unis pour un même but, développer leurs activités à travers des crédits reçus de Kiva par l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Alphonsine est vendeuse des poissons, du miel ainsi que des galettes. Elle avait commencé son activité en 2002 avec un capital initial de $50. Après un dur travail et une bonne gestion, elle est parvenue à la faire prospérer grâce aussi aux bénéfices accumulés. Elle compte l'élargir avec le prochain prêt, en y ajoutant des pagnes et autres articles beaucoup recherchés dans son milieu. L'affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $75 par semaine. Alphonsine est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 2 et 4 ans. Un seul est scolarisé.
texts.en:
Inspiration Plus is a Community Bank made up of 32 members whose chairwoman is Alphonsine. These members are united for the same goal to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. Alphonsine sells fish, honey as well as cakes. She began her business in 2002 with an initial capital of $50.00. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. She intends to expand it with the next loan by adding pieces of fabrics and other much sought-after items in her environment. The business gives her a profit of $75.00 every week. Alphonsine is 42 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, whose ages vary between 2 and 4 years old. Only one is in school.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify the business by purchasing pieces of fabrics to retail with the intention of increasing profit.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice M. is from the village of Naga,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Alice is married and has  school-aged children. To make a living, Alice owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Alice is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alice from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 57 years old and lives in the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan, with his wife, Filomena. They are blessed with five children: Marierose, 25 years old, a college graduate presently working at Sowesfaco in their village; Emmanuel, 24 years old, a high school graduate; Dominador, 21 years old, a college student taking Information Technology; Julius, 18 years old, a college student taking an automotive course; C., 17 years old, also a college student taking Hotel Management.

Alfredo and Filomena are striving hard to earn income to satisfy their daily needs especially in providing for the education of their children. Alfredo works as a farmer and his crops are rice and vegetables, while his wife cooks different viands (tasty dishes) and snacks that she sells in their village.

Alfredo wants to borrow additional farming and vending capital of PHP 18,000 from Kiva lenders that he can use for the maintenance of their farming business. Their PHP 25,000 gross farming income every harvest season is not enough because of the high interest rate that traders put on their debts.

Alfredo is hoping that his loan request will be granted for it will not only assist his business but also the needs of his family. He is just hoping that, through wise farming management and patience, they will able to uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his farming business

loans.name: C2579 Dukore Group

texts.en:
M. Valens is 32 years old, single, and he is the president of group called DUKORE. He has been in business since 2006 with a small shop selling a variety of goods such foodstuffs and some drinks. This business is open from 6 AM to 8 PM every day. 

This group is requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses as well as make more profit, which, in turn will help them to buy their own houses and save for the future.

loans.use: A variety of foodstuffs and some drinks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Due to hardships and difficulties of life, Josephine and Melesio A. help each other earn a living for their survival and to give their daughter a better future. They live in a village of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya.	

Their main source of income is through farming. They plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Sfter planting her husband uses their tricycle to earn income while Josephine engages in selling the vegetables in their village and at the public market. The average income she earns for the month is about to 3,000 PHP which they use to acquire their daily needs and for their daughter's school. She is able to earn additional income if she sells more vegetables. Since her capital is not sufficient, she wants to borrow a 5,000 PHP loan from KIVA lenders which will be used in acquiring more fruits and vegetables to resell. She hopes that she will become successful in her journey as a businesswoman.

loans.use: additional capital in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dreu

texts.en: Mrs. Dreu D. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, is married, and is blessed with three school-aged children. Dreu owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling of variety of food products in the local community. She earns 3,000 PHP monthly from her business. In 2003, Dreu joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa S. sells provisions such as biscuits, canned tomatoes and so on at Broyinbima near Abura. Theresa has studied through senior high school.  She is single and has three children. Theresa has been selling provisions since 2000. She spends her income in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for the family. She is therefore saving towards the building of the family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
