Alba S. is from the village of Sinuza, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Alba is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alba owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Alba has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business.

In 2008, Alba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alba is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Alba from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phạm Thị's Group

texts.en:
Vụ Phạm Thị is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội. Vụ is the group leader of a six-member group with a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hội Phụ.


Vụ is married and has one grown child. To make a living, she operates a family member's business manufacturing and selling bamboo products in the community. Vụ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Vụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business. Vụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.180.000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND for the same purpose. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Vụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the Group:

1.  Chử Thị L. (10105030042) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

2.  Ngô Thị T. (10105030045) is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3.  Vũ Thị Quế (10105030044) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4.  Đỗ Thị H. (10105030052) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 

5.  Phạm Thị H. (10105030043) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine B. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Culipapa, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and fish vending. Her husband, Romy, is a fisherman and Josephine sells his catch in their community and in the nearby public market. They have two children who are 12 and 13 years old and are currently going to school. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in July, 2006, in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their income with her fishing and fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Josephine is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her fishing and fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for her 8th loan, for 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund the operations of her fishing and fish vending business. Josephine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma P. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, separated with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a retail business buying and selling coconuts in the local market. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie Ndiolé

texts.en: Marie Ndiolé D. is 30 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 3 1/2 years and has always paid back her loans on time. As her main activity, she sells groceries and various other products. With this loan, Madame D. will buy cereals and vegetables to bolster her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Leipu

texts.en:
Leipu F. is 44 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Leipu has 2 years of experience in this business.  Leipu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Leipu joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Leipu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Leipu F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Sofia Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Sofia A. H. vive en el Caserío de San Antonio,junto a sus dos  hijos de 10 y 23 años de edad. Es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son casados.  Tiene casa propia. Su hijo quien vive con ella la apoya con los gastos de la unidad familiar. Su casa actualmente está construida de caña,ya que después del terremoto no pudo concluir dicha construcción. Labora como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años en una empresa agrícola de la zona. Solicita financiamiento para continuar con la construcción  de su vivienda, y lograr su objetivo, que es poder tener una casa digna. Su sueño es poder construir su casa para sus hijos y ayudarlos en su educación. La Sra. Sofia A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Sofia A. H. lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio. She lives in her own house with two of her children, one of whom is 10 years old and the other 23. She is a single mother of five children; three of them are already married. The son who lives with her helps her with household expenses. Her current house is made of reeds since, after the earthquake, she wasn't able to finish the construction. For the last two years Sofia has been working a field laborer for a regional agricultural company. She is asking for a loan in order to continue the construction of her house. Her dream is to build a decent home for her children and to help them with their education. Sofia A. is grateful for the help we are able to provide.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth, 44, a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requested a loan of 6,000 Php as additional capital for her business in corn farming. She tills 1 hectare of corn field in Banga, South Cotabato and also owns 2 cows. She maintains the farm very well to have a plentiful harvest. 

She started corn farming in 1985. She now has 4 children; her eldest is 24 years old. With corn farming, she was able to provide the basic needs of her family. This loan will help a lot to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth for her patchwork business

loans.name: Deselyn

texts.en:
Deselyn R. is from the village of Zamora, Aloran.  She is 42 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Deselyn owns and operates a dried fish buying and selling business in the local community. Deselyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Deselyn joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deselyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Deselyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Hoeun L., age 59, is a widower with two sons and four daughters. He is a construction worker. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Hoeun was not in the photo, but his son is presented. 

His family does not have a proper restroom to use and they must often ask for their relatives for the use of their facilities. It is difficult for them, so Hoeun decided to request a loan in the amount of $600 to build his own restroom.

loans.use: To build a restroom for the family's use.

loans.name: Eloïse

texts.fr: A. Eloïse est née en 1955 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Eloïse vit depuis 35 ans au quartier Filla à Porto-Novo. Eloïse est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est encore à sa charge. Eloïse est une veuve, qui vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule les charges de la maison. Depuis trente cinq ans, Eloïse mène comme activité la vente de crevettes fumés et de crabes à son domicile. Eloïse achète ses produits au bord du fleuve à Porto-Novo. C’est la première fois que Eloïse sollicite un concours financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son capital et d’élever le niveau de son activité. Eloïse ambitionne plus tard acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Eloïse was born in 1955 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Eloïse has lived in the Filla neighborhood of Porto-Novo for 35 years. She is the mother of five children, all of whom have been enrolled in school, and one of whom is still in her care. Eloïse is a widow who lives alone with the child she is raising and is the sole breadwinner for the family. For 35 years, she has been earning her living selling smoked shrimp and crabs out of her home. She buys her products along the river in Porto-Novo. This is the first time that Eloïse has requested a loan from ALIDé, intending to bolster her working capital and expand her business. Eloïse's ambition is to be able to buy her own plot of land, later on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of baskets of shrimp

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. OU. K. is 38 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members that are located in Preak Thmei village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.

Mrs. OU. K. is a flower seller in the local market while her husband, Mr. Tum Tuy, is a construction foreman who is able to earn a small profit to help support his family's living expenses. In order to support the flower business, Mrs. OU. K. will use the loan that she has requested from AMK to buy more flowers to sell. This couple has four children: two are attending the local school and the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more flowers.

loans.name: Merly Pasok Group

texts.en: Merly P. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old and is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Merly P. Group. Merly is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Merly is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more stationery materials

loans.name: Merlinda Verano Group

texts.en: Merlinda V. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Merlinda V. Group. Merlinda is widowed and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery A. sells 'kenkey' and charcoal at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Mery has been in this business for eight years. Her husband is a security man. Mery uses her income to help her husband in feeding, clothing and sheltering her family. Mery will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) for distribution. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mery plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana  Julia R. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Diriangén del mismo municipio  donde tiene 12 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría ladrillos, cemento, arena y zinc.
texts.en: Ana Julia R. is from the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality.  She works as a primary school teacher at the area’s Diriangén school, where she has been for 12 years.  This is the first loan she requests through Ceprodel.  Her goal is to make improvements to her home, and she would use the funds to buy bricks, cement, sand and zinc.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, cement, sand and zinc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Edna is married and has three children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, shampoo,soap & toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Edna is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a business of selling Maandazi (dumplings - Kenya Doughnuts) and peas. She sells her items at the market and from home to her neighbours. Mwanakombo faces a challenge of competition from other food vendors in the market. She hopes to expand and get more clients to increase her income in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sack of sugar, a sack of peas, one litre of cooking fat and a bundle of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, a sack of peas, one litre of cooking fat and a bundle of wheat flour.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana P., age 46, earns her living by making and selling food. She prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. She and her husband have five school-aged children and live in the village of Brgy. Balete, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya.

Earlier this year, Juliana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her cooked food items for sale. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her cooked food items to offer for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school while two are too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a vegetable stall, selling sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and coconuts. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and price fluctuation in her business. Lydia hopes to have a big grocery store in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, 3 crates of tomatoes and 50 coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to get financial services to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, 3 crates of tomatoes and 50 coconuts.

loans.name: Hosea  Kamau

texts.en:
Hosea Kamau N. is 26 years old and married to Anne Wangechi, who helps him operate his business. They have two school-going children, ages four and one. Their residential place is in Lodwar, Kenya. He sells clothes and has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly profit of  15,000 KES.


Hosea learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy more clothes. The anticipated profits he plans to use to expand the boutique business.


In the future, Hosea wishes to have a large boutique in Lodwar town. His deeper desire is to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aminadabu

texts.en:
Aminadabu sells rice, salt, and other foodstuffs. He is 30 years old, married and has three children who are between three and ten years old. His wife works together with him in the same business. 

Aminadabu has been selling rice, salt, and other foodstuffs for 4 years. His loan will be used to buy more items to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest. He would like to have a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Ama has been selling roasted plantain in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a driver. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's education, including school fees, uniforms, books and other learning materials.

Ama will use this loan to purchase larger quantities of plantain in order to increase her sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to guarantee her children the opportunity to enjoy a good education. She will also reinvest some of the money back into her business and repay the loan she received.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of plantain

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married lady with two children.  For twenty years, she has been operating a food stall so as to earn a living.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  

Naomi is a God-fearing lady who believes in hard work.  Hence she puts a lot of effort in her business.  She is a member of Githunguri Neema group in Faulu Kenya.  In the group, she is able to save her money on weekly basis.  The members of the group also guarantee each other's loan.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy carrots, potatoes and farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy carrots, potatoes and farm inputs

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tup, a small village in the Isykul region. She is 25 and married to a builder. Together they are bringing up a son and a daughter, both of preschool age.

In order to earn additional money to meet their family needs, Ainura breeds livestock and sells milk products, earning an additional 1,000 KGS per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase sheep to resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, Ainura wants to increase her number of livestock and enlarge a shed to keep more farm animals. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 35 years old, and she has two children who are 13 years old (twins). Both of her children go to school and her husband sells a variety of goods. Chantal sells second hand clothes and she has done this business for 15 years. Chantal is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes, and she plans to pay school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Marivel  Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Marivel es una persona bastante trabajadora tiene dos hijas que están estudiando en el colegio,  el esposo es pastelero en la zona sur su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y después toda la familia ayuda a elaborar la masa a partir de las 5 de la tarde todos los días para despachar por la mañana a todas las tiendas  de  las zonas aledañas, ella realiza pasteles, panes, galletas. El crédito que solicito es para ampliar las instalaciones de su casa  comprara calaminas  estuco y material de construcción. Ellos viven la zona de villa salome  que es una zona que queda cerca de las oficinas es una persona muy responsable que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marivel is a very hardworking person who has 2 daughters who are in school.  Her husband is a neighborhood baker; he works from 7am until 4pm, and after that the whole family helps to make the dough from 5 in the afternoon each day.  They deliver their products each morning to all of the stores in the surrounding area.  Marivel makes cakes, bread and cookies.  She requests a loan to expand the working area in her home; she will buy sheets of corrugated metal, stucco and other construction materials.  Marivel's family lives in the Villa Salome neighborhood, an area that is very close to the Emprender offices.  She is a very responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing and other construction materials

loans.name: Kroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroeurn was born in 1957 and she is married Mr. Touch. They have three children, one of whom is a driver who gets a low salary, another one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the third is studying in the local public school. 

She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the rice and use the rest for their family. Her husband is a duck breeder. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Kroeurn is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora L. tiene 58 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa. Tiene más de 12 años en este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos que diariamente tiene en su hogar. La mayoría de sus clientes son personas jóvenes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos.  Ella siempre sale a vender sus productos pues tiene que realizar ciertos recorridos muy extensos ya que la mayoría de sus clientes les gusta que Teodora los visite. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y ropa para niños.
texts.en: Teodora L. is 58 years old.  Her business is buying and selling clothes.  She has been in this line of work for more than 12 years.  She started her business because she needed to cover her daily household expenses.  Most of her customers are young people who ask her for a wide variety of products.  She is always going out to sell her products.  She has to cover some very lengthy routes as most of her customers like her to visit them.  Teodora would like this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and children's clothes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  Diène est âgée  de 61 ans. Elle habite dans le village de Yoff  depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active depuis plus de 40 ans dans le commerce d’habits de friperie. Auparavant elle travaillait comme  femme de ménage. Mais par la suite elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion. Elle est très intéressée  par la satisfaction qu’elle procure à sa clientèle  et la réalisation de bénéfices  a travers son activité. Madame Diène est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de friperie. Elle  souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement et élargir son activité. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou  Diène, 61, has lived in the village of Yoff for a good number of years. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been working for more than 40 years selling second-hand clothing. Before that she worked as a maid, but she especially chose the work in sales  because she likes to see how she can satisfy her clientele and know that she is earning money from her work.  

Mrs. Diène has been a member of the Yoff branch since November 2003. She has already reimbursed seven prior loans. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs intended to buy used clothing. She hopes to grow her working capital and expand her business. The profit she makes will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish. She is 46 years old, married, and with two children. One of the children goes to school. Rose is borrowing a loan to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet, de 32 años; reside en el barrio San Antonio de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Hugo, con quien convive desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos Jony y Yamerin, a los que cuidan con amor y dedicación. Como buena mujer del campo, ella se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de café y plátanos, que son sembrados en sus propios terrenos agrícolas que  constan de una hectárea de terreno cultivable. Como no tiene mucho capital para invertir en sus cultivos, ella siempre trabajó con su banco comunal, “soy una de las fundadoras”, afirma con mucho orgullo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder vender sus cosechas a los acopiadores que visitan la localidad, “no tengo que trasportar mis mercadería”, menciona. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como peón en diferentes terrenos agrícolas, ganando un dinero extra para el hogar. Ahora Yanet, incursionó en la elaboración de viveros de café, donde gana S/.400 nuevos soles por cada millar que realiza, también trabaja en sus tiempos libres elaborando cajones de madera para guardar las frutas que producen. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del futuro”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Yanet, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias plantitas de café y bolsas para la elaboración de los viveros.
texts.en: Yanet, 32 years old, resides in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the Puente Paucartambo area (central jungle). There, she started her family with Hugo, with whom she has lived for twelve years. They have two children, Jony and Yamerin, who they care for with love and dedication. Like a good country woman, she is dedicated to farming. Her main crops are coffee and bananas, which are sown in her own agricultural lands, made up of one hectare of arable land. Since she doesn't have much capital to invest in her crops, she always worked with her community bank. "I am one of the founders", she affirms with a lot of pride. What she likes most about her work is to be able to sell her crops to the gatherers who visit her area. She mentions, "I don't have to transport my merchandise." Additionally, she receives the support of her husband who works as farm laborer in different farming lands, earning extra money for the home. Now, Yanet ventured into the production of coffee nurseries, where she earns S.400 for each thousand grown. She also works in her free time making wooden drawers to hold the fruit they produce. She belongs to the "Luz del future" (Future light) community bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP, where she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. On the other hand, she promises to again make her payments on time, as she did with previous loans. Additionally, she is thankful to be a part of her community bank because all of its members are responsible and very unified people . Yanet will invest the requested money in the purchase of several coffee seedlings and bags for the development of the nurseries.

loans.use: to buy several coffee seedlings and bags.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a young woman and a mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband Sameh, who is photographed in the bookshop as she is a conservative woman, has a bookshop and wanted to add an accessories section besides the books and stationery he sells, as in the picture.

Riham took out a loan from FATEN to cover the price of the accessories her husband bought which will improve their financial situation as, due to the financial hardship in Palestine, book-selling income does not cover household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase stationery and accessories to sell with the books.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Blanca Asucena tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, y junto a su esposo y tres hijos reside en la Colonia Cofradia.  Ella es una persona muy luchadora que desde muy joven inició a ganarse la vida trabajando arduamente. Desde hace 10 años en una parte de su casa tiene una pequeña pulperia donde vende todo tipo de comestibles, la atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Su principal ventaja es que no tiene competencia pero sus clientes son pocos ya que reside en las afueras de la ciudad. Con el prestamo solicitado podrá surtir su negocio de mas y variados productos, asi su negocio seguirá manteniendose de pie, y algun dia podra cumplir su sueño de adquirir una vivienda, y lo mas importante seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio. Su compañera de grupo Dulce Patricia se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y realiza las ventas de forma ambulante por todo el casco urbano de la ciudad y sus alrededores. Ambas socias son muy puntuales en sus pagos, tienen 6 ciclos de trabajar con prestamos en FAMA y se sienten muy agradecidas con la institucion por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Blanca Asucena, age 39, is married.  She lives with her husband and their three children in the Cofradia neighborhood.  She is a very tenacious person.  When she was very young she started earning a living by working arduously.  For ten years she has been selling all types of groceries in a small grocery store she has in part of her house.  She tends the store from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Her greatest advantage is that she does not have competition.  However, she has few customers because she lives in the outskirts of the city.

With the requested loan she will be able to stock her business with more groceries and varied products.  That way her business will continue to stay afloat.  One day she will be able to fulfill her dream of getting a house.  The most important thing is to continue supporting her children’s education.

Her colleague in the group, Dulce Patricia, sells second hand clothes.  She does this in an itinerant manner in the urban area of the city and its outskirts.

Both members are very punctual with their payments.  They have worked with loans with FAMA for six cycles.  They are very grateful to the institution for the support they have received.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, 42, is married with three children, aged 23, 21 and one year. Both Letecia and her husband are farmers. She engaged in rice farming 23 years ago. Now, she and her husband own and till a land in their town, Surallah, South Cotabato. They currently need financing for the farm so Letecia applied for a loan from CEVI. Letecia is planning to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Letecia hopes to have a stable business and for her children to succeed in their chosen fields.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, administra un taller de estructuras metálicas y también venta de chatarra, vive con su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad, su casa es familiar y el negocio lo tiene desde hace muchos años, heredado por su padre, consiste en el taller y compra y venta de chatarra.
Actualmente necesita un financiamiento para la compra de chatarra que le están ofreciendo, también necesita materiales para el taller como hierro y pintura, con esta inversión está fortaleciendo el negocio y tendrá todo lo necesario para continuar ejerciendo los trabajos.
Su objetivo es, crecer en el taller y poder capacitarse más en la ejecución del trabajo que los clientes le solicitan, con el fin de tener buenas recomendaciones que le permitan aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Juan manages a workshop of metal structures and also sells scrap metal.  He lives with his wife and his 15-year old daughter.  He has run this business for many years after inheriting it from his father, who also bought and sold scrap metal.  Juan now seeks this credit to buy additional metal inventory, as well as materials and paint for the workshop.  These purchases will greatly strengthen his business, allowing him to expand his metal-working projects and grow his clientele by taking custom orders.

loans.use: to buy metal, materials and paint for his workshop

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the teachers of the BDEC Home Economics Centre in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 10,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial needs. Founded in 1980 by the government of Sierra Leone, this centre helps the girl-child to achieve basic cooking and household maintenance skills. 

Helen (pictured at the left) is the leader of this group of teachers. With 26 years of experience in the teaching profession, this 52-year-old is a widow with 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in college. Helen has requested a loan of 1,000,000 SLL in order to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay  for her children’s school fees

loans.name: Sharapat's Group

texts.en:
Sharapat is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married. Together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised two daughters and two sons. All the children are married and live separately with their families.

In order to earn money to meet daily needs, Sharapat breeds livestock and then resells them after fattening. In this way she contributes 3000 soms to the family budget. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock and with the profits gained from trading she wants to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Morropón que pertenece al deparatamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 4 años Marcelina se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas) y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa de sus padres para su seguridad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de adquirir arroz en cáscara para comercializarlo, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones diarias. Marcelina es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por tener un negocio más grande e incursionar en otro negocio para brindarle más comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
47 year old Marcelina lives with her husband and so in their own house, which has water and electrical service. The house is in the district of Morropón, which is in the department of Piura. This area is characterized by its agricultural and livestock activity.
For 4 years, Marcelina has been selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, sodas) and drinks. She runs her business from her parents house because it is secure and she can work at the times she wants to. She trys to use the profits from her sales to cover all her expenses and essentials for the home.
She is requesting a $750 loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her store and to add a particular type of rice to her stocks with the only goal of growing her business and having more products to offer her customers. Marcelina is a responsible and dedicated person who cares about having a bigger business and moving into another business to offer more comforts to her family.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Corazon is very happy selling fish. She walks around their community and shouts fish: "isda." Her fish are inside her pail. Selling fish is her major source of income for the family. She earns PHP 2,400. She has been in this business for five years. Corazon has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Corazon has been a member of GDMPC for about one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her fish business to pay for their daily expenses and hopes to have own stall in the market (so that she does need to walk around selling fish).

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ghislaine Armeline

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 5 et 10 ans.En 2000 elle finit ses etudes universitaires n'ayant pas pu trouver du travail, elle se lance dans la vente des tissus au marche;
Ayant deja beneficie de plusieurs cycle de pret, cette fois au 4 eme cycle tres satisfaite ,elle reconnait avoir rembourser avec succes et fait des epargnes considerables, ses ventes sont de 10000 frs a 200000 frs, surtout  durant la saison seche,la saison de mariages et la periode scolaire, a la vente de metrages pour confectionner les tenues scolaires.
Avec ce nouveau pret , elle a approvisonne son stock des metrages, de la popeline bleu, rose, vert de toutes colories pour les tenues scolaires.
Tres entreprenante , elle pense a l'avenir ouvrir un magasin de tissus de luxe et aller a l'etranger pour s'approvisionner.
texts.en:
Ghislaine Armeline is 38 years old, single and has two children, aged 5 and 10, in her care. She finished her university studies in 2000 and started selling fabrics at the market when she was unable to find another job. She has already benefited from several loans and is now on her 4th loan cycle. She has fully repaid all her previous loans and has even managed to save a considerable amount of money. She generally earns between 10 000 and 200 000 francs and does the most business during the dry season and the marriage season, as well as during the school year, when she sells many lengths of material used to make school uniforms.

Ghislaine Armeline will use this new loan to restock on different fabrics, including poplin of different colours (blue, pink, green, etc.) with which to make school uniforms. A very enterprising woman, she plans to one day own her own luxury fabrics shop and to travel abroad to restock on fine materials.

loans.use: to restock on fabrics including silk, cotton, satin, cotton piqué, linen and terylene.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda de 53 años de edad. Vive en su casa propia con sus familiares, cuentan con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en su domicilio, por tener más seguridad, donde ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades de su casa.

Rosenda se a dado cuenta que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente en el transcurso de los días. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como productos de consumo diario y abarrotes en general para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes.  Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Rosenda es muy trabajadora y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para tener más comodidades y tener mejoras económicas en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 53 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. They have only electricity. The house is located in the rural part of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura. The people of this area dedicate themselves to agriculture, ranching, and handcrafts.

For several years, she has had her own business located in her home, in order to have more security, where she offers her clients all staple items and groceries. She has an established clientele, and with the income that she may earn, she will cover her household needs. 

Rosenda has realized that her business is growing favorably as time passes. She wants to continue adding to her business with the purchase of more merchandise, such as everyday products and groceries in general, in order to satisfy the needs of her customers. For that, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Rosenda is very hard-working and responsible. She wants to achieve greater income to have more comforts and economic improvement in her life.

loans.use: to purchase more everyday products and groceries in general to satisfy the needs of her customers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 53 year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 28 years. She describes herself as being determined and social. She operates a farm where she produces vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. Her primary customers are institutions. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of farming activities and fluctuating prices for inputs. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to pay school fees for her dear children. Her business goal is to grow her business by developing a fish pond within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a fish pond and an orchard.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, esto porque necesita comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio, la compra será en stiker, pulseras, juguetes, collares, para los jóvenes. José ha logrado a través de los préstamos, mejorar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.
Hasta el momento no tiene ningún inconveniente en cuanto al manejo de los préstamos, espera que de igual manera este nuevo préstamo le sirva para mejorar.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan because he needs to buy merchandise with which to stock his business.  He will buy stickers, bracelets, games and necklaces for young people.  Through loans, José has managed to improve his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

Up to now, José has not experienced any problems in managing his loans.  He hopes that this new loan will also help him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (stickers, bracelets, games, necklaces)

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica. Vive con Roy y sus tres hijos de 11, 8 y 3 años de edad, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Enith es la venta de comida como estofados, asados, y menús, para lo cual cuenta con un puesto de venta que instaló en el frontis del Colegio cerca de su casa. Ahi atiende a sus clientes que en su mayoría son estudiantes, docentes y  transeúntes. Tiene dos años realizando esta actividad, tiempo que le valió para ser conocida en la zona. Lo  que le gusta de su trabajo, es el contar con un ingreso económico, gracias a ello apoya a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que es trabajador en la madera y realiza viajes por temporadas de hasta 30 días. Sus planes es abrir un restaurante en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP,  se siente contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, como en prestamos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, como arroz, aceites, menestras y demás, buscando menores para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Enith is 28 years old and is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives with Roy and her 3 children, aged 11, 8 and 3 years, in her own house. Enith sells food such as stews, roasts and fixed menus from a food stall she has located in front of the school near her house. She serves her customers there, the majority of which are students, teachers and passersby. She has been doing this for 2 years and is now well-known in the area. What she likes about her work is being able to count on an income, thanks to which she helps her partner with the household expenses, as he works in the wood industry and is often away from home for periods of upto 30 days. She plans to open a restaurant in her own home. This will be her 3rd loan with MFP. She is happy to have financial support to move her business forwards, which is why she agrees to be punctual with her repayments, as with her previous loans. With the amount requested, she will buy the ingredients needed to prepare the food such as rice, oil, beans and the like, looking to buy retail to make bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and beans.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Давлат имеет высшее образование. По профессии он преподаватель. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кроме этой работы он занимается торговлей. Он у себя дома открыл магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Davlat has a higher education.  He is a teacher and has been working in this field for 15 years.  Besides this work, he is involved in sales.  Davlat opened a store with a mixed assortment of goods at home.  He has been involved in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Olga Leonor

texts.es: Olga de 22 años y madre de un niño de 13 meses es la propietaria de un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de fotocopiaje, impresiones, transcripciones y laminación ubicado en el lugar donde habita. Su idea emprendedora nació después de recibir su liquidación de la empresa de donde ella era empleada y tradujo está en la inversión de su fotocopiadora y gradualmente agregó más de estas y equipos que compró a crédito y que con las utilidades producidas por su negocio logró terminar de pagar.  Su sueño de crecimiento está siempre latente y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues quiere invertir en una época en la que se augura un alto movimiento comercial., como lo es el final del año, debido a las fiestas navideñas y de cierre del año. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que recibe de la fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará 2 computadores para adicionar el servicio de internet que es muy solicitado y ella desea integrar a un mercado joven que lo amerita y con ello hacer del esta inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Olga is 22 years old and the mother of a 13 month old son.  She has a business where she provides photocopy services, printing, transcriptions, and laminations.  It’s located in her home.  Her entrepreneurial idea came to her when she received her severance from the company she used to work for.  She began with a single photocopier, and gradually added more of these and other equipment that she bought on credit and was able to pay off with the profits from her business.

Her dream to grow is always present and for this reason she is asking for a Kiva loan.  She wants to invest during a season where there is lots of business, like year’s end, because of Christmas and new year.

She will use the money from this Kiva loan, her first one through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy computers to add internet service, which is often requested.  She wants to enter a younger market and in this way make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy computers to add internet service to her photocopy business

loans.name: Yuliza

texts.es: Yuliza, una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad, convive con Yoni de 36 años, junto ellos viven en casa alquilada junto a sus 02 hijos Mirne de 07 años y Araceli  de 05 años, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Hace 04 años, Yuliza, se dedica al negocio de abarrotes, desde muy temprano empieza su labor de madre para enviar a sus hijas a la escuela y luego ir abrir su puesto de ventas donde los productos de abarrotes lo puedes encontrar a un precio económico. Yuliza es una mujer a quien  le gusta el trabajo que realiza, ella dice que es rentable, pero a veces cuando se le agotan los productos le hacen falta para poder vender a sus clientes. Pero aun así Yuliza, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar los productos de abarrotes que le hacen falta y así no quedar mal ante sus clientes. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP por lo que se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pagos. Además se siente asegurada con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda muchos beneficios. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, piensa invertir en la compra de productos como: sacos de azúcar, fideos, conservas, verduras, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Yuliza, a hardworking, 25-year-old woman who lives with 36-year-old Yoni. They live together in a rented house along with their two children, 7-year-old Mirne and 5-year-old Araceli, who are their motive for working. For 4 years, Yuliza has been working in the grocery business. She began working as a mother very early so that she could send her daughters to school, and later so that she could open her place of business, where you can find groceries for good prices. 

Yuliza is a woman who likes the job she does. She says it is profitable, but sometimes she runs out of products to be able to sell to her clients. However, with the requested loan, Yuliza will soon be able to buy the groceries she has run out of and will not be embarrassed in front of her clients. 

This will be her third loan with MFP and because of that she promises to continue paying her loans. On top of that, she feels secure with her communal bank, which has already given her many benefits. She is thinking of putting the requested 1,500 nuevo soles towards the purchase of products like sacks of sugar, noodles, preserves, vegetables, and other goods.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, preserves, vegetables.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает в Гиссарском районе. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж водитель. Сама она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Fotima lives in the Gissar region. She is married. She is 43 years old and has five children. Her husband is a driver. She breeds cattle for further resale. She has been in this business for ten years. Fotima is taking out the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle and repair the cowshed.

loans.name: Norce Group

texts.en:
Norce is 40 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin. She is married with three children. Norce has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for two years. Norce requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Norce has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Norce is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El municipio donde se conformó el grupo es conocido por los habitantes como “La novia del sol”; en primavera la temperatura rebasa los 40°C. Los integrantes de la asociación eligieron el nombre por ser el producto naturista que la mayoría de ellos consume y vende. Las demás actividades económicas de ellos son: Santa vende abarrotes y comida; Alicia, Norberto, Anayeli y Ciro, productos naturistas; Alejandra, cosméticos; Primo, material para construcción y productos naturistas; Maribel, comida y servicio de estética; María, carne y Hugo, bisutería.
Doña Santa  tiene 58 años, es una gran mujer, está casada con el señor Jorge  con quien procreó 5 hijos, todos ellos hoy en día mayores de edad. Desde hace 20 años, la pareja formó un gran equipo de trabajo y juntos manejan un negocio de comida que se encuentra ubicado afuera de una de las iglesias de la colonia. Al principio Jorge únicamente ayudaba a acarrear las cosas en un triciclo o carretilla, pero actualmente recorre las calles de “La novia del sol” a bordo del triciclo ofreciendo el delicioso atole de coco natural, tamales huecos, de elote, bollitos y tortas; mientras ella se encarga de atender gustosamente a sus clientes en la pequeña tienda de abarrotes que lograron abrir con las ganancias obtenidas.
Como ya es costumbre, todos los fines de semana Santa coloca dos  mesas para exhibir una gran variedad de dulces, tortas, tacos, tamales, una nevera donde guarda refrescos, jugos y en un contenedor, agua de Jamaica y horchata para consentir a sus clientes. “El secreto del éxito está en cómo nos desempeñamos y tratamos a nuestros clientes” comentan entusiasmados. Su trabajo les ha permitido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, principalmente dar estudio a sus hijos. 
“De lunes a viernes estoy en la tienda, y los fines de semana en mi negocio de comida. Ambas labores me han permitido crecer económicamente” además agrega “Doy gracias por la oportunidad de un préstamo, pues con él podremos hacer crecer nuestras actividades y tener más éxito”.
El nuevo préstamo le ayudará a invertir huevos, chile, cebolla, jitomate, aceite, frijol, azúcar y dulces para continuar con sus actividades.
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo, la fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la señora Alicia, en el travesaño del columpio se pueden ver las cajas de Kyani, producto naturista. Doña Santa viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
The municipality where the Group is from is known to the locals as "The Bride of the Sun". In the spring the temperature can reach 40°C. The members of the group chose the name as a byproduct of the natural products they consume and sell. The other business activities of the members are:

Santa –grocery and food sales  

Alicia, Norberto, Anayeli, y Crio - selling natural products

Alejandra –Cosmetics sales

Primo – construction materials sales and natural product sales

Maribel – food sales and aesthetics

María – butcher shop 

Hugo - costume jewelry sales

Doña Santa  is 58-years old.  She is a great woman who is married to señor Jorge.  Together they had five children, who are now grown.  Twenty years ago, the pair formed a great work team.  Together they run a food business located outside one of the churches in their area.  At the beginning, Jorge alone helped Santa transport things with only a trike or a cart.  Now, he goes around the streets of "The Bride of the Sun" on a  trike offering the delicious "atole de coco (natural)" (coconut atole- a maize-based beverage),  tamales, corn, buns and cakes; meanwhile she happily takes care of the customers in their small grocery, which they were able to open with the profit they earned. 

As is now custom, every weekend Santa sets up two tables to exhibit a large variety of sweets, cakes, tacos and tamales.  They keep sodas and juices in a cooler, and in a liter container, they have horchata and hibiscus water, to spoil their customers.  "The secret to success," they enthusiastically say, "is in how we work and treat our customers."  Their work has allowed them to offer their family a better quality of life, primarily by giving their children an education.  

“From Monday to Friday I'm in the store.  Then, on the weekends, I have my food business.  Both jobs have allowed me to grow financially."  Santa adds, "I am thankful for the opportunity of the loan.  Because of it, we can grow our businesses and be more successful." 

The new loan will help to buy eggs, chilies, onions, tomatoes, cooking oil, beans, sugar and sweets so they can continue with their businesses. 

These are the members of the group. The photograph was taken in señora Alicia's yard.  On the crossbars of the swing one can see the boxes of Kyani, the natural product so many of the members sell. 

 In the photo, doña Santa is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, chilies, onions, tomatoes, cooking oil, beans, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Vasko

texts.en:
Vasko V. is a photographer. He is 32 years old and lives in Vratza. He graduated a professional photographic school and had worked in his father’s company for 8 years. His father is also a photographer.

Two years ago Vasko and his father separated their business and he found his own photographic studio. He managed to achieve good image and to win lots of customers.

Vasko V. needs a new professional camera and photographic materials and he applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: To buy a new professional camera and photographic materials

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She owns a shop selling different consumable items. She aims at increasing the stock of soft drinks.  Soft drinks have high turn-over in her shop. The demand of soft drinks in Dar es Salaam is high because of the weather -- it is hot throughout the year. The profit margin of soft drinks, mainly Coca-Cola, is high if a retailer buys more than 50 crates at a time. 

Amina had entrepreneurship and small business training from YOSEFO. She knows how to plan efficient stock levels.

The loan requested will enable Amina to purchase a profitable level of stock. She is asking for a loan of US$750.

loans.use: Add stock of cold drinks to her store.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small shop in the south of Kirkuk in a poor area. He has worked in this shop since 2001. Until now, he was not able to develop his small shop. This is his first loan, and he wants to use it to buy an icebox to sell ice cream during the summer.

He has a big family; he supports his mother, father, wife, and five children. He wants to enhance his family's standard of living. He wishes to succeed in his work and develop himself to be the owner of a larger mini-market in the future.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy a new icebox

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.es:
Brenda is a young entrepreneur with a strong will power. After her parents divorce she wanted to keep going to school but her mother's income alone was not enough to cover the costs - that is why she started working at a sewing factory when she was 20 years old. Soon she realized she could start her own sewing business, so she spent the money she had saved to purchase a sewing machine that was used to fulfill small orders. Thanks to the good quality of her products, demand for her merchandise increased considerably - she now has three employees helping her out.

Brenda asks for US$550.00 that will be used to buy an extra sewing machine that will increase production output; thus, covering customers' demands. She commits to paying back her loan within 6 months. You have the chance to become a vital part of this business growth. She thanks in advance the opportunity you can provide to expand her small-business.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice.

Brenda es una joven emprendedora, con grandes deseos de superación, después del divorcio de sus padres ella quería continuar estudiando pero su madre sola no podía cubrir todos los gastos, por esta razón ella empezó a trabajar en un taller de costura a sus 20 años, pronto se dio cuenta de que ella podría iniciar su propio negocio y con los ahorros que tenia compro una máquina de coser usada con la que inició a realizar algunos pequeños trabajos, gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora la demanda por sus servicios se ha incrementado considerablemente, por lo que ahora cuenta con la ayuda de tres empleados.

Para continuar creciendo ahora Brenda solicita $ 550 dólares que utilizará para comprar una máquina de coser con la que espera incrementar su producción para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser una parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Brenda, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para continuar creciendo como microempresaria.

loans.use: Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
Maria Veronica is 22 years old and recently married. She is dedicated to embroidering bedspreads, sashes, handkerchiefs, tablecloths and cushions. She sells her handicrafts to people from her community who then resell the items at tourist destinations. With the loan, she plans to purchase threads and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA VERONICA, tiene 22 años recién casada y se dedica a bordar cubrecamas, chales, fajas, servilletas, manteles, cojines. Sus clientes son personas de su misma localidad que comercializan después sus prendas a los lugares turísticos del Estado. Pertenece al grupo Fátima 5, con su préstamo invertirá comprando telares e hilos

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr:
Mr. Kouma A. is 22, single, and a carpenter by training. He does not have his own workshop and thus has to go to those of his carpenter colleagues in order to fulfill his customers’ orders. This is very difficult for him, and he is slowly losing customers. To stop this from happening, he is requesting financial assistance in the form of a loan of $1000 to satisfy his customers by opening his own workshop before they start turning elsewhere.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 22ans et célibataire, monsieur Kouma A. est menuisier de formation. Sans atelier, il est obligé d’aller auprès de ses collègues menuisiers avant d’exécuter certaines demande de sa clientèle ; ce qui lui est très gênant. Ainsi il est en train de perdre sa clientèle à petit coup et pour mettre fin à cela, il exprime un appui financier sous de crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps en ouvrant son propre atelier.

loans.use: Building of a carpentry workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase of more merchandise.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, age 50, is a widow with 6 children ages 35, 25, 18, 16, 15, and 12. She owns a business of selling clothes and beverages, which she began in 1989. From these sales, she makes a monthly profit of about $55. She works daily from 8am to 8pm.

Rehema has taken a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requests a new loan in order to buy more inventory of clothes and beverages.

loans.use: To buy clothing and beverage inventory

loans.name: Johanna Del Pilar

texts.es:
In the city of León, Nicaragua, Mrs. Johanna del Pilar V. works selling watches, cell phone accessories, and glasses. She began the business 10 years ago in her own home where she had only a table on which she put her merchandise (with the exception of cell phones, which were not as popular then as now). Her business has developed to such an extent that now Johanna has purchased a glass display case in which she exhibits her products for the general public.

One advantage for Mrs. V.’s business is that it is located on a very busy street that permits everyone who passes to see her products in the front window display. However, despite this location, Mrs. V. earns limited income from the business and at times she is unable to cover her household expenses. For this reason she has decided to request a loan from Ceprodel in order to improve her quality of life.

Currently, with a total of 8 previous loan repayments, Mrs. V. has been able to better stock her business and also make partial improvements to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de León, la señora Johanna del Pilar V. se dedica a la venta de relojes, accesorios para celulares y lentes. Su negocio nace hace 10 años en su hogar de habitación donde contaba solamente con una mesa donde ponía los productos a excepción de los celulares que para ese tiempo no tenían tanto auge como actualmente. Hoy en día a medida que ha venido desarrollándose en su negocio ha comprado una vitrina de vidrio donde exhibe sus productos al público en general.

Una ventaja que posee el negocio de la señora V. es que está ubicado en una calle muy transitada que permite que todo el que pase logre ver sus productos en su vitrina. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta situación, la señora V. percibe pocos ingresos económicos y en ocasiones no logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar por lo que decide recurrir a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para mejorar su condición de vida.

Hoy en día, con un total de 8 créditos ha logrado surtir mas su negocio y además ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su local de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita R. R. has a business cutting hair in the city of Morales, San Martin. She loves providing a service and being a productive member of her community. Although she has worked with her family for much of her life, she started her own business four years ago to gain some independence.

Rosita is 31 years old, divorced, and has a son. She enjoys her independence and is happy that she can care for her son and pay for his education.
