Her family is very supportive of her business, and Rosita looks forward to sending her son to a university so he can have more opportunities in life than she had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Rosita is requesting a loan of $700 to repay over 6 months. She would use the extra capital to buy new clippers and make repairs to her shop.

loans.use: She would use the extra capital to buy new clippers and make repairs to her shop.

loans.name: Paulina's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 28 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 4. Paulina has been a business and trading woman since 2008. Everyday, she works from 9.30am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Abra and Rose, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ndigwaki

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Ndigwaki M.. She is married and has 1 child aged 5. She has 1 more dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2004, Ndigwaki established her cosmetics business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of cosmetics in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn S. is 58 years old and has one child, two nieces, and one older brother. Her child is a vendor selling second-hand phones in Phnom Penh. They are depending on Mrs. Morn to provide for them. Morn is a widow and has been working as a teacher at a state school since 1979. After the full time class, she opens an extra class to her students to make additional income. On average she earns $1.60 of profit per day.

Mrs. Morn currently is requesting a loan from Kiva to help open a stand in a busy market for her son who is selling telephones in Phnom Penh. This will help him to earn more profits to support the family income. Mrs. Morn is pictured with her older brother.

loans.use: Set up a shop stand for her son.

loans.name: Basirat Ayinde

texts.en:
Basirat Ayinde O. sells garri from her house, She acquired this knowledge from her mother and has been in this business since 2000. She is 38-years-old, married and has four children. Basirat lives in sabo oniba, Lagos state.

Basirat Ayinde O. has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and is requesting this loan to buy more garri and plantain to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more garri and plantain for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia E. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria with her family. She learnt about the sale of women's fabrics from her mother. She started her own business in 1996. She is a LAPO client.

Patricia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1, 200 to buy more women's fabrics for sale. She says thank you to Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more female wrappers for sale

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mrs. Uth C. was born in 1968 and she now lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks food for her husband and children. Her husband, Sa Thavy, sells ice-cream in the local village. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand his customer base by selling products from door to door, but needs a motorbike to travel around. Thus, Mrs. Uth C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Uth C. has two children who both attend high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel S. está casado con la Sra. Gloria Mareco, son padres de 2 hijas; una de 12 y otra de 14 años respectivamente, ambas se encuentran cursando sus estudios secundarios.

El cliente era empleado de una herrería desde los 12 años de edad en donde aprendió el oficio de herrero, y con el ahorro de dicho trabajo formó su propia microempresa que consiste en una elastiquería y herrería y cabe mencionar que lleva 14 años en el rubro.

El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de un compresor de aire para su trabajo. Y tiene proyectado para el futuro vender repuestos para camiones, ya que cuenta con clientela bien formada y desea brindarles una mejor atención.

Para el país desea que se apoye más a la agricultura y a las industrias por que considera que son los motores principales de la economía.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel S. is married to Mrs. Gloria Mareco, and they are the parents of 2 daughters (ages 12 and 14). Both girls are attending high school. Angel was 12 years old when he began working for a blacksmith, and this is where he learned his craft and where he was able to begin saving money, with which he was able to start his own blacksmithing business. He has now been in business for 14 years. The loan he is now requesting will go to the purchase of an air compressor for his business. He plans that in the future he'll also sell spare truck parts, since he has many customers with trucks and his desire is to give them better service. His wish is also that his country will receive more support to agriculture and other industries, which he believes are the main drivers in the country's economy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a compressor

loans.name: Heom

texts.en: Mr. Heom S. lives in Trapaing Pong Village in Takeo Province. He is 66 years old and married with four children. Three of his children are employed in a garment factory worker and the youngest one attends the local school. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns $4 a day, which is a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Samrith Oeurn, is a farmer. Even though Mr. Heom S. and his wife both have jobs, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Heom S. would like a loan of $500 to buy a cow for breeding. His wife appears with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Modesto Noel

texts.es:
Su nombre es Modesto Noel R. tiene la edad de 60 años, su estado civil es casado, este señor tiene 6 hijos pero no están a su cargo ya todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su esposa no labora es ama de casa, sus  propósito son de mantener activo su negocio por lo difícil que se torna la situación en este país y con este negocio el podría ahorrar para poder mantenerse en un futuro, en sus deseos esta el obtener mejoras para su vivienda y proporcionarle a sus nietos la ayuda necesaria mientras el pueda seguir trabajando.



La actividad económica a la que Don Noel se dedica es a la sastrería el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 38 años, el inicia este negocio desde la edad de 12 años y por su propia cuenta decide ingresar a un taller donde adquiere el conocimiento de este oficio lo cual el lo transforma en un trabajo el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en león, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que el necesita realizar las compras de 150 yardas de tela de dril que se utiliza para la realización de los pantalones, compra de zziper, hilo y agujas para la maquina por lo que agradece a fundación León 2000 y otras organizaciones por mantener abierto su crédito.
texts.en:
Modesto Noel R. is 60 years old, and is married. He has 6 children but they don't live at home anymore and work to maintain themselves. His wife doesn't work, she is a housewife. Their purpose is to maintain active their business because of the difficulty of the changing situation in their country. With this business he can save to be able to maintain his family in the future. One of his wishes is to make improvements to his house, and to give his grandchildren the help necessary while he is able to continue working. The economic activity that Don Noel undertakes is a tailor shop. He has had this business for 38 years. He began the business at 12 years old, and for himself decided to enter a workshop where he would acquire the knowledge of this trade, which he would transform into a job. The business is located in his house in León. The finance is for capital for his work so he can buy 150 yards of material that he will use to make trousers, buy zippers, thread and needles for his machine. For this he gives thanks to Fundación León 2000 and other organisations for keeping open his credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with grown-up children. She owns a clothing sales business. Her gross monthly income is 8,000 UAH, and her investment in inventory is 40,000 UAH.

Valentina started her own business 5 years ago. Her friends got involved in this kind of business a few years earlier. She saw that their experience was positive and decided to try herself. The business grew little by little. Valentina found out she had great communication skills and financial aptitude that allowed her to develop her business. Now this business helps Valentina to be financially and socially independent.

Valentina would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She pays special attention to good quality in choosing her goods. Her clients respect her and often come back for new clothing. Valentina hopes that increased assortment will allow her to offer her customers a better choice and increase her sales.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oeun K., 53, is a widow with five children: two sons and three daughters. One of them was married and lives outside the family home, two daughters are silk weavers, one son is studying at University in Phnom Penh, and the youngest son is studying in the local school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-oeun has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to the middleman, who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. She wants to continue her weaving business and hopes that her children will have full-time employment after they finished their study. 

Sam-oeun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to pay school fee for her son who studies in University.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to pay school fee for her son.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Ce monsieur célibataire habite le quartier de kégué, il fait le commerce de friperie derrière le marché d’assiyéyé où il s’approvisionne, il fait ce commerce depuis 2005, le commerce de friperie est une activité qui marche bien à lomé. Il sollicite son premier crédit de wages pour acheter 05 balles de chemises. Il n’est pas marié mais avec ce qu’il gagne il aide les autres membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This unmarried gentleman lives in the Kégué district. He does commerce in used clothing behind the Assiyéyé marketplace, where he gets his inventory. Since 2005, this has been his work, which is a good business in Lomé. He is requesting his first WAGES loan to buy five bales of shirts. He is not married, but with what he earns, he helps the other members of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of shirts

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia, a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for nine years, belongs to Titanic loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250 working daily from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more clothes for her business, hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and her enterprise will grow.  

Zakia, 30 years old, is married and has three children: ages 8, 5 and 2.  She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Huong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương , 44 tuổi ở Mê Linh - Hà Nội. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1997 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn . Hiện nay ngoài nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng  2.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000 để mua thêm lợn và mua thức ăn phục vụ  chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Huong Thi N. is a 44 years old woman in Me Linh, Hanoi. She joined the TYM fund in 1997 and borrowed money to raise pigs. At the moment, besides the income from the livestock, salary of 2,000,000 VND per month of her husband also contributes to the family’s budget. The couple plan to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more pigs and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Lina has owned a grocery store for eleven years. She requested a loan of 2500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a new refrigerator for her store. Lina has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Lina is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and family members. When she first started her work, she didn’t have the startup capital. Lina decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a new refrigerator for her store.

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru: Бустон  Набиева 1961 года рождения, замужем имеет 1 ребенка. Высшего образования не имеет. После замужества долгое время сидела дома. Вскоре начала торговать мелочами на рынке находящейся не далеко от дома.Сейчас торгует пластиковыми пакетами на большом рынке. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2002 года. За это время улучшила своё  состояние. Она торгует на улице не смотря на холод и палящее солнце. Благодаря поддержки со стороны КИВА и Микроинвест она расширила свой оборот от розничных до оптового базара.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Buston N. is married and has 1 child. She does not have a higher education. After her she married, she spent a lot of time at home. Then, she started selling small things at a market not too far from her home. Now Buston sells plastic packages at a large market. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2002 and has been able to improve her state of being since then. Thanks to the support from Kiva and MicroInvest, Buston was able to increase her turnover from both retail and wholesale markets.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: selling clothing

loans.name: Asia Parveen Murad Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Asia parveen and I live in Borewala in Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. I own a two-room brick house where I have lived for the past ten years. My husband, M. A., has run a timber-selling business for three years. As inflation is increasing rapidly and it is difficult for one person to cover all the expenses, I help my husband with my own business sewing clothes.

I am applying for a loan to buy more timber to expand my husband’s timber-selling business. I am the leader of a group comprising three other women from my locality. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). K. baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes and taps) to sell. Noor Fatima baji wants a loan to buy a musical instrument (guitar) for her husband’s musical group.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: The members also operate a business of seasonal vegetable selling and in this picture they are showing their vegetables.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya S. is a widow and lives with her two children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

She has a small business in carpentry. She used to run the carpentry business on the plot of land of her neighbor. This year, with help of her two children, she moved the carpentry business to her own land after building a small shelter.

In addition to her carpentry business, she runs a small convenience store that sells a number of food items, including soft-drinks, chewing gums, biscuits, etc.

She keeps herself busy with her two businesses for most of the time. In the future, she hopes to expand her businesses and would like to build a small house on the plot of land that she owns. She requests a loan to purchase more wood and food products for her two small businesses.

loans.use: To buy wood and food products for her businesses

loans.name: Ayoka

texts.en: Ayoka lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods and bread. She has been in this business since the year 1979. Ayoka is 50 years old. She is very determined to expand her business and increase her family's standard of living. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and bread to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and bread

loans.name: Mamuli A Nakilwa Edith Group

texts.en: N. Edith is 48 years old, married with seven children, and looking after five dependents going to school. She has a grocery business selling bananas, tomatoes and chicken. She has been in her business for 11 years. She is using the loan to purchase bananas, tomatoes and chicken for her business. The loan is adding capital to her business, which is improving in stock. Her future hope is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, tomatoes and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Mrs. Then T., 29, and her husband, Mr. Then Lang, 33, were married in 1998 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.


Mrs. Then T. has been a garment factory worker for a year. Her husband has been a construction worker for twelve years. Recently, he wants to change to a new business and drive a Tuk Tuk, a motorbike with a trailer at the back. So she requests her first loan of $600 to add to her own money to purchase a trailer for her husband to drive a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a trailer for her husband to drive as a Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Wenifredo

texts.en:
Wenifredo B., a 43-year-old father of three children, is a rice grower. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day to maintain a hectare rice field and a poultry farm as well. He started the business four years ago and this is very helpful to his family because they earn almost all of their income from rice and eggs.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan for farm financing, buying chickens and buying feed for his poultry.

He said he likes the services in CEVI and hopes that he can seek more loans in the future.

loans.use: Farm financing and poultry

loans.name: Siloe Plus Group

texts.fr:
Justine L. est présidente du groupe dénommé « Siloe Plus » composé de 25 membres solidairement engagés pour recevoir des crédits de Kiva à travers l’IMF HOPE RDC.
Justine 48 ans, a commencé son activité en 2008. Elle vend de la charcuterie et des gâteaux devant sa parcelle située dans la partie montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a reçu 5 fois les prêts de l’IMF HOPE RDC et les a remboursés correctement. Le crédit qui lui sera octroyé prochainement lui servira à diversifier son activité en achetant des œufs à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, elle génère un bénéfice de $12 par jour. Elle travaille durement avec une bonne gestion afin d’atteindre son objectif d’ouvrir une boutique dans sa parcelle. Justine est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants âgés de 17 à 25 ans. Deux d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Justine L. chairs Siloe Plus Group composed of 25 members who are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC. Justine, aged 48, began her business in 2008. She sells cooked pork meats (such as pâté, "rillettes", ham and sausages) and cakes in front of her plot of land in the mountains west of the city of Kinshasa. She is a regular client who received five loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and repaid them on schedule. She will use this loan to diversify her business and buy eggs for resale and increase her income. Currently she earns a profit of $12 a day. She is a hard-working lady who manages her business efficiently to fulfill her goal of opening a store on her plot of land. Justine is divorced and the mother of three children aged 17 to 25. Two of them attend school.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs for resale and increase her income

loans.name: Sépénou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce le commerce de quincaillerie, étant marié et père d’un enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient à ses charges et à celles de sa famille.le stock de marchandise dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter rehausser son stock de produits de quincaillerie

loans.use: achat des articles de quincaillerie

loans.name: Yedgor

texts.ru: Едгор Темуров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Едгор более 2 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет собственный магазин, в котором торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота и увеличения ассортимента, т.к. в этом есть спрос.
texts.en:
Yedgor T. lives in the city of Kulyab. He is 40 years old, married and has five children. Yedgor has been engaged in trade for more than two years. He has his own store, in which he sells food products. He is requesting a loan to expand his inventory and diversify his assortment in order to meet demand.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une revendeuse de poissons fumés dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé ; elle achète des poissons tout frais auprès des pécheurs de la plage de Lomé et les revend ensuite sous forme de poissons fumés. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Ainsi, ces poissons sont fumés par des procédés traditionnels avec surtout des cartons vides servant de bois de chauffage. Beaucoup de ménages s’approvisionnent chez elle en laissant des commandes de vente. Elle a approché WAGES en ce moment pour acheter 06 cartons de poissons frais, 30 cartons vides qui serviront de bois de chauffage et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a retailer of smoked fish in the Agoè district of Lomé; she buys fresh fish from the fishermen at the beach in Lomé and resells them in smoked form. This business allows her to contribute financially to the management of her household. These fish are smoked using traditional methods, especially with empty boxes serving as firewood. Many households obtain their supplies from her by leaving their orders with her. Currently, she has approached WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 6 boxes of fresh fish, 30 empty boxes to serve as firewood, and various other products. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and empty boxes

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net H. lives in Troey Troeng village in Kandal province. She is a chicken breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to request a loan to buy more chickens for her business. Her husband, Mr. Huy Senglon, helps her with the business.

Mrs. Net H. is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because this child is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 32 years old and married with one child. He has a garbage collection business and employs four people. He's been in this business for five years and also works as a carpet cleaner. He describes himself as organized and hardworking, and says that he hopes to expand his clientele outside of Nairobi. He requested this loan from the Kiva Partner, Faulu, for 80,000 KES to buy a truck to transport garbage.

loans.use: to buy a truck for transporting garbage

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina trades in cereals such as beans, maize, rice, etc. She supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Paulina also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

Paulina is 42 years old. She is married and has two children who are both still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Paulina works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose Q. K. is in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use. Rose is 30 years-old and divorced with four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
La   Señora Claudia María Pérez M., Labora como Inspectora en Turno vespertino del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento y arena, para la construcción de  un embaldosado frente de su casa de habitación.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 Claudia dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia María Pérez M. works as an evening shift inspector at the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute of Managua. She has two children in her care, and they are of school age. She is married. She has had loans with CEPRODEL for three years. During this time, she has invested three loans in the improvement of the house in which she lives, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL.

The loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement and sand for the construction of a tile floor at the front of her house.

Her goal is to offer better security and a better living conditions to her children.

Claudia says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and enlargement of home

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman B. sells men's clothes. He opened his own store in 2001 to provide income for his family. This business is the only source of income for Mehman's family. 

His store is located in the center of his village and is very popular among local people. He is married and has 4 sons. He dreams that, one day, one of this sons will continue his business, but for now, Mehman has to do everything he can to develop and expand his business. For this purpose, he has applied for 1600 AZN to purchase more clothes for the upcoming spring season. Mehman and his family are counting on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Mrs. Naret C. and her husband, Mr. Moeun Sok, live in a small village about 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Naret has been a tailor for more than 2 years. She operates her business at home. Her husband has been a driver for a company for more than 4 years. Naret used Kiva to ask for a loan one time already. She now is requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to build a restroom for her famiy to use.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family to use.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz tiene 37 años, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una persona muy luchadora y que diariamente se gana el pan de cada día. Además de realizar esto los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de comida, pues ciertos vecinos llegan a disfrutar de sus deliciosos platillos, ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para comenzar la preparación de los refrescos naturales que son muy deliciosos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo gaseosas, frutas naturales, bolsas, azúcar entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is 37 years old, and she sells soft drinks. She has been in this business for over six years. She is a very tenacious person, and everyday she earns her daily bread. Also, on the week ends she sells food. Some of her neighbors come to enjoy her delicious dishes. She gets up at five in the morning to start preparing the natural soft drinks that are so delicious. The loan she is requesting is for working capital for soft drinks, natural fruits, bags, and sugar, among other things. Her wish is to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Emma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling candies, some food for snacks, shampoo and etc. in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by KIVA.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, KIVA created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 61 años, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que obtiene. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que tiene una amplia variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos, pues además ofrece precios muy bajos y esto atrae a las mayoría de sus clientes. En su negocio vende ciertos productos como papel, calculadora, tijeras y útiles escolares. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio. ella sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Candida is 61 years old. She has had a bookstore for more than five years. She has a wide number of customers who request different items. She offers low prices and this attracts most of her customers. She also sells certain other products, such as papers, calculators, scissors, and school supplies. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital and buy supplies for her business. She wants to improve her business and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sheila Alona

texts.en: Sheila Alona R., is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is separated, and has three school-aged children. Sheila owns and operates a fish-vending business. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Sheila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase more fish to sell. Sheila plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rocky

texts.en:
Rocky R. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 very young children. Rocky owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rocky has been involved in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 90,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Rocky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rocky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rocky is requesting a new loan, his 5th, of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Junette

texts.en:
Junette F. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old. Junette is married and has three school-aged children. Junette owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. 

In 2009, Junette joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Junette has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Junette is requesting her second loan, for 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Cheas

texts.en:
Cheas S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph. She and her husband produce Cambodian traditional baskets to sell for an income of USD 2 each per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda B. M., vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, sitio    que combina una zona comercial, recreativa con una  residencial llena de muchas viviendas multifamiliares; Ella tiene el negocio de elaborar y vender ropa, el cual inició desde el año 1995, cuando aprendió en un taller familiar de confecciones en el año 1992. Escogió realizar esta actividad  después de ser secretaria de una empresa privada y hoy se siente satisfecha por ello, porque su negocio genera  empleo. Yolanda  trabaja en horario de 8:00 a m a 7:00 P.m. y de lunes a sábado, por eso   aunque hay muchas confecciones, se sostiene compitiendo con respuesta oportuna, precio y calidad en sus productos, asì logra  mantenerse   estable  en el mercado porque tiene  muchos clientes entre almacenes del centro de Barranquilla, amistades, familiares  y referidos  ; la frecuencia de compra de sus materias primas son cada tres días, por eso debe tener efectivo disponible para hacerlo; en la actualidad solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas, hilos, adornos para elaborar ropa que tiene encargada. Yolanda sueña con tener una boutique y a nivel personal se siente muy realizada porque sus hijos son profesionales, eso resalta que aunque su estado civil es separado, son muy representativos sus esfuerzos para lograr educarlos y que tengan  buenas condiciones de vida, porque para eso se prepararon.
texts.en:
Yolanda B. M. lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood [named for July 20th, Colombia's Independence Day]. It is an area that combines a commercial zone and recreation area with a residential zone full of multi-family homes. She runs a business making and selling clothes, which she started in 1995, after learning the trade in a family workshop in 1992. She decided to take up this activity after working as a secretary at a private business, and today she feels very satisfied with her decision because her business generates work. Yolanda works an 8AM to 7PM schedule from Monday to Saturday, and therefore produces many clothes. She stays competitive by being timely and through the prices and quality of her products. This way, she is able to remain stable in the market, because between the stores in central Barranquilla, friends, relatives, and references, she has many clients. She needs to buy materials for her work every three days, so she must have cash on hand to do so. Currently, she is requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will purchase fabric, thread, and adornments for the clothes she is making. Yolanda dreams of owning a boutique. On a personal level, she feels very successful because her children are professionals, even though she is separated from their father. This is representative of how hard she worked to give them an education and a good quality of life, so that they would be prepared for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and adornments for the clothing she makes

loans.name: Sokhouy's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine people which located I. Bang Village, Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhouy C. is 35 years old and is the village bank president having selected by its members. While each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose. 
Mrs. Sokhouy C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, she will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to cultivate rice. Aside from farmer she is also grocery seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family living, while her husband, Mr. Phally Haem, is a primary school director and also support his wife businesses. This couple has three children, who all are students I. the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Truphena Awino

texts.en:
Truphena is a 43-year-old lady from Migori town. She is married to Phinehas O.. They have three children between the ages of 27 and 20 years.  They live in Uriri on the outskirts of Migori town in Western Kenya.

Truphena runs a cereal business where she sells all types of cereals, but mainly maize and beans due to their high demand. Although she is based in Uriri town, she sometimes supplies her cereals in Nairobi, the capital city, which is 500 kilometers away.

Truphena was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was an existing client, and since she had always wanted financing to boost her business, she didn’t hesitate. She joined and she is now taking her fourth loan after successfully completing the other loans. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of cereals to sell and also to use in her molasses business. 

Truphena dreams of buying a pickup van for transporting her cereals to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a vegetable and fruit vendor. She owns a stall at Nakawa market in the city suburbs where she sells her wares. She buys her fruits and vegetables from the very market where she works and therefore does not incur any transport costs during purchasing. She has been in this business for ten years. In addition to her market stall, she owns a small retail shop at her home which brings in some additional income.

She sells her wares at retail prices and works seven days a week. Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She aspires toward a business model where she would eventually sell her wares directly to farmers. She also hopes someday to build her own house. 

She decided to join MCDT because they were giving out timely loans at low interest. She would like to use this loan of 800,000 to buy more baskets of mangoes, oranges, pineapples, cabbages, and yellow bananas.  

Edith resides in a rented two-roomed house with her husband and six children. All their children attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of mangoes, oranges, cabbages, pineapples, and yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio L. Jr. is from the city of Dicayas, Dipolog City. He is 54 years old. Arsenio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Arsenio owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arsenio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of PHP 30,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Arsenio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Ali K. 44 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey  doch 18 let kotoraya v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 16 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona ,seychas projivayet v Khirdalan qorode. 

Eto uje vtoroya ssuda Ali on ochen blagodaren za pervuyu ssudu za to chto lenderi pomoqli yemu i yeqo biznessu. Ali 1 qod tomu nazad nachal noviy bizness ,on otkril "internet club". Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi rasshirit pomesheniye chtobi on smoq pomestit bolshe kompyuterov.
texts.en:
Ali K. is 44 years old. He is married, with two children: an 18-year old daughter who has been admitted to the university this year and a 16-year old son who goes to school. Ali is an Internally Displaced Person, a refugee from the Kalbadjar Region. He currently lives in the town of Khirdalan. This is Ali’s second loan. He is very grateful for his first loan and for lenders’ help with his business. A year ago he launched a new business, opening an “Internet club.” At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his facility and be able to accommodate more computers.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding his facility

loans.name: Luby De Jesús

texts.es: La  Sra. Luby de Jesús R. C.  ella  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva ella vende de casa en casa, ella tiene diez  años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo en mercadería,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Luby de Jesús R. C. sells new clothing from house to house and has been working in this business for ten years. She is currently married and has a school-age son.

She has had eleven loans through CEPRODEL and she has used each one of them to purchase products for her business and expand her merchandise. The CEPRODEL loans have benefited her greatly because she has improved her business and her and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, and underwear

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia Borgoñosfood, age 54, sells food items and daily-use products from the sari-sari (variety) store that she owns and operates with her husband. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two school-aged children and live in the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. 
   
Earlier this year, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Salkinoy

texts.ru: Хужакулова Салкиной проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж, работает в колхозе. Сама Салкиной имеет среднее образования. Занимается торговлей. Она привозит в город фисташки, миндаль и продает оптом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. На полученную прибыль она намерена купить крупнорогатый скот.
texts.en: Salkinoy K. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 43 years old, married and has 4 children.  Her husband works at a farm collective.  Salkinoy has a secondary education.  She is involved in sales.  She delivers pistachios and almonds into the town and sells them wholesale.  Salkinoy has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  She wants to use the resulting profit to purchase cattle.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun N., 40, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Takeo province. She sells desserts in her village and is able to make about US$8 per day. Her husband raises fish and grows rice. He has been doing this business since 1999, and is able to make about US$4 of profit every day. Three of the children are in school.

To earn more money, Hun N. is asking for a loan of USD1,000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to operate a moto-taxi. She believes the extra business will allow her family earns more income. Hun N. really wants all her children to attend the university if she can support them.

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian J. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Ian is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Ian owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Ian has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Ian is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory &  for working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: Twenty-six-year-old John would like a loan to buy clothes to resell. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi-permanent house.  His dream is to educate his children.  He sells first-hand clothes and has a business aspiration of becoming a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch S., 33, weaves traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a motorbike driver, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to improve the business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina M. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella resiD. en San Jacinto, en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su familia. Marcelina posee un comedor, en el cual trabaja D. lunes a sábado, en el cual sus ventas son bastante estables, ya que esta rodeada D. colegios y fábricas, cuyos empleados y estudiantes consumen sus alimentos, ya que Marcelina comercializa desayunos, almuerzos y así mismo diferentes tipos D. bebidas y golosinas. Debido a que cuenta con varios clientes Marcelina posee una persona quien le ayuda a elaborar los alimentos y quien le ayuda a atender a sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas, verduras,  bebidas y golosinas, con las cuales tenga mucho más productos que ofrecer y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marcelina M. D. R. is 46 years old.  She lives in San Jacinto, in San Salvador department with her husband and her two dependent children who are studying.

Marcelina owns an eatery where she works from Monday to Saturday.  Her sales are quite stable since she is surrounded by schools and factories whose employees and students eat her food.  Marcelina sells breakfasts, lunches and also different types of drinks and candy.  As she has a number of customers, Marcelina employs another person to help her prepare the food and serve her customers.

Marcelina is requesting this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of fruit, vegetables, drinks and candy so that she has more products to offer and can, in this way, increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, drinks and candy to sell

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Fatuma has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Fatuma sells her products at retail at the market.  Fatuma has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Fatuma include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of second-hand clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and build rental rooms and also to start selling at wholesale only.   Fatuma lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Corte, Carmen, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business.  Her husband Roque, who is 37 years old, works as a painter to earn his living.  They have four children from 5 to 11 years old. 

Eliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,100, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to add more stocks for her customers so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Eliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference  in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Joyce  Ndungu

texts.en:
Joyce Nduki M. is a very hardworking woman who sells clothes in Kangundo. She has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 3,000. She is 47 years old, married to Peter, a Securicor officer, and they have two school-going children.

Joyce has never borrowed from any other MFI and she is applying for a second loan after having successfully repaid the previous one well and in good time. She intends to use the entire loan amount to add more stock of secondhand clothes for sale. Joyce intends to reinvest the additional income from the proceeds of this loan back into the business. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to add more stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a twenty nine year old enterprising man living in a family house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He has the desire tp educate his siblings to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. He is an grower of tea and has been farming for two years. The business is good as he has an assured market in the local factory. He has challenges in that he has limited capital to meet the quality needed at the factory. His dream is to expand his tea estate. Kenneth needs the loan to plant tea.

loans.use: Planting tea.

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 26 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen una hija de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es obrero. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que trabaja como obrera en una fábrica en Manta y además de esto también se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también aprovecha su lugar de trabajo para venderles a sus colegas de trabajo. Labora dos  días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by foreign and domestic tourists. Most of the residents engage in fishing or work at other jobs that are tied to the sea.

In this place one can find Sra. Ana. She is 26 years old, married, and has an eight month old daughter. Her husband is a laborer. She joined the Communal Bank at the very beginning and enjoys it because she has made many friends among her group.

Ana is a strong-willed woman who is employed as a factory worker in Manta. In addition, she engages in trade by selling Yanbal products (a line of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door and also takes advantage of her regular job by selling to her co-workers. Ana works at her business two days a week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments at the end of each week. She says the products that sell the most are perfumes because they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and undergarments. Her dream is to have a house of her own since she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and undergarments.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, another one is a rice seller who gets a low salary, another is a bicycle repairer, and the others are attending the local public school. She is a pig and chicken breeder who can earn some profit to support her family, while her husband is a motorcycle repairer and an iron welder. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. 

So to improve her situation, she is seeking a loan to buy more pigs and pig food, and with the rest of the loan she is going to buy more iron welding supplies. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig food

loans.name: Jorge Fructuoso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Fructuoso; el tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de carpintería metalica, el realiza trabajos en puertas, ventanas, techos entre otros trabajos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería metalica.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los trabajos como metal y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province and department.

The member’s name is Jorge Fructuoso. He is 40 years old, lives with his partner and he has four children. He alternates his daily activities with a metalwork workshop. He works on doors, windows and roofs along with other projects. Jorge wants to expand his metalwork business. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials for his work like metal and tools. 

The member is happy about this loan and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work like metal and tools

loans.name: Youlta

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession a 28 ans, youlta  est mariée à un transitaire et est mère de deux enfants. Elle a démarrée son activité en 2002 en s’approvisionnant de mèches et de tissages à Accra(Ghana), un pays frontalier à l’ouest du TOGO et au SENEGAL. Elle veut équiper son salon de coiffure d’appareils de nouvelle gamme ,ce qui va lui permettre d’avoir plus de clientèle et de majorer son bénéfice pour aider dans l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Youlta is a hairdresser by profession. She is married to a freight broker and is mother to two children. She began her business in 2002, getting supplies of hair extensions and weaves in Accra (Ghana), a country which borders the west of Togo and Senegal. She would like to equip her hairdressing salon with a new range of appliances, which will enable her to have more customers and increase her profits, so she can help to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un cliente de 27 años de edad. Es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de José  Leonardo Ortiz en Lambayeque.

Hilario se dedica a brindar el servicio de mototaxi. Este es un servicio muy popular que se da en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú. La mototaxi es una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Hilario tiene experiencia en esta actividad y es un trabajador bastante conocido en su sector que cuenta con clientela fija.

El dinero que Hilario obtiene de su trabajo, lo reparte entre él y sus padres. Actualmente Hilario y su familia desean mejorar su vivienda  para tener un mayor confort, es por ello que Hilario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitirá apoyar a sus padres en las mejoras del hogar.

Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues estos arreglos son algo que realmente su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Hilario is a young entrepreneur of 27 years of age. He lives in his parents' home in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in Lambayeque.

Hilario provides a very popular mototaxi service in the small villages of Peru. The mototaxi is comprised of a motorbike with a cabin attached to the back which can be used to transport passengers. Hilario has a lot of experience in this field. He is quite well known in his community and has a stable client base.

Hilario divides the income he receives from his mototaxi business between himself and his parents. They would like to improve their home to make it more comfortable, which is why Hilario has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles which will help him to support his family while they make home improvements. 

Hilario is very grateful for the loan that he has been granted as these home improvements are very much needed by his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga tiene un almacén D. productos en la zona D. uso domestico en la zona Ticti Sud una zona alejada D. la ciudad, su negocio se encuentra en su domicilio ya que la casa donD. vive es propia, la mayoría D. sus hijos están en el exterior y ella se quedó sola en la casa con una D. sus hijas ya que vive separada D. su esposo, la Sra. Dominga se quedo apoyando a su hija; actualmente su única fuente D. ingresos es la oferta D. productos D. primera necesidad D. el almacén  se encuentra bien surtido pero siempre hace falta algo para satisfacer las necesidades del cliente, el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra D. víveres para el almacén, la señora es D. carácter muy jovial, trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dominga has a domestic use products store in the Ticti Sud neighborhood, an area that is far from the city.  Her store is located in her home since she owns the house she lives in.  Most of her children are abroad so she was left alone at home with one of her daughters who is separated from her husband.  Dominga was left having to help out her daughter.  Currently it’s her only source of income; she stocks basic need items in the store.  Although it’s well stocked there’s always something missing to meet all customer demands.  

The money she will be granted will be used to buy stock items for the store.  She is very cheerful and hard working and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Paz has a shop, where she sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green & yellow bananas. Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green & yellow bananas.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad de 53 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor Alan de 24 años, quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano. Soledad tiene que distribuir su tiempo en varias actividades. Durante todo el día se dedica en la venta de leña y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 30 años en este negocio desea para el futuro, incrementar la cantidad de leña que tiene y así tener plata para pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo, a quien cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no le falte nada. Hace poco sufrió una operación del apéndice, por lo que está en cama. Pero esta dificultad no la amilana, a contrario le ida fuerzas para salir adelante. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de lechuga, espinaca y arveja; los cuales después de cuidarlos y fertilizarlos constantemente los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia en la vida es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Por ello está segura que podrá ser una de las mejores agricultoras y comerciante de la zona. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Soledad de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 bolsas de semilla de arveja que oscila entre los S/. 375 soles cada uno y el resto comprará abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos de espinaca.
texts.en:
Soledad, 53, lives in Palcamayo.  She is notable for being a hard working, sincere woman.  She lives in her own house with her youngest son, Alan, 24, who always helps her with her work.  Every morning, starting very early, Soledad has to divide her time among several activities.  She sells firewood, that’s in quite high demand from her customers, all day.  With 30 years in this business she wants for the future to increase the amount of firewood she has in order to have money to pay for her son’s higher education; she cares for him with much love and has always seen to it that he’s had everything he needs.

She recently had surgery on her appendix so is bedridden.  But this difficulty doesn’t discourage her; on the contrary it’s given her strength to continue forward.  During her free time she farms lettuce, spinach and peas which, after caring for and fertilizing them constantly, she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.  She enjoys chatting with her customers and jokes around with them to get along with them better since her main strategy in life is to put joy into everything she does.  Because of this she’s sure that she can become one of the best farmers and merchants in the zone.

She belongs to the “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she hopes to have your collaboration to continue toward her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to making her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  Besides, she enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  

If Soledad were to receive the support of the requested loan, she’d use it to buy four sacks of pea seeds which cost around 375 soles each and would use the rest to buy organic manure to spread among her spinach crops.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is past the age of 64. 

Mariam is the proud owner of a car repair shop. She handles tasks such as the business expenses, returns, appointments etc. Her husband assists her with the work. He is responsible for changing tires, repairing engines, and other manuA. labor. They work together to satisfy the family needs and to be able to cover their children's education fees. 

Today, Mariam is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a scanner machine. She says that this machine will smooth the work operation and help identify the smallest car damages. She is very optimistic and hopes to further expand her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner machine

loans.name: Godelene

texts.en:
Godelene, 31 years old, is married and has two children ages two and five years old. Both are in school, and her husband is a businessman.

For the past seven years Godelene has run a general store in which she sells rice, beans, cooking oil, and other goods. The profits from this business have helped her improve her family’s standard of living.

With this loan, Godelene will purchase more goods that she will continue to sell for a profit. With future earnings, she hopes to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells provisions like soaps, polythene bags, spices and other items at Abura. She is married. Her husband is a security man. Efua has been in this trade for 6 years. She responsibly helps her husband pay the utility bills and other household expenses.  Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another shop.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Raimon

texts.en:
Raimon is a twenty-three-year-old married man with one child, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to educate his child up to university. 

He has been in a retail shop business for five years. He acquired initial capital from farming. His hardship is price fluctuation and his vision is a wholesale business in the city. Raimon needs the loan to buy crates of beers and sodas for resale.

loans.use: To buy beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy marañon seeds.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida believes that, "Patience and hard work" are the only weapon to fight poverty. She is a mother who is now 61 years old and has four adult children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village while her husband manages their farm land. She has been in this business for almost 10 years earning profits of P9,000 a month which she usually spends on the education of her children and to cover their basic necessities. 

They endure hardships and difficulties for they want their children to finish their studies and earn their degree. As a fruit of their patience and hard work, most of their children become professionals and have a good job. They mentioned that this is their big accomplishment in life. 
 
At present, Brigida aims to continue and improve the business to have a stable source of income. She is asking for additional capital of P32,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, candies, beverages, soaps and shampoos to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business as she continue to work hard.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, breads, candies, beverages, soaps and shampoos to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Marcia; tiene 43 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia es Licenciada en Turismo de profesión y después de trabajar por muchos años en el área de hotelería, la socia decidió independizarse y abrir su propia empresa de eventos, la socia tiene una empresa encargada de decorar, de la música y animación, de los aperitivos, de los platos de fondo, de las cenas elegantes, de los matrimonios, de bautizos, de cumpleaños y de todo evento que se diese en la bella ciudad D. Cusco, la socia es muy experimentada en cuanto a diversos buffet para toda ocasión y a la ambientación de los locales que se escojan para los eventos a realizarse ella ve cada detalle y sus trabajadores son muy profesionales.
La socia desea el crédito para invertir en su empresa y comprar copas nuevas para vino blanco, vino rojo y agua. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de copas.
La socia Cleofe es la sra que esta en la parte superior la encontre en su lugar de trabajo porque ella estuvo de viaje.
Los otros socios desean invertir en sus diferentes negocios como tienda de abarrotes, estudios, en gastos personales.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
M.ía belongs to the "San Antonio" communal bank, which is located in the community of Huachac, in the province and department of Cusco. M.ía is 43, married, and has two children. 

She has a university degree in Tourism Management, and after working for many years in the hotel industry, she decided to become independent, and open her own event planning company.
