Her company takes care of the decorating, the music and the entertainment, the appetizers, and the main dishes, for elegant dinners, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, and every event that is held in the beautiful city of Cusco. 

She is very experienced with regard to different buffets for every occasion, and in the settings chosen for the holding of events. She sees to every detail, and her workers are very professional. She wants the loan in order to invest in her business and to buy new glasses for white wine, red wine, and water.  

Cleofe is the woman shown in the upper part of the photo, pictured in her place of work, because she was on a trip when the photo was taken. 

The other members wish to invest in various businesses, such as a grocery stO., and to pay for education and personal expenses.   

M.ía is grateful for the support she has been granted and is committed to making her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy glasses for her business.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr: Mutoo, leader du groupe « Faraja », âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont le fils ainé  a 14 ans et le cadet 4 mois. Elle est vendeuse de sacs à mains dans le petit marché local appelé TMK. Son mari est un  comptable dans une division publique. Son capital initial fut de  200$.  Il y a de  cela 13 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Avec ce nouveau crédit, la cliente va acheter 1 ballon de sacs  à mains à marchander. Cependant, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroitre son entreprise. Ainsi, elle remercie l’IMF Hekima, pour son appui en micro crédit.
texts.en: Mutoo, the leader of Faraja Group, is 32 years old, married and the mother of seven children. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest 4 months. She sells handbags at the small local market called TMK. Her husband is an accountant in a public organization. Mutoo's start-up capital amounted to $200. She has been in her activity for the past 13 years. She will use this new loan to buy one bale of handbags for resale. Mutoo wants to see her children grow up and her business expand. She thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for its support with microloans.

loans.use: to buy one bale of handbags.

loans.name: Hazvidi Hope Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 36 years old and lives with her family in Masvingo. She has five children aged 4, 6, 9, 12 and 13; four of them are going to school.  She has been selling clothes, shoes and kitchenware at the flea market for three years. Her husband helps her with her business, but she faces the challenge of inadequate capital to buy more goods for sale.

Gladys has applied for US $4OO to buy more stock for her business. With the additional income generated from her loan, she will be able to send her children to better schools and give them a good start in life.  Her plan in the near future is to open a shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes and kitchenware for sale

loans.name: Violeta Estefanni

texts.es:
Violeta, se dedica a la venta de pasteles, vive con una tía, es soltera, realiza sus ventas todos los días, ofreciendo pasteles y tostadas de plátano y yuca, ella tiene tres años en el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en maíz, plátanos, yuca, condimentos y aceite, estos materiales son los que necesita para elaborar las ventas, por lo que será una gran ayuda este préstamo.
Su aspiración es tener una mejor calidad de vida, trabajar arduamente para mantenerse y cubrir sus propias necesidades y las de su tía.
texts.en: Violeta works selling cakes.  She lives with her aunt, is single, and she makes sales every day, offering cakes and fried plantains and yucca.  She has been working in this business for three years.  Currently she is asking for a loan which she will invest in corn, plantains, yucca, condiments and oil.  These are the materials that she news in order to make her products, and the loan will thus be a great help.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life, to work hard to care for her own needs and also the needs of her aunt.

loans.use: To purchase corn, plantains, yucca, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. El préstamo anterior fue de gran apoyo para el mejoramiento. En este nuevo ciclo de préstamo será utilizado para seguir poco a poco con la obra de ver su casa construida por completo, compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, estribu, camisas, tablones de madera, perlines, pintura para perlines, clavos de acero, laminas de zinc, hierro, entre otros materiales que se requieren para la construcción de un cuarto que se anexara a la casa, así obtendrá comodidad ya que actualmente están durmiendo en un solo cuarto con sus hijos.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante para cumplir sus metas y brindarle a su familia beneficios.
texts.en: Miguel is a hardworking man who, along with his wife, has plans to improve the infrastructure of his house.  His previous loan was a great help with the improvement project.  In this new loan cycle, he will continue gradually with the work of completing the construction of his home.  He will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, brackets, steel liners, planks of wood, support beams, paint for the support beams, steel nails, corrugated metal roofing sheets, steel and other materials that are needed to build a room that will be added to the house.  In this way he will have more comfort, since currently he and his wife are are sleeping in a single room with his children.  He is grateful for the ongoing support that is allowing him to meet his goals and is providing his family with benefits.

loans.use: to add a room to his house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Grace has a shop that sells hardware products like weighing machines, hand globes and nails by the kilo. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of hardware products for her shop.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her hardware shop.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: Álvaro  desde Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar caribe,  envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Que Dios los bendiga por ayudar tanta gente humilde en todo el mundo. “  Él está muy satisfecho con su anterior credikiva porque logró comprar al por mayor y de contado víveres, reparó su carro triciclo en el cual vende arroz chino por las calles del pueblo Y ahora se ´prepara para el siguiente financiamiento, con el cual comprará un nuevo bici taxi que le permita abrir nuevos mercados y desplazarse con mayor comodidad y rapidez a otros sitios lejanos, y también invertirá en víveres en mayor volumen, con el cual disminuirá los costos de producción por los descuentos que obtendrá al hacerlo en mayor cantidad de dinero.
texts.en:
From Puerto Colombia on the shores of the Caribbean Sea Álvaro sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “May God bless you for helping so many humble persons throughout the world.”  

He is very happy with his previous Kiva loan because he managed to pay cash for larger amounts of foodstuffs; he repaired his three-wheeled cart that he uses to sell Chinese-style rice throughout the town’s streets.  Now, he’s getting ready for the next loan that he’ll use to buy a new rickshaw that will allow him to open up new markets and get from place to place more comfortably and more quickly getting to more distant places.  He will also invest in larger amounts of foodstuffs which will reduce production costs thanks to the discounts he’ll qualify for being able having the money to buy in larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy a new bike taxi and also to buy larger volumes of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de comida el cual atiende con el apoyo de su esposo,  ellos  realizan  banquetes para cualquier tipo de evento  y nos  comenta  que  sus  clientes  han ido  incrementado  de  manera  satisfactoria, es por  ello que en esta  ocasión requiere  ampliar su  negocio extendiéndolo, realizando  la  construcción para  la parte  de  enfrente del  mismo  ya  que  considera  que  es   muy  pequeño , ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad de  que  sus  clientes  tengan mayor  espacio  y una mejor  comodidad  cuando  van a  su negocio
texts.en: María has a business selling food that she tends to with help from her husband.  They cater banquets for all kinds of events and she comments that her clientele has been growing satisfactorily.  Because of this, she wants to enlarge her business extending it by building on to the front of it because she considers it to be too small.  She sees in the loan the possibility for her customers to have more space and comfort when they come to her business.

loans.use: to make her storefront bigger.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with 3 children. 
Reynaldo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business.
Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is thirty-nine years old, and presently lives in Gabunon, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She is widowed with three children.

Annie  has a general store and has been this business for almost four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two months. In the future, Annie hopes that she can improve her family's standard of living, and earn more than she needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Devothe

texts.en:
Devothe aged 42 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 14 years.They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to buy a cow. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en: Rajabu lives in Yombo, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.He is married with three children. Rajabu sell used clothes . He buys these clothes from wholesales, amend them in his tailoring workshop at home and resell them in retail. Most used clothes need some modification before resell, some are undersized ,some are oversized, some are torn. Rajabu owns one old sewing machine. He needs two modern sewing machines. The new machines will increase the speed of repairing the clothes. He is also in a plan to employ one assistant to facilitate his mission, To make his plan work Rajabu is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: I am a 28-year-old father of 2.  I sell roasted corn. I do my business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my family. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day.

loans.use: Expand and improve my business

loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Aracely is a native of Salitre where she has been farming rice her entire life. She has a small farm where she farms the crop and she also a couple of cattle. Aracely lives with her husband and three children who are in school. She will invest her money in pesticides and feed for her cattle. With the extra profits she hopes she can purchase a cow and continue to provide her kids with an eduction.

She is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Pesticides for rice

loans.name: Zarmena

texts.en:
Zarmena lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is not married. She makes artificial flowers. She loves this work a lot and she has good experience.

She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy all the materials for making flowers. She wants to attract more clients and make a good income so that she can improve her life.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for artificial flowers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
Remedios F. Quispe is a mother with four children. She prepares and sells food from a cart in all of the markets in El Alto.

She has participated with Pro Mujer for five years, which is the same amount of time that she has had this business. Thanks to Pro Mujer she was able to buy what she needed to get started. Remedios used to make cinnamon ice cream, but she had to quit that business to take care of her children, who were very young.

Now she tends to her food cart with help from her children, due to the existing demand and her need to generate income. She is in need of money to buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Remedios F. Quispe, es madre de cuatro hijos se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto ambulante en todas las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Ingresa a Pro Mujer, hace cinco años, que es el mismo tiempo que ella se dedica a su actividad, puesto que gracias a Pro Mujer ella compra todo lo necesario para la atención de su puesto de venta de comida. Anteriormente Remedios se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de helados de canela, pero tuvo que dejar esta actividad por no descuidar la atención de sus hijos que eran muy pequeños. Actualmente Remedios atiende su puesto de venta con la ayuda de sus hijos a raíz de la demanda existente y la necesidad de generar ingresos. Ella precisa de dinero para poder comprar un minibús, con el fin de proveer de una herramienta de trabajo a su esposo y de esta manera aliviar su carga laboral, tanto de ella, como de sus hijos que trabajan a su lado

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O. is asking for a loan amount of $400 to buy more provisions to sell in her food store, which she keeps obsessively organized. Mrs. O. started her business in 2004 and has been running it for 3 years. She is 40 years old, married with seven children, and lives in Asaba in Delta State. She is a good client of LAPO.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her food store

loans.name: Judite Luis

texts.pt:
Judite Luís N. is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She lives in the district of Magoanine in Maputo. She entered the program in July of 2005 as a member of the Ahiculene group and started with a loan for 1.800MT. She raises and sells chickens and raises hens for production and sells the eggs in her home. She has had great development in her business having grown the quantity of chicks and hens that she raises. With this loan of $825US she intends to buy food for the chicks and hens, and will build a small house in her yard for her workers.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Judite Luís N. tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de dois filhos.Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Julho de 2005 como membro do grupo Ahiculene e começou com um empréstimo de 1.800MT. Cria e vende frangos e cria galinhas poedeiras para produção e venda de ovos na sua residência.Teve grande desenvolvimento no negócio , tendo aumentado a quantidade de pintos e poedeiras que cria. Vai tomar neste ciclo 20.000MT os quais pretende aplicar na compra de ração para pintos e poedeiras, e ainda costruir uma pequena casa dentro do seu quintal para o empregados.

loans.use: Buy food for chicks and hens, and construct home for workers

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 40-year-old Chiku M.. She is married with no children. In 2002 Chiku established a grain and charcoal business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

Charcoal--small black and dirty pieces of dry earth--are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, beans, and charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel Rios works selling music and movies on DVDs. Ten years ago, he decided to invest C$ 600 (six hundred cordobas) buying these products. This investment was made through a loan from a moneylender. Manuel Rios worked very hard to pay back that debt.

It is necessary to highlight that Manuel is father to three children, and has the responsibility to offer them an education. This is why, intelligently, Manuel Rios has taken loans from Ceprodel (12 loans), which he has invested in his business, acquiring compact discs. He needs to invest more in his business to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de música y películas en dvd es el negocio al que se dedica el caballero Manuel R.. Desde hace 10 años decidió invertir C$ 600 (Seiscientos córdobas) en la compra de estos artículos, la inversión la realizó por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Para salir de la deuda, comenzó esforzándose grandemente hasta saldarla.

Es de mucha necesidad destacar que es padre de tres hijos con la responsabilidad de brindarle educación y por este motivo muy inteligentemente, Manuel R. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (12 créditos) que los ha utilizado como inversión en el negocio para la adquisición de los discos compactos. Su necesidad es invertir mas en el negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Buying compact discs (Compra de los discos compactos)

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 3

texts.en:
Lujida is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in a poverty-stricken community called Los Guaricanos, on the outskirts of the national capital. She has made a small business for herself of selling shoes and clothing from her house, and occasionally along the streets in her community. She is asking for this loan to expand her inventory—specifically she would like to buy a bigger quantity of clothes, as well as a wider variety. With a better variety she can begin to attract new customers, and consequently increase her income.

Her goal is to first grow and expand her business to a new and more profitable level. After that she says she will use her extra income to help give her grandchildren a better and more comfortable life than she has had; she wants to help them grow into smart and good adults.

Lujida says she knows that with God’s help, and this loan, her business will surely grow much stronger. She is very thankful to all of you out there who are helping her by supporting her in this loan!

loans.use: Purchase new varieties of clothing in larger quantity

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30 years old and has one child. He works and lives with his family in Nabatieh, a town in south Lebanon. He makes his living as a car mechanic, and has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the spare parts he needs to run and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a car-repair business

loans.name: Blasia's Group

texts.en:
Eight women who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring Women decided to form a new one with their new friends and neighbors. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experiences in the committee and explained to them how the committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women members of a committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is formed by 15 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing workshops, grocery stores, carpentries, stationeries, bookshops, sales of food, drinks, chairs, lingerie, medicines and candies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.use: Purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
H. Hamza is 36 years old. Hamza and his wife, who is a nurse, dream that their two children can have a higher education. In order to support the family and to ensure a better future for his children, Hamza runs his own business repairing  electronic equipment like TVs, radios, CD recorders, and tape recorders. Hamza also sells the equipment. Being a good repairman, Hamza is able to choose equipment of a better quality and attractive price for the clients. Hamza’s business is very stable and brings significant support for his family. 
Today Hamza requests 1200 Somoni (350$ US Dollars) for the term of 4 months. With tthe loan funds he is planning to purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment. Hamza thanks all for their support and says that he will repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness N. lives in ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria. Happiness is 32-years-old and is married with four children.

She sells electronic components. This is a skill that she learned in three months and has been in this business for the past three years. She is requesting a loan to buy more electronic components for resale . She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more electronic components for resale

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Rusilda R., who lives in the Barrio Santa Lucia zone, formed the committee after contacting her friends and neighbors. The committee is comprised of 18 women who live in the same zone. The women partake in different business activities such as clothing sales, foodstuffs, cosmetics, farming, etc. They are requesting a loan in order to purchase clothing, basic need items, and food, among other goods to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité fue la señora Rusilda R., ella vive en la zona del Barrio Santa Lucia, esta Sra. contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité. El comité esta constituido por 18 señoras quienes viven en la misma zona. Las señoras tienen actividades diferentes una de otra, como ser venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos, granjera etc. Ellas obtienen el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículos de primera necesidad, comidas y otros, para su posterior venta.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, costume jewelry, footwear, chickens, tapioca, soft drinks, basic foodstuff (sugar, flour, noodles, herbs, eggs, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Кудратов Рузибой .житель района Шахринау.Возраст 26 лет, холост. Клиент живет  с престарелыми родителями. Рузибой имеет небольшой лепешечный цех на местном рынке.Этот бизнеес явяляется основным источником дохода его семьи.Так как родители Рузибоя пенсионеры. На полученный кредит клиент хочет закупить  муку для выпечки хлебобулочных изделий. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Ruziboy K. lives in Shahrinav. He is 26 years old and single. The client lives with his elderly parents. Ruziboy has a small flat-bread shop in the local market. Because his parents are pensioners, this business is the main source of income for his family. When he receives the loan, Ruziboy wants to buy flour for baked goods. He plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing flour

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Lola es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Lola es natural de la comunidad de Quispillacta que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja 1 vez por semana donde vende frutas variadas y de la feria compra quesos, ajos, animales menores como cuy, gallina, los animales los vende en el mercado 12 de abril, mientras que los ajos lo pela y luego lo reparte de casa en casa y en algunas oportunidades lo vende ambulatoriamente. Además Lola junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el que realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad.

Lola necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra ajo y quesos. Lola sueña con mejorar su casa, hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien en buenos colegios.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Golondrinas Communal Bank. Lola is married, 24 years old, and has two children. She is from the Quispillacta community, which is located 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She travels there once a week to sell a variety of fruits and to buy cheeses, garlic, and small animals such as guinnea pigs and chickens from the market. She sells the animals in the market on April 12, while the garlic she peels and then distributes house to house and on some occasions she sells it as a street vendor. Additionally, Lola and her husband have a mototaxi, which they use to transport passengers to the city.

Lola needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in buying garlic and cheese. Lola dreams of improving her house, expanding her business, and having her children study in good schools.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying garlic and cheese

loans.name: Loeny

texts.en:
Loeny S. V. is 23 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and two children. She has been selling desserts in front of her home since 2004, and earns about $3.50 per day. Her husband, Sm Visal, is 25 and owns a parking lot earning $2.50 per day. Their oldest child goes to school and the other is too young to attend. Their average household expenses are $50 per month.

Loeny S. V. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Purchase a motor-bike for her husband to commute to work, and also to increase her own business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy S. is 26 years old and a rice farmer, who also raises female ducks to make eggs to sell wholesale to customers. His wife, Mrs. Sokthavy Noun, 20, is also a farmer and has two young children who live at home. They live in Svayloung Commune in Pursat Province.

Thy applied for a loan of 1,500,000 riel ($375) to purchase more ducks for breeding and hopes that a loan will help him to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks

loans.name: Kpakpo

texts.fr:
Né le 04 octobre 1975 à Aného, Monsieur A. Kpakpo est célibataire avec deux (02) de ses frères et sa mère à charge. Exerçant le métier de photographie, il tire l’essentiel de ses revenus de là pour nourrir sa famille et se prendre en charge. Très populaire et sollicité de par la qualité de ses services rendus, il se trouve confronté à un problème de déplacement ; ceci a fait chuter sensiblement son chiffre d’affaire et a affecté son niveau de vie. 
En effet, il n’arrive plus à répondre aux nombreuses sollicitations et beaucoup de ses clients se dirigent vers d’autres photographes. Face à cette situation aux conséquences incalculables, il sollicite un financement pour se doter d'un appareil photos plus performant et d’un moyen de déplacement afin de récupérer ses clients et surtout accroître son chiffre d’affaires susceptible de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kpakpo A. was born on October 4, 1975 in Aného, he is single and is financially responsible for his brothers ' two children and his mother. He is a photographer and derives most of his income comes from this trade to feed his family and support himself. He is very popular and gets a lot of requests because of the quality of his services. He is faced with a transportation problem, consequently his income has dropped somewhat and this affects his standard of living.

Indeed he can no longer meet all of the demands and a lot of his clients are going to other photographers. Faced with this situation with untold consequences, he is requesting a loan to buy a better camera and a mean of transportation in order to get his clients back and mostly to increase his income and to hopefully raise his family's standard of living.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a camera and a mean of transportation for his work

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun S. is a villager in Lvea Sor Kandal village in the Kandal province. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn for living. She now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which badly affects her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sarun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make her crops more productive. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to dig a well to give her family access to clean water. Her husband, Mr. Chu Moeun, helps her on the plantation.

Mrs. Sarun S. is 46-years-old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive and dig a well for clean water

loans.name: Foyonan Valérie

texts.fr:
D. Valérie  habite le quartier de tokoin wuiti, elle a pour activité  la vente de riz et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2007, la demande étant élevée ces derniers temps, elle sollicite de chez wages un  prêt d’un montant de 130000F pour acheter 02 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile et des condiments d’alimentation. 
Elle est divorcée de son mari et a trois enfants  à sa charge.
texts.en:
Valérie D. lives in the Tokoin Wuiti neighborhood. Her business consists in selling rice and other food staples, she's been running it since 2007. Since demand got higher recently, she's seeking a loan of XOF 130'000 (ca US$ 260) from Wages, in order to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, and food condiments. She's divorced and has three children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, and food condiments

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou S. used to engaged in the buy and sell business.  However, due to some business difficulties, she then opted to start another business which is a community store.  In her store, she is earning an average income of PHP5,000 a month that she utilizes to provide the immediate needs of her family and as business capital.  To further improve her business, Marilou extended her wish to borrow a loan of PHP30,000.  She will use the loan to purchase different stocks for her store and hopefully achieve her dream of having a grocery store in their village.  She promised that if she will be given an opportunity, she will work hard and sacrifice to become successful.  

Marilou is happily married to Rodante S. and they are blessed with four children. The eldest is Mariel, 30 years old, married; Joyce, 28 years old, a college graduate and also married; Rodante Jr., 26 years old, college graduate, and the youngest is Love, 25 years old.

loans.use: To purchase different merchandise for sale

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Файзуллоева Махбуба проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование . По специальности экономист. Но по профессии нигде не работала. Уже два года работает в диллерском центре , где продает пластиковые карты и производит денежные переводы. Кроме тогопродает телефоны. Планирует получить кредит для увеличения товарооборота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahbuba F. lives in the Gissar region. She is 26 years old and has two children. She has a college education. For two years now she has been working at a dealer center where she sells plastic cards and makes money transfers. In addition, Mahbuba sells phones. She plans to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. She can pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing a new motorbike

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом – мужчина 48 лет. Женат. Отец 5-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Жена – домохозяйка. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает. Рынок находится далеко от его дома, поэтому он должен нанимать машину, чтобы довезти скот до рынка. Пока у Гулом нет машины. Но он надеется, что когда у него будет большой товарооборот и большая прибыль, он купит себе машину. Он надеется что кредит ему поможет в достижении его цели.
texts.en:
Gulom P. is 48 years old and is a father of 5 children. He has a university degree. He makes a living by buying and selling livestock. His wife is a housewife. Gulom buys livestock, feeds it for 2-3 months to fatten it up and then sells the animals. The market where he sells the livestock is far from his home and so he has to rent a vehicle to transport the animals there. Gulom wants to have his own vehicle. He is asking for a loan to expand his sales so as to increase profits, to help him get closer to his goal of owning a vehicle for transporting his livestock to market.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock sales

loans.name: Gara United Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed T. and Aminata J.. They named their group Gara United. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. Mohamed sells “gara lapper” materials – white cotton cloth, inks, soda, powder, etc. “Gara lapper” is the term used for locally dyed cloth. Aminata sells market food. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs have received from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had a lot of meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. Previous loans have enabled their businesses to grow and have improved their standard of living. 

Mohamed T. (left) is the leader. He was born in Magburaka. He is 36, married to a businesswoman, and the couple has two children. One child is in primary school and the other is still quite young. Mohamed has more than fifteen years of experience in business. With this loan, he will buy a bale of white cotton and inks.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia L. manages a small sari-sari (variety) store. She is 41 years old and the mother of two. She would like to grow her business even more. The income that she gets has helped much in paying the expenses at home and for the education of her children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise to sell. She thinks that by doing so, she will get a better income to support their needs. CEVI helps small businesses to grow by providing financial services to the poor. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Oimniso

texts.en: S. Oimniso is 45 years old and a very good entrepreneur. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her husband has no fixed job and this is the reason why, twenty-five years ago, she decided to start her own business. Oimniso started with very little merchandise but, little by little, her business grew and she also started to sell clothes with excellent results. She is very clear about the secret of success in a business. She knows it is the variety of products that she offers because if a client is looking for something that she does not have, he or she may never return to her. For this reason, she tries to always be with good stock. Oimniso is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season

loans.name: Asapo

texts.en: E. is 38 years old and married with five children. For the past three years, she has sold frozen food such as turkey and fish. E. is requesting the loan amount of 120,000 NGN to purchase more frozen food such as chicken, turkey and fish to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Ametowoyona

texts.fr: Ametowoyona A. est un jeune homme de 31 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. mécanicien 2 roues à Adeta. Avec ce crédit il souhaite acheter des outils de travail et aussi des motos usées pour les réparer et les revendre. Cette chance lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ametowoyona A. is a young man, 31 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is a bike mechanic in Adeta. With this loan, he wishes to buy work tools and also used motorbikes to repair and resell. This chance will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou S. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business providing tricycle transport services to the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marilou is requesting her 4th loan, for 5336 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicles for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicles for better service

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She sells drinks. She has been in business since 1998. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun sells jewelry, such as wristwatches, earrings, and bracelets. Abiodun is 30 years and married with 2 children. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase jewelry to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en: Scolastica J. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a phone accessories shop at Yombo Machimbo Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods from wholesale and retail sale shops at Kariakoo city business center and from other shops and sells to consumers at her shop. She has been in the business for three years and she uses the business income for her family's daily needs demand and for business capital. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and is married with four children aged 6 to 20 years, all of whom go to school. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she lives with eight people. She also takes care of additional family members.

Christine is a retailer, selling secondhand shoes and ladies’ bags. She works in Mengo in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for three years and is servicing her sixth loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Besides this business, she also sells herbal medicine.

Christine sells to all categories of people, both in retail and wholesale. She buys ladies secondhand bags and shoes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works in an open place.

Christine wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand bags and shoes. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow stronger and owning a whole shop of secondhand bags and shoes.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand shoes and bags

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She is a tailor and she also sells curtains and carpets. She is a hard-working woman and she is very diligent in her business. The demand for her goods is high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan amounting to N70,000 to purchase more curtains and carpets to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more carpets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Nymph

texts.en:
Nymph C. is from the village of Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Nymph is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nymph owns a specialized retail store, selling longganisa and chorizo sausages, and ready-to-wear Items in the local community. Nymph has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nymph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Nymph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Nymph is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Nymph from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en: 47-year-old Cesario is a diligent farmer. He has been married to Clara for 18 years, and they are blessed with four children. Farming is tedious work, but Cesario loves it nonetheless. He makes sure to rid his farm of weeds and other pests. He is now preparing his rice field for planting. He applied for a loan from CEVI amounting to 15,000 PHP. With this loan, Cesario will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies to be used at his farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Believe in God' group. Members of the 'Believe in God' group are petty traders in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. This group of entrepreneurs sell different types of commodities and have been in business for many years. However, their businesses have been growing at a very slow pace. They thus formed themselves into a group of three and applied for a loan of SLL 2,400,000 from SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo.

The leader of the group is Ramatu J. on the left in the photo. Ramatu was born in Barsa town, Waterloo. She is fifty-two years of age. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer and three of her children are attending secondary school. For nearly twenty years now, Ramatu has been selling cottons, beans, oil, butter, rice, onion, Maggi (used in sauce), and so on. Ramatu wants a loan in order to expand her business. She will use her share of the loan to buy five lengths of cotton, five gallons of oil, one bag of beans and one packet of Maggi.

loans.use: To buy five lengths of cotton, five gallons of oil, one bag of beans and one packet of Maggi.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of two children who go to school. She lives at Axim in the western region of Ghana.

Axim is in the coastal area, and the major occupation for most women there is fish mongering and selling. Comfort takes a supply of fish from the seashore and smokes them. She has customers who come to buy them in bulk to re-sell to the final consumers.

Comfort also prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. Her business is progressing as a result of the good human relations she has with her customers.

Currently, her major problem has to do with funds to buy stock. Comfort would use the loan to purchase good quality fish to supply her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
Maria Claudia es casada, tiene 32 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a tres horas y 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, se vio en la necesidad de empezar a trabajar e instaló un puesto de venta de ropa para niños en el interior del mercado central del distrito de Catacaos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia por lo que dia a dia ella se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida debido a la calidad de prendas que ofrece y a al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, por ello está pensando en ampliarlo con la compra de más ropa, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre responsable y muy conocida en la zona donde vive. Sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona confiable y amigable.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia is married, 32 years of age and lives with her husband and their two children in the Catacaos district, province of Piura, in the region of Piura, located three hours and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Due to the fact that her husband works as a taxi driver and the income that he earns is not sufficient to cover the family expenses, she saw the need to begin to work and installed a stall to sell children's clothes in the interior of the central market of the district of Catacaos. This business is of a lot of help for the economy of her family for which she endeavors to get ahead day to day. Her business enjoys a good reception due to the quality of garments that she offers and the good deal that she offers her clients. Because of this she is thinking about expanding her business with the purchase of more clothes, but she does not have sufficient capital to carry out this action. For this reason she has seen the need for the first time to request a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. She is a very well known and responsible mother in the zone where she lives. Her neighbors and coworkers respect her a lot and consider her a friendly and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John H. is from the village of Taraka in the city of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, John provides van transport services in the province of Misamis Occidental. John has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. John has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC and he is now requesting hist 5th loan from GDMPC, for 50,000 PHP, to purchase spare parts for the van.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi van.

loans.name: Sévérine C.

texts.fr: A. Sévérine C. est née le 29 Novembre 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à WENON Abel, Sévérine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolariés. La famille vit au quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis 9 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Sévérine n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a 5 ans environs que Sévérine vend divers produits (couscous, pâtes alimentaires, conserves de tomate et de sardines, sucre, lait, riz, savons, mayonnaise, piles, bombons, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Sévérine vend de la glace et du yaourt à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de faire face à ses différents besoins. Sévérine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo. Sévérine a obtenu antérieurement trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Ces trois crédits ont été tous bien remboursés. Sévérine envisage augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Sévérine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sévérine C. A. was born on 29 November 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Abel Wenon, Sévérine is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. The family has lived in the Lokokoukoumè district in the town of Sèmè-Podji for 9 years. The couple provide for the family together. Sévérine only attended primary school. For about 5 years, Sévérine has been selling various items (couscous, pasta, canned tomatoes and sardines, sugar, milk, rice, soap, mayonnaise, batteries, sweets, etc.) at her home. Additionally, she also sells ice cream and yogurt at her home. This activity allows her to meet her various needs. Sévérine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Lomé, Togo. Sévérine has obtained three previous loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). These three loans were all repaid properly. Sévérine plans to increase the stocks of her products and better respond to the demands of her customers. It is for this reason that she is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (soap, sugar, milk, pasta, rice, couscous, canned tomatoes and sardines, etc.)

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 64-year-old married father of three. He operates a hardware business in Eastleigh where he sells building nails, bolts, glue, and metallic items among other products. He has been in this business for five years and employs two people. He describes his business environment as competitive and says that his customers are consistent. He has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy more nails, bolts and glue. He also says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more accountable. He hopes to open more business centers across Nairobi and supply the materials in large scale in the future. He describes himself as aggressive and patient.

loans.use: To add to his stock

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has a young child. She is engaged in a business of selling river shells at a local market in her town, earning an income of USD 4.76 per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.56 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Abejitas, inicia su primer ciclo con 7 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Vinchos, Comunidad D. Mayobamba.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cereales, animales menores, carne, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Agustina que es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 11 y 6 años, Agustina se dedica a la venta D. cereales que compra en las diferentes comunidades D. su zona, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad D. Pisco y Cañete, también venD. verduras. Agustina invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. verduras. Los sueños D. Agustina son ampliar su negocio, tener capital propio y educar a sus hijos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 2,200 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Abejitas begins its first loan cycle with 7 members, who are from the Vinchos district, Mayobamba community. The members do different activities such as selling cereals, small animals, meat, agriculture and livestock. Señora Agustina is married with 2 children, 11 and 6 years old. Agustina works selling cereals that she buys in different communities in her zone, which she then sells in the cities of Pisco and Cañete, and also sells vegetables. Agustina will invest her loan in the purchase of vegetables. Agustina's dreams are to expand her business, have her own capital and educate her children. The members need different amounts of loans such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 2,200 soles in loan with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Galsanpuntsag

texts.en:
Galsanpuntsag is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of his children, ages 14 and 15, attend a local secondary school. His youngest daughter attends local primary school. 

Galsanpuntsag operates a business making gold and silver goods in his town. From 1991- 2002,  he was a herder with a few head of livestock and operated his gold and silver crafts business from his home. Since 2005,  he has been operating only his gold and silver goods business, after he ran a grocery store for a year. 

He says, “Since I received the loan, my family's living conditions have improved. I improved my old workplace and increased my working capital. I have been planning to build a workplace at a local market.”  Galsanpuntsag is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase necessary materials to build a workplace for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a workplace

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is married with five children and three of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Aida is married to a businessman. She owns a retail shop in Kisaasi, one of the city suburbs, and sells to all categories of people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. She wants to use this loan of 2,000,000/= to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of wheat flour, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. After being with MCDT for five years now, Aida is boastful of growth in business and income. She has been in this business for 10 years. She doesn’t have any other source of income besides this retail business. Aida rents her business premises at 70,000/= per month.  The people in the community around her shop are Aida’s major customers. She works seven days a week. She aspires to see her business grow big and start selling at wholesale only. Formerly, Aida had a problem of thieves but managed to buy iron bars. Now she is faced with the problem of transportation as she incurs a lot of transport costs to and from buying merchandise at Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. Aida decided to work with MCDT because of the co-operation of the staff.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Solo A Lunyoro Zipolah Group

texts.en: L. Zipolah is an encouraging businesswoman of 48, married with seven children, five of whom are in school. She has been running a business baking pan cakes for over twenty years. She is using the loan to purchase pan cake ingredients such as cassava flour, sweet bananas and cooking oil, and to stock up on charcoal to ease her work. Her business is expanding and her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase pan cake ingredients such as cassava flour, sweet bananas and cooking oil, and to stock up on charcoal

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov S., 46, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

S. and her husband sell rice and animal feed for an income of USD 2 each per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 300 to repair her rice-grinding machine.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her rice-grinding machine

loans.name: Golden Sisters Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the “Golden Sisters” group. They are small-scale-business women in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses.

Nancy S. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. She is 33 years old and was born in Binkolo village, about seven miles from Makeni. She is married and has one child who is attending secondary school.

For three years now, Nancy has been selling gara lapper (locally-dyed cloth), women’s dresses and slippers/flip-flops. With her share of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying materials for making gara-lappers like caustic soda, powder, ink, etc. She will also buy women’s dresses and slippers wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gara lappers like caustic soda, powder, ink, etc., plus women’s dresses and slippers

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia is the mother of three children and the wife of Mr. S.. This small family lives in a three room brick house in a city of Pakistan named Borewala. Borewala City is famous for its shrines. 

Fozia and her husband have their own work. Fozia is a seamstress and her husband is a government servant. Fozia has ten years of experience in her domestic-sewing business. She does this work to financially support her husband because in government sector the wages are insufficient. She has a good reputation among her customers. In the past she sewed clothes of her neighbors, but later on her work become famous in the market, and now she gets the order from the boutiques as well. 
  
Fozia is a second year member of Asasah. She successfully repaid her first loan and maintained a good credit behavior as well. Now she is applying for her sewing business. She will buy another sewing machine for her business because her daughter also wants to support her in her business. With her help she can increase her business and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase another sewing machine for the sewing business

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba. She is 52 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Dionesia owns and operates a business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Dionesia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Carlos de 37 años de edad, y su esposa la Sra. Roxana que conviven hace 15 años cuentan con  cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, actualmente alquilan un lote ubicado en el barrio Tierras Nuevas, donde ahi mismo tiene su casa y su taller. 

El Sr. Juan Carlos es mecanico hace 14 años quien gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo consiguio comprarse un micro y un lote. su  esposa Roxana se dedica a la fabrica de sobres para correspondencia y luego los entrega a distintas librerias de la ciudad, y tambien administra la renta de su linea N° 16 ayudando a si mismo a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El Sr. Juan Carlos es cliente antiguo de la institucion siempre tuvo un  buen comportamiento de pago. El credito que se le otorgo es para la contruccion de su vivienda ya que ellos cuentan con un lote propio."los señores estan muy agradecidos por el trato que recibieron y la facilidad del credito".
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 37 years old, and his wife Roxana who have been together 15 years, now have four children who are all school-age. They currently rent a lot in the Tierras Nuevas neighborhood, where he has his house and workshop. Juan Carlos has been a mechanic for 14 years and, thanks to his job and his effort, has managed to buy a lot and a minibus. His wife Roxana makes envelopes, which she then sells to different bookstores in the city, and she also manages the income from his N° 16 bus line, helping her husband with household expenses. Juan Carlos is a longstanding customer of this institution, and he has always had a good payment history. The loan he was granted is for construction on his home since they now have their own land. The family is very grateful for the treatment they have received and the ease of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Belle Dame Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Belle Dame, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura, sous préfecture de Fana de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, de vêtements, de chaussures, de fruits et de la restauration.
Ces femmes du groupe Belle Dame sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments alimentaires, des fruits et légumes, des habillements et des céréales pour la restauration.
ASSAN K., la présidente du groupe Belle Dame compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires de diverses sortes.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises, généralement à Bamako où les condiments sont moins chers, et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce de condiments alimentaires.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Belle Dame group are all married, average 32 years of age with three children each and live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana (in the Fana Coura district) in the prefecture of the same name, which lies in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and neighbors and are active in the sale of condiments, clothes, shoes and fruit, as well as the restauration business. The women in the Belle Dame group are on their first group loan which will be used to buy condiments, fruit and vegetables, clothes and cereals for the restauration business. Assan K., the president of the Belle Dame group, is planning on using her loan to buy packets of various condiments. She gets her supplies generally in Bamako where condiments are cheaper, and she sells them locally in the market at Fana, for cash on a retail basis, and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be used for everyday family expenses; the balance will be reinvested in the condiment business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents. This young woman started her business as a beautician from her home. She has 5 years of experience in this occupation. Her business is very essential because with its income, she is able to help her parents pay for her university fees. As is common among young Lebanese people, she has a job and is pursuing her education at the same time. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying Business Management and this is her first year. In the future, she is planning to start her career working in a bank to gain experience and be able to help her parents with her income.

loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La  Sra. Vilma H. N.  ella  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ella vende de casa en casa, ella tiene cinco   años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo en mercadería,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Vilma H. N. has a business selling new clothing.  She sells door-to-door, and has been in this line of work for 5 years.  She has taken 12 loans with CEPRODEL, and with every one she has bought merchandise for her business so that she could have more merchandise to sell.  These CEPRODEL loans have benefited her a lot, since in this way she has improved her business and the living conditions of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Phork

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 48-year-old Phork S.’s daily activities, which she does in order to generate profit to support her family. She usually makes US $4 each day and has been in the business for over ten years. Phork S. provides this service to her neighbors: sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Phork S. is married to Mr. Chhey, 50, a local farmer, and they have three children. One of their daughters sells secondhand clothes in the local market. Currently, her daughter’s business is running well and she wishes to add more inventory to her stock. Phork S. is looking for a loan to purchase secondhand clothes for her daughter to sell.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for her daughter to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina P. is the single mother of a 3-year-old girl who lives in Karakol town.  She finished hairdresser's courses, but couldn’t find a well-paid job. Being a very energetic and hardworking person, Madina decided to start her own business selling vegetables.  She rented a selling place at the local market and managed to earn 10,000 KGS monthly.  This business became successful with the help of Madina’s mother who supports her in all activities. 

These two women got past many difficulties and were able to make their business a good source of income for the family. Now Madina plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to broaden the range of products she sells and to raise her floating capital in future.  With the revenue, she plans to give a good education to her daughter.  As for her personal plans, Madina dreams of marrying and giving a birth to one more child.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Ben (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Ben est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe est constitué de monitrices de jardin d’enfants, qui en plus de cette profession fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements,  les chaussures etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fatoumata Berthé est un membre du groupe Ben qui vend des habits.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des habits en gros. Elle se procure  des habits à Bamako. Elle vend à crédit et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée et au niveau des structures professionnelles. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe Ben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Fatoumata Berthé compte réaliser 190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
