Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Ben is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well.  They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives.  They are, on average,  forty-two years old, married, and have at least three children.  

This group is made up of child care workers who, in addition to this work, deal in various articles such as clothing, shoes etc. 

In order to increase their business activity, they decided to participate in the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  They are on their ninth group loan, having repaid all their previous loans.

Fatoumata Berthé, a member of the Ben group, sells clothing.  She plans to use her loan to buy clothing at wholesale.  She gets her clothing in Bamako.  She sells on credit and for cash at the main market in Koutiala to a varied and diverse clientele and to professional organizations. 

While the other members of the Ben group plan to make an average monthly profit of 160,000 FCFA each for this loan cycle, Fatoumata Berthé plans on making 190,000 FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, they will use a part of their revenue to meet daily family expenses.

They hope to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to keep their supplies well stocked.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Adjoavi a 45 ans et est mariée. Elle fait la vente  de produit d’alimentation générale et de ce fait remboursé déjà plusieurs crédits.  Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans d’expérience.  Elle achète souvent au grand marché de Lomé et revend  en face de Fucec  à  Lomé.  Elle demande  un prêt pour acheter 4 cartons de lait,  10 sacs de riz,  6 cartons de savons et 5 cartons  de sucre.
texts.en: Adjoavi is 45 years old and married. She sells general food products and has already repaid several business loans. She has gained 10 years of experience in this business. She often buys her goods at the grand market in Lomé and re-sells them in front of Fucec in Lomé. She is seeking a loan to buy 4 cartons of milk, 10 bags of rice, 6 boxes of soap, and 5 boxes of sugar.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. lives in the Mengo Mackay  neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, one of whom is in school.  Christine has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products from home by means of retail.     

Christine  has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, and rice.  

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale only and to educate her children up to university.   

Florence lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, and rice

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the last four years, Aidah has run a business selling charcoal.
To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Aidah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Aidah hopes to become a teacher. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to sing.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gorgorlou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité a été créé depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite en 2009. Il est composé de 26 femmes qui habitent différents quartiers mais qui chaque mois se retrouve pour les activités de leur Banc Villageois. Leur activité principale est pratiquement le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HERSENT2

Madame ROKHAYA N. portant des lunettes de vue et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait la vente de tissus et d'articles de mercerie. Elle fait aussi la confection sur mesures. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie pour revendre et faire de la confection d'habits.

Son objectif est de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et ceux de la famille par exemple la scolarité des enfants et la nourriture
texts.en:
This group was created during the first loan cycle with associated communal bank in 2009. It is made up of 26 women who live in different quarters of the city but they meet every month for activities set out by their communal bank. Their main activity is the management of a small business.  The group is a part of the communal bank named Hersent2. 

Mrs. Rokhaya N. is the leader of the group and she appears in the photo wearing glasses, and her image is reproduced above the crowd. She is 51 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children in her care. She also takes care of 3 other children who were left in her care by close friends. 

She sells fabrics and craft supplies. She also is also a seamstress. 

Her new loan will permit her to purchase fabrics and craft supplies for resale and she will also be able to fashion items of clothing.

Her goal is to cover her personal needs and those of her family, including her children's education and nutrition.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine owns a business that sells hardware. She is 35 years old, married and has three children. Her husband and she work together. Claudine  has been selling hardware for four years.  

Her loan will be used to buy to buy more metal items,such as wires and plumbing supplies. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and rent that house out to generate  more revenue. She dreams of having either fifteen or twenty million Rwandan francs  as her capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy more wires and plumbing supplies to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses: furniture making and an eatery. Her husband, Decembert, 36 years old, earns his living as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children, aged 10 months to 12 years old, 3 of whom currently attend school.

Edna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Edna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more materials so that she can continue to save up for the future. Edna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team."

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending/dried fish business. Her husband Jesenillo, who is 40 years old, works as a vendor of dried fish to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 6 and 20 years old. Rosalinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to purchase more stock so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. Rosalinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is  a 32-year-old married woman and the breadwinner of the family living in Hioma, Uganda. She has been running a business of shoes and hair weaves for two years. She started with capital of 500,000ugx, but now she has a stock of 1,200,000ugx. She hopes to set up a boutique. Hadijah needs the loan to buy shoes and weaves for selling.

loans.use: Buying shoes & weaves for selling.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh T., 26, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a farmer and raises pigs, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Sedemi Akoua

texts.fr: Madame S. à 32ans, elle est mariée à un étudiant et à 02 enfants en charge. Elle habite Nukafu. Akoua est couturière  et désire ajouter à cette activité la vente des articles de mercerie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle  a démarré l’activité en 2009. Son approvisionnement se fait au grand marché de Lomé et la revente s’effectue à Nukafu. Vu les conditions difficiles pour assurer  un bon niveau d’études  à ses enfants, elle désire ce premier prêt  pour l’achat des articles de mercerie afin de réaliser un profit et de voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mrs. S. is 32 years old. She is married to a student and has two dependent children. She lives in Nukafu. Akoua is a seamstress and would like to also sell sewing supplies on the side, in order to be able to provide for the family needs. She has launched this business in 2009. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Nukafu. Given the difficulty of ensuring a good education for her children, she is seeking this first loan to purchase sewing supplies in order to raise her revenues and help her family succeed.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Durante 6 años, Luz Dary P. trabajó con una amiga en la venta de mercancía, lo que le permitía contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues con lo que su esposo gana no era suficiente para abastecer dichos gastos. 

Desde hace algún tiempo y motivada con la ilusión de tener un gran almacén que les genere buenos ingresos a la familia, Luz Dary decidió montar su propio negocio, allí trabaja de domingo a domingo y aunque es un gran esfuerzo esta emprendedora de 43 años de edad considera que este es el camino para alcanzar su sueño y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Luz Dary necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y pagar algunas deudas, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. 

Luz Dary afirma que desde que trabaja se siente una parte importante del hogar, pues su aporte permite alivianar los gastos que mensualmente se generan.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Luz Dary Patino worked with a friend selling merchandise, and this allowed her to contribute toward the household expenses, since her husband's earnings were not sufficient to cover all of those expenses.

After some time, and motivated by the dream of having a large store that would generate good income for her family, Luz Dary decided to start up her own business.  Now she works there every day, and even though this takes great effort, this enterprising 43 year-old considers that this is the way for her to achieve her dream and improve her quality of life.

Now Luz Dary needs a loan to buy merchandise and pay off some debts, which will allow her to improve her earnings.

Luz Dary feels that her work makes an important contribution to the household, since she can cover some of the household's monthly expenses

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to pay off debts related to her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad. Él vive con su esposa e hijos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona rural de la provincia de Áscope en el departamento de La Libertad.

Los vecinos de Carlos Alberto lo consideran una persona trabajadora y responsable, que daría todo por el bienestar de su familia.

Carlos Alberto cuenta con dos años de experiencia brindando el servicio de mototaxi (la mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades; consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros), en su propio vehículo. 

Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que necesita para la reparación y mantenimiento de rodajes y carpas de su moto.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a 34-year old father of a family. He lives with his wife and children in his parents' house. It is located in the rural region in the province of Ascope in the department of La Libertad. 

Carlos Alberto's neighbors consider him to be a hardworking and responsible person who would give everything for the well-being of his family. 

Carlos Alberto has two years' experience in providing motorcycle rickshaw service (the motorcycle rickshaw is a public transportation service that is very common in Peru, especially in the small communities. It consists of a motorcycle and a cabin in the rear where passengers are transported). He has his own vehicle.

He requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to repair and maintain the tires and awning of his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the tires and awning of his vehicle.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Celia, la socia  tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es soltera; La socia  trabaja en una institución religiosa, ella es evangélica y su organización se llama Perú para Cristo, la socia es misionera y también realiza bellos trabajos en costure ría, la socia también sabe de piñatería para fiestas infantiles y todo tipo de manualidades, la socia  según la temporada realiza diversos trabajos, ella ahora requiere el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de materiales de costura, la socia desea comprar hilos, agujas, telas, botones y otros para tener e implementar su costurera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: Celia is a member of the communal bank Renovación. She lives in the district of Huanchac, located in the province and department of Cusco. Celia is 38 years old and single. She is a missionary, working with "Peru for Christ", a protestant religious institution. She also realizes beautiful sewing works and makes piñatas (*) for children's parties and all other kinds of handicraft, depending on the season. Celia applies now for a loan to invest in sewing materials. She wants to buy yarn, needles, fabrics, buttons and other items to keep her sewing business running. She values the granted loan and is infinitely grateful for it. It will improve her quality of life. Celia commits herself to repay the loan according to the agreed schedule. (*) Translator's note: A piñata is a hollow figure made of cardboard or from a clay pot lined with colored paper. Filled with fruit, candy, toys, etc. and hung up at parties, people take turns to stand in front of them blindfolded and try to break them with a stick. (Source: The Oxford Spanish Dictionary)

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sewing materials.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Tiene su familia, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, sabanas, toallas y ropa en general.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis sells general merchandise.  He’s been in this line of work for over 3 years.  He is a very hard working person who is devoted to his family and very proud of his roots.  He is a family man so he always strives to provide for their needs.  

The loan he’s requesting is to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothing in general.  He wants to be able to continue making progress with his way of earning a living which is most important.

loans.use: to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, tretments, sheets, towels and clothes in general.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a young mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband Rafat is a National Palestinian authority employee who had to find another source of income besides his work. Safa's husband started buying charcoal in bulk to sell to stores in the city. Safa's husband's charcoal work is bringing him a good income.  Therefore, he wanted to purchase a transportation car in order to start distributing to stores outside the city and gain more customers, Safa took out a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Safa is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a car to distribute charcoal

loans.name: Febbie Ann

texts.en:
Febbie Ann is 38 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Febbie Ann works very hard to provide for them. 

Febbie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, curls, and other groceries. 

In the future, Febbie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 39, has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He is married to Lydia and they have six school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to diversify his sources of income.

In the future, he hopes to expand and own many quarries.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
He is a 39-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children who are five and eight years old. Both of his children are in school. He and his wife run a general store.

He has run this store for the past six years selling sugar, rice, beans and other goods. 

He requires this loan so that he can purchase more goods that he will sell for a profit.  

In the future, he will save all his profits in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Victor  Manuel

texts.es: Victor Manuel, tiene la edad 51 de  años, está en soltero y vive con su madre. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de novillos para el engorde. El cuenta con un potrero apto para la crianza de novillos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación  para su engorde más rápido. El quiere lograr  que sus animales alcancen un peso ideal para su venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su madre y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 51 years old, single, and lives with his mother. He intends to use this loan to buy young cows for fattening. He currently has a paddock fit to raise young cows. He hopes to provide them with feed so that they will fatten up more quickly. He wants his animals to reach the ideal weight for their sale at the local market or in the surrounding areas. He wants to generate the best possible earnings for his well-being and that of his mother, as well as to grow his venture raising young cows.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Victor Manuel has not had any other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 30 years old, married and has four school-aged dependents. Three years ago, Gina started a mini-eatery at home to earn a living. She makes different types of foods for sale. Her husband is working as a driver in the community. She earns a total of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Gina joined GDMPC earlier this year. She applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional ingredients needed in food preparation. She personally does the cooking and accepts consignments to add to the daily income. Gina hopes to sustain her family with spare funds to sustain the business operation. She plans to expand her business area and offer alternative foods to choose from.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed in food preparation.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es: Blanca Irma de cincuenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en municipio de mucho comercio. Ella posee una venta a orilla de calle principal de artículos varios, golosinas, adornos, sandalias para dama y caballero, entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas siempre encuentran con ella lo que necesitan a buenos precios y con artículos de muy buena calidad, Blanca siempre los recibe muy amable y los atiende de la mejor forma posible, su lema es al cliente lo que necesite, además de ser una mujer muy entregada al trabajo es una mujer llena de metas para su vida y alcanzarlas es su más grande reto, una de ellas es ver crecer el negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita invertir comprando, sandalias, adornos, gelatinas, dulces, etc. Blanca Irma tiene la confianza que con su arduo trabajo logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: 50-year-old Blanca Irma lives with her life partner in a town with a lot of commerce.  She owns a stall at the side of the main road where she sells a variety of goods: candies, decorations, men's and women's sandals, etc.  Lately she has has had a lot of customers because people always find what they need at good prices and her goods are very good quality.  Blanca always greets her customers very pleasantly and serves them in the best way possible.  Her motto is 'give the customer what they need'.  She is a woman who is very committed to her work and full of goals in life.  Reaching these goals is her big challenge.  One of her goals is to see her business grow.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to invest in buying sandals, decorations, sweet treats, etc.  Blanca Irma believes that, through her hard work, she will manage to provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, decorations, gelatin treats and candies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 26 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, she has run a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Alma is a new HSPFI member.

Alma is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Segundo Guillermo

texts.es:
Segundo de 47 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Segundo  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, él trata en lo posible, desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así pueda tener mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Segundo es una persona responsable y trabajadora  que lo único que desea es que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo, 47, lives with his family in their own house which has electricity as the only utility.  It is located in the district of Zaña which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  The people of this area are involved in agriculture, livestock farming and tourism.

Segundo has a motor-taxi service (transportation used to cover short distances with a maximum capacity of three people) which he has been running for several years. He provides the service in the same area where he lives despite all the competition he has.  He starts out early to gather as many passengers as he can from different locations in order to increase his income and cover household expenses and necessities.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to pay for maintenance and buy repair parts needed for his vehicle.  This is so he can continue providing good customer service and improve his family's lifestyle.  Segundo is a responsible, hard-working person who only wants to the best for his children.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and buy repair parts for his motor-taxi.

loans.name: Daniel Natalio

texts.es: El señor Daniel vive en la zona de Villa Tunari en el Alto, el se dedica a la fabricación de sombreros de cholitas y también para señores, el vive en alquiler donde tiene un taller de sombreros de cholitas y de varones para lo cual solicito el crédito ya que necesita comprar material para la fabricación de sombreros,  necesita capital para realizar sombreros mas finos, el entrega la mercadería por docena a las tiendas sombrereras de la ciudad de La Paz, hace tiempo que se compro un terreno por la zona de San Roque el mismo que lo esta haciendo  amurallar y desea hacer construir unos cuartitos para irse a vivir en su propia casa y ya no pagar alquiler y desea dar a su familia mayor comodidad por eso trabaja duro y se esfuerza.
texts.en: Daniel lives in the Villa Tunari area of El Alto.  He makes ladies' and men's bowler hats for a living.  He lives in a rental unit where he has a workshop to make his ladies' and men's bowler hats.  That is why he asking for this loan, as he needs to buy material to make the hats and he needs capital to make nicer hats.  He turns his merchandise over by the dozen to hat shops in the city of La Paz.  A while ago he bought some land in the San Roque area.  He is building a wall around it himself and he hopes to build some small rooms so he can go live in his own home and no longer have to pay rent.  He also wants to give his family more comfort, which is why he works hard and applies himself.

loans.use: to buy material to make bowler hats

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a forty-six-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school while the others are all grown up. Her husband Mwinyihaji is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past four years. Her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transporting her products to the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to do business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, D. 54 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía D. Tomas, su esposo desD. hace 53 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, a los que cuidaron y criaron con mucho amor. Ahora ellos viven solos en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito D. Cajas Chico. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, durante las mañanas venD. dulces y bebidas en la escuela estatal D. su localidad, ahí D. lunes a viernes durante todo el día recibe la visita D. los alumnos y profesores. Además hace algunos años compró 2 autos, con los que realiza trasporte público cubriendo las rutas al anexo D. Auquimarca, en este negocio le ayuda su esposo, quien maneja uno D. los carros. Por otro lado venD. habas crocantes a diversas tiendas, donD. ella visita 3 veces por semana, ahí recibe buenas ganancias, pues es conocida. Luz siempre aprovecha las fechas festivas, donD. pueD. vender productos D. demanda, como semana santa, con los panes o Señor D. los Milagros, con los turrones, “me gusta estar activa”, asegura. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las Wanquitas” y este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, donD. esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura D. avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Luz D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. panetones D. diferentes marcas, para venderlos en navidad.
texts.en:
Luz, 54 years old, is a simple woman. She lives with Tomas, her husband for 53 years. They have 5 children who they cared for and raised with much love. Now they live alone in their own house, located in the district of Cajas Chico. She is a working woman. In the mornings she sells sweets and drinks in the state school in her neighborhood, where from Monday through Friday the students and teachers visit her. 

In addition, a few years ago she bought two automobiles, which she uses for public transport covering the Auquimarca routes. She helps her husband in this business, who drives one of the cars. She also sells crispy peas to various stores, where she visits three times a week, and makes a good profit, which is well known. Luz always take advantage of the  holidays, where she can sell products people are asking for, such as bread during Easter, or nougats during El Señor D. los Milagros [Lord of Miracles celebration of the patron saint]. “I like being busy,” she says.

She belongs to the solidarity group called Las Wanquitas and this is the fourteenth loan with MFP. She is happy, because she will have financial support, as this makes her feel secure as she goes on with her work. And she in turn promises to make her payments. She also likes being a member of the group because all the members are responsible people and very close-knit. Luz will use the money from the loan to buy many different brands of Christmas breads and cakes.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of breads and cakes

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio , agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atravez de fondo kiva  ya que durantes varios creditos ah logrado invertir en su cultivo de piña , ya que con las ganancias del credito anterior logro pagar su credito y comprar algunos bloques para mejorar su vivienda y su calidad de vida , ahora necesita financiamiento para poder aplicar fertlizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir plagas y malesas que se puedan presentar en un futuro .
texts.en:
Julio is grateful for the support that Afodenic provides through the Kiva fund. Through several loans he has succeeded in investing in his pineapple crop. With the gains from the previous loan he was able to pay his loan and buy some bricks to improve his house and his quality of life. 

Now he needs financing to be able to apply the fertilizers and the supplies necessary to fight the pests and diseases that may arise in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Wefwile B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wefwile B Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Wefwile B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Beatrice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Wefwile B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del Banco comunal “Corazón Esperanza” perteneciente a la comuna de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, además de la entrega de servicios, ya que tiene un Bazar, en el cual vende diferentes artículos de paquetería, juguetería y también un ciber.
Trabaja en este negocio desde hace un año y medio.
Su local está ubicado en su casa, ahí habilitó un espacio al interior. Ella  trabaja de lunes a domingo en horario continuado. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela y no existe competencia en el sector.
Con el crédito comprará juguetes al por mayor y adornos de navidad, especialmente para la temporada de fiestas. Además invirtió parte del préstamo en un permiso que le permitirá instalarse con un puesto en una feria navideña.
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar, para surtir mejor su negocio, además agregar la venta de ropa y comprar más computadores para el ciber, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con 3 PC. 
Adriana vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 38, 24 y 16 años de edad. Su hijo mayor es quien le ayuda en la atención y administración del negocio, ya que padece una enfermedad que lo inhabilita trabajar lejos de su hogar.
Uno de los sueños de Adriana es comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería, ya que actualmente debe pagar fletes (alquilar medio de transporte), costo alto para sus ingresos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta y participa de las reuniones impartidas en el Banco comunal, existe una muy buena relación con los demás integrantes.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, comenta que ha aprendido a organizar de mejor manera la contabilidad de su negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Corazón Esperanza” ["Heart of Hope"] communal bank, which is located in the community of  La Cisterna.

She works in retail and also providing services, as she has a store where she sells different types of paper goods and toys and also has a cyber-cafe.  She has been working in this business for the last year and a half.

Her sales-premises are located in her home, where she has set aside some interior space.  She works from Monday through Sunday, on an ongoing schedule.  She comments that it's going very well for her as she has many customers and there isn't any competition in the area.

She will use the loan to purchase toys at wholesale and Christmas decorations, especially for the holiday season.  She will also invest part of the loan in a permit which will allow her to set up a stall at a Christmas Fair.

Her goals for her business are to prosper, to stock up her business better, and also to add on clothing sales.  She wants to purchase more computers for her cyber-cafe, as for now she only has three PCs.

Adriana lives with her husband and three children aged 38, 24 and 16.  Her elder son helps her with tending and managing the business, as he has an ailment that prevents him from working outside of the home.

One of Adriana's dreams is to purchase a vehicle for transporting her merchandise, as she currently must pay for freight (renting transportation).  This is a high cost to cover on her income.

She is very happy and grateful for the support being provided by Fondo Esperanza, as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also enjoys participating in the meetings held at the communal bank, where she has very good relationships with the other members.

In regard to the trainings, she comments that she has learned to organize her business's accounting in a better manner.

La Cisterna is a community located in the south-central sector of the Metropolitana region.  It is essentially a residential and commercial community.  Originally it was a rural area with large plots of land, however due to the population growth and the advent of services, it has become an area that is 100% urban.

loans.use: to purchase toys at wholesale and Christmas decorations, especially for the holiday season.  In addition, she will invest part of her loan in a permit which will allow her to set up a stall at a Christmas Fair.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 46 años, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde hace 2 años intensifica sus labores ganaderas vendiendo animales como vacas y toros en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad y la comisión de sus ganancias se ven en el precio que  vende de acuerdo a las condiciones de los animales que adquiere, así mismo vende la leche de sus vacas después de ordeñarlos por las mañanas paralelo a esto cultiva la papa, quinua trigo y  maíz que en cada cosecha también los vende al por mayor en el mercado de abastos de su ciudad, en estas tareas siempre recibe la ayuda de su  esposa ya que esto aporta bastante a la economía de su hogar, uno de los planes de  Pedro es  sembrar pastos y forrajes para alimento de los animales que piensa adquirir en el futuro a fin de tener un establo ganadero. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Pedro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de alfalfa. .
texts.en: Pedro is 46 years and is known for being a hard worker.  He lives in his own house in Huachac with his wife and their 2 children.  Two years ago he began to intensify his agricultural efforts, selling cows and bulls at the local markets.  He also sells the milk from his dairy cows as well as grows potatoes, corn and other crops which he sells after each harvest at the wholesale market in his city.  His wife helps him in all of his efforts, which help support their home.  Pedro is planting food for the animals he wants to acquire in the future, once his business is more established.  This is his second loan with MFP, and he likes being a part of the communal bank because all its members are very responsible people and work closely together.  He commits to making punctual payments.  With this loan Pedro will purchase natural fertilizers for his alfafa crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Khorolsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorolsuren, 44, works in the television company as a janitress. She has been doing her job for many years and lives with her children and her husband in a ger, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. A ger is a portable, bent wood-framed dwelling structure traditionally used by Mongolian nomads in the steppes of Central Asia. The structure comprises a crown or compression wheel usually steam bent, supported by roof ribs, which are bent down at the end where they meet the lattice wall. The structure is usually covered by layers of fabric and sheep-wool felt for insulation and weatherproofing.

Her ger cover has been become very old and bad for covering. During winter, her ger becomes very cold. It is harmful for the health of her family members. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of a new ger-cover from the market.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a new ger cover

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
55-year-old Nemesio is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with 2 young children.

Nemesio has been a fisherman for 12 years. He works hard to earn money and sustain his family. Nemesio is also saving for his children's future education. He said he wants his children to be given proper education and to be successful in their chosen fields.

Nemesio requested this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Nemesio hopes to expand his fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married with five children.  Mila is 62 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City; Philippines.

Mila is a farmer and she is engaged in banana and corn farming.  She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her corn and banana plantation.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Mila hopes to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn and banana plantation.

loans.name: Muchadi

texts.en:
Muchadi is a student who comes from Klapanunggal Branches. He is a smart boy, but he has trouble with costs for school. 

His mother joined as a Komida client, and by dint of a Komida education loan, he can continue in school for his future.

loans.use: to pay for monthly school costs.

loans.name: Jituben Usmanbhai Meman And Group

texts.en:
Five women from rural Surendranagar in Gujarat, India, Jituben (the group leader), Sooltanben, Faridaben, Sushilaben, and Hasinaben have come together seeking to crowdfund an enterprise loan of Rs. 100,000, which they plan to repay in 12 monthly installments. They need this microfinance to fund the small scale businesses that they run, so they can invest in serving more customers and increasing profits. 

The income and savings they currently earn are insufficient to fulfill their goals of achieving financial stability and improving the living standards for their families. Sooltanben, Sushilaben, and Faridaben also need to guarantee enough savings so their children can access a good education. Your loan will help them take the steps necessary to increase their incomes and achieve these goals. 

Jituben, Sooltanben, and Faridaben buy clothes in bulk and resell them at retail prices to local customers. They will use the loan to stock up on more popular items like dresses, jeans, stoles, saris, and leggings. Sushilaben polishes diamonds, playing a role in the flourishing local diamond trade. She will use the loan to buy a special cutting machine, which will improve her productivity and income. Hasinaben is engaged in the local cottage industry of tie-dying, locally known as “bandhani”. She will use the loan to buy more cloth, so she can make and sell these fashionable, in-demand bandhani saris and dresses to more customers. 

These investments will lead to a growth of around 50% in their incomes. Your loan will help empower this group of 5 women to grow their businesses and achieve their goals of securing financial stability and uplifting their families.

loans.use: To grow their garment selling, diamond polishing, and tie-dying microenterprises

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: ANITA: Es una señora sonriente de 53 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada, con 11 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace más de tres décadas, vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi, mariscos y pescados, en un termo con hielo.  Recuerda con gran entusiasmo que inicio con C$ 3,000 (Tres Mil Córdobas Netos) con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. Solicita financiamiento para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: para comprar mariscos y pescados

loans.name: Joane

texts.en:
Joana Luis M., age 48, native of the District of Manhiça, a province of Maputo, did not have the opportunity to study during her childhood. After she met her husband, she came to live in the neighborhood of Guachene in the Municipal District of Catembe. They had six children.

She never had any training in terms of business management, and only attended the first year of elementary school.

Before starting her fishing activity, she worked with the sale of seafood for two years, buying from the fishermen and reselling in Catembe and the city of Maputo. Her husband worked at the Cigarette Factory and when the company closed, he received severance pay. With the money, he bought a boat and 5 heads of cattle, and having arranged a second wife, he went to live in a neighboring area with his new wife. Joana was then living only with her youngest child.

With the boat, she started to develop the fishing activity, having created two (2) jobs but it was difficult to get money together for the replacement of fishing nets and repair of the boat itself. Through some people in her area, she found out about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and went there to request financing of 12,000.00 meticais for the purchase of fishing materials (nets and other consumables), which improved the work and production conditions to some extent. With the credit paid off in seven months, rather than the sixteen months that were anticipated, she currently has a 5 meter boat. To expand, through this financing, she would like to increase production and create three (3) more jobs through the purchase of nets and painting the boat. She personally sells some of the fish in Catembe at a stand she acquired for that purpose, and the other part she sells to resellers. In addition to having generated jobs, her activity has a greater impact on providing seafood to improve the diet in her community (Catembe) and generates indirect jobs for the resellers who buy her fish and resell in the city of Maputo.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro Guachene Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Joana Luis M. Sector de Actividade: Pesca Valor de Empréstimo :16.385,00 Mtn (630.00 US$) Aplicação do montante de Empréstimo: Compra de materiais de pesca e reparação de barco Início: 13/11/2006 Fim: 12/11/2007

Joana Luis M., de 48 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Manhiça, província do Maputo, durante a sua infáncia não teve possebilidade de estudar depois que se juntou com seu marido, veio morar no bairro de guachene no Distrito municipal da Catembe. tiveram seis filhos. Ela nunca teve nenhuma formação em matéria de gestão de negócios, estando a frequentar o primeiro ano de Alfabetização. Antes de iniciar a actividade pesqueira, dedicava-se à venda de mariscos a dois anos, comprava nos pescadores e revendia na catembe e na cidade do Maputo. Seu marido, trabalhava na Fábrica de Cigarros tendo a Empresa fechado, foi indenimizado e com o dinheiro comprou um barco e 5 cabeças de Gado Bovino tendo aranjado a segunda Esposa, passou a viver num outro bairro vizinho com a nova esposa. Ela passou a viver só com o filho mais novo. Já com barco começou desenvolver a actividade pesqueira tendo criado dois (2) postos de trabalho mas, era difícil juntar dinheiro para a reposição de redes de pesca e reparação da própria Embarcação. Através de algumas pessoas da zona ficou a saber da existência da HLUVUKU -ADSEMA tendo lá se dirigido para solicitar um financiamento de 12.000,00Mtn para compra de materiais de pesca ( redes e outros consumíveis ) o que dum certo modo veio a melhorar as condiçoês de trabalho e da produção tendo pago o crédito em sete meses contra os dezasseis que estavam previstos, actualmente possui um barco de 5 metros de comprimento e, para imprimir maior dinâmica, através deste financiamento deseja aumentar a produção e criar mais três (3) postos de trabalho através de compra de redes e pintura de barco. Uma parte do pescado vende pessoalmente na catembe numa barraca que adiquiriu para o efeito e outra parte vende para as revendedoras. Além de ter gerado postos de trabalho, a sua actividade tem um maior impacto por fornecer marríscos para o melhoramento da dieta alimentar na sua comunidade(Catembe) e gera postos de trabalhos indirectos para as revendedeiras que compram o seu pescado e revendem na cidade de maputo.

loans.use: Buying nets and motor boat repairing

loans.name: Alougba

texts.en:
Mrs. Alougba K. is 56 years old and lives in the village of Agbanakin in the Lakes region. She has been a widow for five years, and is now the only one taking care of her six children, of which the oldest are unemployed. She specializes in the production and marketing of palm oil, commonly called "red oil" in the region. This is a business which she has undertaken for more than fifteen years; an activity which she has fully mastered.

She refunded all previously received loans, which have enabled her to have a more or less steady income. We the aim of securing and increasing her income to be able to provide to her family's needs, she is asking for a loan of $550 to buy palm nuts and wood in bulk for the production of oil.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 56 ans, Madame K. Alougba vit dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Veuve depuis cinq ans, elle est la seule à prendre en charge ses six enfants dont les plus âgés sont sans emploi. Elle est spécialisée dans la production et la commercialisation de l’huile de palme communément appelée « huile rouge ». C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plus de quinze ans ; ainsi dit, c’est une activité dont elle maîtrise tous les rouages. Les prêts précédemment reçus et remboursés lui ont permis d’avoir un revenu plus ou moins régulier. Dans le souci d’accroître et de sécuriser ce revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir totalement aux besoins de sa famille, elle demande un crédit de $550 pour acheter en quantité des noix de palme, des bois pour la production de l’huile en conséquence.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts and heating wood

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: Nahida is 38 years old and lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and lives with all the members of her family. She wants to support her husband and she took her 4th cycle group loan and opened a shop for her daughters who are also tailors. They want to support their family. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy some new machines to expand her business. She is happy because she has the chance to improve her family's future.

loans.use: To buy new machines and rent a shop for her daughters

loans.name: Choeum

texts.en: Mrs. Choeum S. is a 48 year old widow with 4 children.  She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, and helps her son (pictured here) who works as a carpenter/construction worker.  Her son, with her help, provides enough income for the entire family at about $4.50/day.  This loan will be used to purchase some carpentry tools to add to their business.  With the new tools, Mrs. Choeum S. and her son will be able to serve more people more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Adolat S., 40 is married and has 2 children. She has been in business for a few years. Adolat buys vegetables wholesale and then resells them at local markets. The wholesale market is located on the border with Uzbekistan. Adolat and her husband go there early in the morning to purchase vegetables from Uzbek wholesalers. Because Adolat resells at the below-the-market prices, she has a lot of clients. Adolat asks for this loan to finance wholesale purchase of vegetables, while the prices remain low, so that she can earn additional profit.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Адолат 40 лет, она замужем и у нее 2 детей. Вот уже несколько лет она занимается мелким предпринимательством. Она оптом покупает овощи и продает их по окрестным рынкам. Оптовый рынок расположен на границе с Узбекистаном. Она и ее муж едут туда рано утром, и когда узбекские оптовики приходят к границе, они покупают у них овощи. Цены Адолат старается придерживать ниже рыночных и поэтому у нее много клиентов. Сейчас Адолат хочет получить новый займ для оптовой закупки овощей, так как цены приемлемые. Это принесет ей дополнительную прибыль.

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of vegetables

loans.name: François Djiwonou

texts.en:
Mr. Francois Djiwonou Kotkpa was born in Vogan, in the South of Togo, January 7, 1976. He is a young man, who after his secondary schooling, sanctioned by the BEPC, launched himself into business alongside his mother. In very little time, he became very apt in this domain, however, he lacks funds to follow through his plans for his business. With as much good as bad and with all of the difficulties of life, he was able to set up a small business selling traditional style skirts(pagnes) in a small market in Lome. This activity is exposed to the elements, which makes it victim to sun and rain. To resolve his problems with his space in the market, he requests a loan of $1,000 to rent a storefront and to expand the stock of his merchandise. At this time of year, the sales of traditional style skirts is very high.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Monsieur François Djiwonou K. est né à Vogan au sud du Togo le 07 janvier 1976. C'est un jeune homme, qui après ses études secondaires sanctionnées par le BEPC s'est lancé dans le commerce aus côtés de sa maman. Très tôt, il s'est révélé très doué dans ce domaine, mais faute de moyens financiers, il n'a pas pu atteindre ses objectifs. Tant bien que mal et avec toutes les difficultés du monde, il est arrivé à assoire une petit commerce de vente de pagnes dans un petit marche de Lomé. Son activité se déroula en plein air, ce qui l'expose à tout moment aux pluies et au soleil. Pour palier à tous ses problèmes, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour la location d'un magasin et l'augmentation de son stock de marchandises en cette période de fin d'année où le commerce de pagnes est très florissant.

loans.use: Rental of a store.

loans.name: Hannah Amissah

texts.en:
Hannah Amissah B. sells provisions such as milk, milo, Pepsodent, sugar, rice, and biscuits. She is married with one daughter aged 14 years. Her husband is a photographer, and his income is low. To help with the family finances, Hannah works very hard. She also buys eggs and distributes them to her customers. Her shop is also located at a busy market here in Cape Coast.

One major challenge that Hannah faces is that she has to make an advance payment before she receives her supply of eggs. At the moment, she has lots of orders from her customers for the supply of eggs. Hannah is asking for a loan of US $1,100 to enable her to buy more eggs and supply them to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase (eggs, chickens)

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.en:
D. Muhtor is 25 years old. He is married with one child.

Muhtor and his wife, who is pictured,  run a family business. Muhtor repairs the sewing machines and his wife is the seamstress sewing the national dresses. Both work at home, accepting the orders and performing their activities. The family business is quite successful and generates the stable income. 

Today Muhtor requests 2 000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. The loan shall be spent to purchase the equipment need to repair sewing machines. This is the first loan for Muhtor and he promises to pay it in a timely manner

loans.use: To purchase of the equipment to repair a sewing machine

loans.name: Solekan

texts.id:
Solekan is a toys seller. He has 2 employees. One of the product that he sells is a candies that are being packaged with toys as gift. One candies package like this cost him IDR 60 thousand (approx of USD 6.6) and he sells this for IDR 100 thousand per package (approx of USD 11). In one day he can sell around 6 to 10 packages.

In a day he can earn a net profit for himself around USD 10.

At the moment Solekan needs additional capital of IDR 7 million (USD 775). This money will be used to add the merchandise as he wants to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Bersama dua orang tenaga kerja yang dimilikinya, Solekan menjalankan usaha Jual Mainan. Salah satu produk yang ia jual adalah permen berhadiah. Satu paket permen dibutuhkan modal sebesar Rp 60.000,00. Sementara dia menjualnya seharga Rp 100.000,00/paketnya. Dalam sehari dia bisa menjual antara 6 -10 paket. Saat ini Solekan mengajukan pinjaman modal sebesar Rp 7.000.000,00. Jumlah tersebut akan digunakan untuk menambah stok barang dagangannya, karena dia ingin mengembangkan usahanya. Asumsinya dia membutuhkan tambahan stok produk mainan lainnya – selain permen berhadiah – sehubungan dengan permintaan langganannya. Secara keseluruhan keuntungan per harinya mencapai Rp 100.000,00.

loans.use: To add merchandise (Menambah stok barang dagangannya)

loans.name: Zendia B 2009-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ester G.. She is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Ester is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging from age 15 to 18 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to feed her children and pay school fees.

Ester is joined in her small group by Anna M., Rose P., Rose P., and Martha C.. Anna M. has a business in baking cakes and wants to expand the business. Rose P. is currently operating a business in selling charcoal and wants a loan to expand the business. Rose P. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand her business. Martha C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Complete finishing home's exterior / Terminación de los acabados en el exterior

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 46 years old mother of two. She lives with her family in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Zeinab owns a mini-market. This is the first time she has applied to Al Majmoua for a loan. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Albatoul

texts.fr:
Mrs Albatoul B. is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children and husband in Kaboïla II, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After failing to succeed in several different types of businesses, she started a business of buying and selling heating wood and locally manufactured soaps twenty five (25) years ago. For the past six (6) years, she has been part of the Soro Yiriwaso credit program in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. After being given 4 group loans through an association of women from her district (Association BENKADI of KABOILA II), this is now her 4th individual loan. With this new loan, she intends to buy 2 truck loads of wood for heating and five (5) baskets of locally-manufactured soap from Sikasso and its surrounding towns (Tabarako, Missirikoro, etc.). She resells her goods for cash or credit from her residence to a clientele of mostly women. She plans to increase her monthly income to 75.000 FCFA which will be used to help her husband, to pay the interest on the loan and to reinvest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame Albatoul B. est agée de 46 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux à Kaboïla II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Après avoir mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans reussite, elle décida de se consacrer finalement aux activités d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe et de savons de fabrication locale il y a maintenant vingt cinq (25) ans. Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle decida de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis six (6) ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires au sein d’une association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de KABOILA II), elle est à son 4 ème prêt individuel. Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau pret 2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe et cinq (5) paniers de savon de fabrication locale dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso (Tabarako, Missirikoro, etc.) mais aussi dans la ville de Sikasso. Elle revend ses marchandises en détails au comptant et à crédit à son domicile où elle mène cette activité à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui servira à aider son époux, à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investira le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of wood for heating and locally-made soap

loans.name: Bahrija

texts.en:
Bahrija is a 31-year-old woman living in Sarajevo. She is divorced, and is raising her seven-year-old on her own. Bahrija makes a living running a bistro, a small restaurant where she sells an assortment of coffee and light meals. She also receives a small welfare allowance for her child in the amount of 50 KM a month.

This is her first loan with Zene za Zene, and she has requested 1200 KM to purchase some supplies for her restaurant. She will spend this loan mostly on food, and it is her hope to increase her business by offering some new meals at her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy some more inventory for her restaurant

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet was born in 1974, is married, and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region in the Alkhanli village. He has been in this business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy foods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy foods to improve his business

loans.name: Rosibel Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosibel  es viuda tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad uno de ellos trabaja y le ayuda economicamente y su hija  le ayuda con el negocio ya que ella se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y elaboracion de tortillas, su actividad la empieza a partir de las cuatro de la mañana ellas venden para el desayuno y almuerzo una parte la venden en su casa y la otra la salen a entregar,  la señora Rosibel lleva once creditos con fundación los cuales todos han sido para capital de trabajo, manifiesta que uno de sus grandes sueños es poder mejorar su casita ya que esta en muy mal estado y  poder heredarles a sus hijos un techo mas digno manifiesta que agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le hemos tenido y espera que le sigamos brindando nuestro apoyo para asi poder lograr cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel is a widow with two grown children. Her son is working and helps her out economically, and her daughter helps in the business. She sells cooked beans and makes tortillas, starting at four in the morning selling for breakfast and lunch. They sell some from their house, the rest they deliver. Mrs. Rosibel has eleven credits with the foundation, which have been for working capital. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to improve her little house, since it is in very poor condition, and to be able to leave her children a decent roof over their heads. She appreciates the help and confidence that have been given to her, and she hopes that we will keep offering our support so she will be able to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yeam

texts.en:
Mr. Yeam V. is a farmer in Snoul Village in the Takeo Province. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates rice.

He faces a small hurdle in cultivating his field because he does not own animals to help plow the rice field. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan so he can hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice fied. With the rest of the loan, he will buy fertilizers to support his crop.

His wife Mrs. Toun Sophea is a housewife. She cooks food for the family and takes care of the children. Mr. Yeam V. is 37 years old and the father of two children. The children attend the local school. After they study, they help the family by breeding hens.

Mrs. Toun Sophea is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S., 59, is married and has 8 children. She is a housewife, cooking for her family members and taking care of the household. Mom S. and her family live in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Her husband, Tep Van, is 78 years old and earns income growing rice crops and selling them at a market. On average, Tep Van makes US$4 per day. The family is financially supported also by two of the children who work as construction workers and make around US$3 per day each. At present, Mom S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to be able to have an easier commute to work. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for her husband's rice farming business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. She is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Norma bakes traditional Peruvian breads, like “wawa” and “chapla,” as well as sweet breads. She bakes them in a rented oven and sells them from a market stand she rents. 

Norma is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar and flour. The 1000 soles will pay for about nine sacks of flour, or four of five sacks of flour and a few sacks of sugar.  

Norma’s dream for the future is to buy her market stand and to own a home of her own.

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour and sugar

loans.name: Veronica J

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Veronica M. from Kyela. She is married with two children aged 11 and 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them.

Veronica has been running a crops-selling business since 2004. Client’s business is buying crops from farmers and bring them at town where she can sell it at higher price. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members.

Veronica currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Veronica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Bernardina Delia

texts.es:
Bernardina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Bernardina es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Bernardina tiene una panadería en su casa en donde elabora todo tipos de panes, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de personal, sus ventas los realiza en su mismo horno. Además Bernardina tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes y también tiene un locutorio.
Bernardina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos.
Los sueños de Bernardina son sacar adelante a sus hijos con una profesión, ampliar su negocio y que toda su familia gocé de buena salud.
texts.en:
Bernard is a member of the Divine Love Community Bank. Bernardina is married, is 56, and has 3 children. Bernardina has a bakery in her house where she makes all kinds of bread, for which she counts on personal assistance, her sales are realized in her own oven. Also Bernardina has a bodega in her house. Bernardina needs a loan of 2000 soles which will be invested in buying flour. Bernardina's dreams are to move her children forward with a profession, to grow her business and that her whole family has good health.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Wule

texts.en: Wule is 41 years old and married with a child. She sells foodstuffs such as bags of rice and beans. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Salif Y.  a 50 ans, polygame et père de sept  enfants, il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment l’achat-vente des appareils électroniques (radios, cassette, panneaux Satellitaires, Antennes Paraboliques, Batteries et divers) il y a maintenant plus de 25 ans. Il rejouit d’une forte réputation dans ce secteur et reçoit beaucoup de commandes.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il sollicite la collaboration de l’institution avec qui  il est à son  2ème prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 radios de marques différentes, 2 panneaux satellitaires, 5 batteries blindées, 5 antennes paraboliques et 200 cassettes. 
Il  s’approvisionne à Bamako pour venir  revendre à Sikasso dans sa boutique sise à la gare routière à côté de la compagnie Kènèdougou Voyage. Parallèlement à sa boutique, il vend aussi des téléphones portables par commande. Il a comme clients les voyageurs, les routiers etc. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant et d’autres à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 400 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Y., age 50, is polygamous and the father of seven children. He resides with his two wives and his children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to go to school, and after having done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, he got introduced over 25 years ago to commercial business, notably buying and selling electronic equipment (radios, cassettes, solar panels, satellite dishes, batteries, etc.) He enjoys a fine reputation in this domain and receives many orders.

In his search for added financial resources, he applied to collaborate with the institution (Soro Yiriwaso micro-financing) and is now on his second individual loan, which will enable him to buy 15 radios of various brands, 2 solar panels, 5 shielded batteries, 5 satellite dishes, and 200 cassettes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako to be sold in Sikasso in his shop located at the bus station next to the Kènèdougou Voyage company. Along with his shop, he also sells mobile phones by special order. For customers, he has travelers, bus drivers, etc. Certain customers pay cash and others, on credit.

With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 400,000 francs CFA. With these profits in hand, he intends to cover most of his expenses and those of his family, to make the interest payments, and to invest the rest in his main business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy radios, solar panels, satellite dishes, batteries, and K7 cassettes

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda  inició el negocio porqué siempre le gustaron las ventas y además podía tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar con los gastos de la casa y también ayudar a sus hijas. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1989 inició el negocio primero con una especie de tiendita en la que vendía productos de primera necesidad, después puso una tortillería porqué se dio cuenta que por la colonia no había ninguna y tanto los vecinos como ella tenían que ir muy lejos a comprarlas. Por un tiempo funcionaron bien ambos negocios pero despues  batallo para encontrar empleados de confianza y decidio cerrarlos. Desde hace una año y medio inicio con la venta de productos para el hogar  y con esta actividad ella puede establecer sus horarios de trabajo y no tiene que depender de un horario fijo.
 
Cuando comenzo con esta actividad tenía muy pocos clientes, pero empezo a ofrecer sus productos con amistades,  vecinos y  antiguos clientes se enteraron que vendía dichos productos y comenzaron a comprar, actualmente pues ya cuento con un buen numero de clientes.



Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5000 para poder adquirir productos para surtir los pedidos pendientes que le han solicitado sus clientes para poder ofrecerles un buen servicio y de esta manera aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosenda started her business because she has always liked sales and, also, she could have an extra income that would allow her help with the household expenses and also help her daughters. She began the business in March of 1989. She had a type of small store where she sold basic necessities. Then she started a tortilla shop because she realized that there wasn’t one in the neighborhood, and she and her neighbors had to go a long way to buy them. For a while, both businesses worked well, but then she began to have problems finding trustworthy employees, so she decided close them. A year and a half ago, she began selling house wares and with this business she has been able to establish her work schedule and she doesn’t have to have a fixed schedule. When she began this business, she had very few customers, but she began to offer her products to friends, neighbors, and previous customers. They found out she was selling these products and they began to buy. She now has a good number of customers. She needs a loan of MXN $5000 to purchase products to supply the orders that she has from her clients, so that she will be able to offer them good service and thereby increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Radjabgul

texts.ru: Саидова Раджабгуль жительница района Рудаки.Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Старший сын работает таксистом , и он один является кормильцем семьи. Но Раджабгуль занимается земледелием и в сезон зарабатывает неплохие деньги. Поэтому сейчас она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует получить и использовать для закупки семян овощей и удобрений.
texts.en:
Radjabgul S. lives in the Rudaki district. She is 47 years old, married and has five children. Her oldest son works as a taxi driver and is the only one who provides for the family. However, Radjabgul is involved in agriculture and makes fairly good money in season. This is why she requested a loan from us now. She plans to use the money to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jesus Divino Group
