texts.es: El grupo "Jesús Divino" es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado D. dieciséis  personas,  D. las cuales 4 son hombres y 12 mujeres todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades, los hombres son transportista,  algunas D. las mujeres tienen sus propias ventas D. abarrotes en sus domicilios y otras se dedican a la venta D. empanadas en los colegios, venta D. ropa, etc. siempre con el compromiso D. seguir creciendo. El ámbito comercial es bastante competitivo y se requiere D. capital para seguir en la lucha por salir adelante es ahí donD. los fondos otorgado por nuestra institución coadyuvan al mejoramiento D. fuentes D. ingreso mejorando sus herramientas D. trabajo y con la compra D. mercadería D. mejor calidad para poder  obtener un mejor ingreso diario. Los socios no tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios pero saben como manejar los fondos otorgados y hacer crecer más sus negocios para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y poder cumplir con las obligaciones que cada uno D. los socios tiene.
texts.en:
The group "Jesús Divino" is a new group maD. up of 16 persons, 4 men and 12 women, who work in different activities. The men are in transportation, some of the women sell groceries out of their own homes and others sell empanadas at schools, sell clothing, etc., always with the commitment to keep growing. The market is quite competitive and requires capital to stay in the struggle to get ahead. This is where the funds granted by Fundación Agrocapital helps improve their sources of income, by improving their working tools and with the purchase of better-quality merchandise to they can obtain a daily income. The members do not have much experience in support groups but they know how to manage their loans and to make their businesses grow so that they can proviD. their families with a better standard of living and meet the obligations each of them have with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Darwisa

texts.en: Mrs. Darwisa V. is seeking a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items for her sari-sari store. She is 30 years old, married and presently living at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.She became a member of Paglaum MPC in May, 2009. She hopes to have a successful business with a concrete store. She wants her children to finish college and have a good future.

loans.use: Capital for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Naqibullah

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Naqibullah, the son of K.. He is resident of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 35, married, and the father of 4 children, who are still small. He is in the business of selling wood. He is happy working there. He would like to open a shop and increase his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to buy all the requirements to progress his business.
He his happy that effective processes, such as kiva’s, exist in the world to support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Progressing his business.

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balbina Elías, es casada tiene 49 años tiene 9 hijos y se dedica a crianza de pollos y marranos también hace tejidos típicos su crédito lo necesita para comprar comida para sus animales y comprar mas marranos ya que saco los mas grandes el mes pasado, y sus sueños son sembrar café en un terreno abandonado y que sus hijos sigan estudiando tiene una hija que esta en 3ro básico y ella se siente feliz por eso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Balbina Elías is 49 years old, married, and has 9 children. She works raising chickens and hogs, as well as doing traditional weaving. She requires a loan to buy food for her animals, and to buy more hogs since she sold the largest ones last month. She hopes to grow coffee on an empty plot of land, and that her children continue studying. She has a daughter nearly finished high school, which makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens and hogs for resale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and married to Felix, who is a laborer, and they have four children ranging in age from 17 to 23.

Elisa has had her variety store for three years and has had a total of nine loans from ASHI, all of which helped her with her business and helped her to raise her family up from poverty. She paid them all back 100% and on time.

With 17,000 Pesos of this 35,000 Pesos loan, Elisa will be able to purchase groceries for her variety store. The remainder, she is planning to use for a welding machine for her husband's work and, with the little bit left, a fishing net so that they might start a fishing business too. It's very wise here to have more than one income, since weather and other factors affect businesses and Elisa has been working hard for years to be able to start to diversify her business.

Elisa’s dream is that, someday, her small store will become a bigger store but, more than anything, she wants good health for her family and education for their futures so they might not have to live in poverty.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: To buy goods for her variety store and a welding machine for her husband

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is married with two children. He repairs and paints car bodies in the suburbs of Beirut and he requests $2,000 to buy a welding machine. Ali thinks that this loan will change his life. This machine will help him improve his business and will attract more customers as well as make the repairing process more efficient.

Ali has been working in this business for eight years and he hopes to expand and improve his work in terms of space and quality. He is experienced at what he does. He is honest and he treats clients well and fairly.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel L. tiene 45 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depende de ella. Reyna se levanta temprano todos los días, por lo que tiene la venta inicia desde temprano y tiene clientes de lugares muy largos, pero lo más importante es que aquí obtienen tortillas de calidad. Los créditos que ha recibido de fundación le han ayudado para salir adelante, ya que por medio de ellos ha logrado obtener ciertas mejoras en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cal, leña. El sueño de Reyna es seguir mejorando su vivienda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working as a mason for the past ten years. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay his children’s school tuition. This is the first time that Badih has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have much experience. It wasn’t easy for him to develop networking. In addition, he had to learn the new technique in order to face his competition. Ali decided to do his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and to pay school tuition.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James U. is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years old. He lives in Rubavu district, West Province, Rwanda. He employs one person in his business and operates every day from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m..

James has been in the business of selling goats for three years. Before that he was doing agriculture activities and could not afford enough food for his children.

With this new loan, James will purchase more goats and, with the profits he hopes to earn, James will be able to continue paying school fees for his children and expand his business by purchasing more goats. He also hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda, age 58, is a corn farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has 7 children. Before joining CEV, she did not have enough money to buy farm supplies. High interest rates made borrowing difficult. Now, Florenda is thankful that she joined CEV. She can now purchase farm supplies with cash and repay a loan with low interest rates. 

She has requested a loan of Php 12,000 from CEV. Florenda will user her loan to buy the supplies that she needs to produce a healthy crop and a good harvest

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Benadetta

texts.en: Benadetta is 35 years old and married with four children aged 14 to 21. She has run a retail shop for the past seven years and sells unga (flour), fat, rice and other consumables. Benadetta is requesting a loan of Kes 40,000 to increase her inventory. In the future, she hopes to expand her business in order to better provide for her family and to eventually open a wholesale outlet. She describes herself as confident and determined. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fat, rice and sugar

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
“If others can, why can't I?” Some words of encouragement from Lovely D., a loving housewife of Leomar D.. They live in a village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya with their four children. Being parents, they want their children to finish their studies so that they will be employed someday. Despite our economic crisis, they still have the strong determination to uplift their status of living.

Farming is the common source of their income. They plant rice and some vegetables twice a year. Lovely is also engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in their village to help her husband earn income. She wants to acquire more vegetables to be sold at Solano Public market but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she wants to borrow P 7,000 to strengthen her capital and acquire more vegetables. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can improve her small business and increase her income for the sake of their survival and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is a 33-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has two children, the oldest of whom is only 5 years old. She is engaged in the rice farming business to meet her family's day-to-day needs. Like her other farmer friends, she has had to deal with traders in connection with her business, which--due to the high interest rates the traders charge--makes earning money difficult.

Now Nemia feels fortunate to be a member of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines and also a KIVA partner. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($325). With the loan proceeds, she would like to purchase farming necessities, like fertilizers, and to pay the laborers she hired to work at her farm.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing farming necessities and by paying laborers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señorita Sonia P. C., tiene 22 años de edad y vive a 24 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona oeste. La señotita Sonia es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. En casa de sus padres es donde tiene sus tres vacas lecheras que son su mayor fuente de ingreso.

La señorita Sonia se dedica a la actividad lechera desde muy pequeña. Ya que la familia tiene como actividad principal la produccion de leche y la agricultura, el conocimiento que tiene la cliente sobre la produccion lechera es muy amplio. Al mismo tiempo que se dedica al trabajo de campo ella estudia para profesora en una Universidad Evangelista cerca de su comunidad.

El presente credito sera empleado en la construccion de un criadero de cerdos, esto con la vision de diversificar sus ingresos y contar con una especie de ahorro, ya que la comercializacion de los cerdos se los raliza semestralmente.
texts.en:
Sonia P. C., 22, lives 24 km from the city of Cochabamba in the western area. Sonia is single, and she lives in her parents’ house. Her parents’ house is where she has her three dairy cows. They are her greatest source of income. Sonia has been doing dairy work since she was very small. The family’s primary activities are milk production and agriculture. She has a great deal of knowledge about milk production. She does field work, and she also is studying to be a teacher in the Evangelist University near her community. The current loan will be used to build a pig farm. She has a vision to diversify her income in order to have some kind of savings. She will sell the pigs biannually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a pig farm to start raising pigs

loans.name: Precious Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old, widowed, and the mother of three children. Her youngest child is in school while the rest are working. Elizabeth operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of soft drinks, such as canned malts, and canned and bottled drinks such as Coke, Pepsi, etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business and give her youngest child a good quality education.
However, Elizabeth says that without adequate funds it is not possible to realize that dream. She has been running the drinking spot for 15 years now, and she is requesting a loan to buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.
Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Precious’. She is pictured standing second from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food sellers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana E. de 22 años, vive en una casa de cemento solo tiene luz como servicio básico su vivienda esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en una camioneta haciendo fletes tienen 1 hijo de 7 años que estudia en una escuela particular.

Johana hace 2 años atrás regreso de España  donde aprendió todo lo que se hace en los salones de belleza poco a poco empezó a hacer cortes de cabello y tratamientos. Ahora Johana tiene su propio salón de belleza en la que trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00. Una de las dificultades que tiene es que la mayoría del tiempo tiene que estar de pie y eso hace que la circulación de la sangre en los pies le cause dolor.

Johana quiere comprar con el préstamo tratamientos, cremas, planchas para tener mas cosas en su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere poner una sucursal del salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Johana is 22 years old. She lives in a cement house that only has basic electrical service. Her house is located in “The Paradise of Guayaquil”. Her husband works in the freight trucking business. They have one son that is seven years old and studies in a private school. Johana went to Spain two years ago where she learned everything that one does in a beauty salon. Little by little she began to cut hair and do treatments. Now Johana has her own beauty salon where she works from 7:30 in the morning until 10:00 at night. One of the difficulties that she has is that she has to be on her feet all the time and the lack of circulation to her feet causes her pain. Johana wants this loan to buy treatments, creams and shelves to display more items in her salon. In the future she wants to have a franchise of beauty salons

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, treatments and display shelving.

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en: Zhora G. is 24 years old and he is a student. Zhora lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area. He studies in the Yerevan State University Economics department. His extramural courses and annual tuition fees amount to about $800. At the same time Zhora and all his family (father, mother and brother) are engaged in farming. They breed cows, sheep, chickens and bees. Zhora needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his cows and other farm animals. He plans to spend the expected profit on his education.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his cows and other farm animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a tire repair machine

loans.name: Ernesto Ramón

texts.es: Don Ernesto M. es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 1 año, donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, a él se le han otorgado 2 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y nos expresa que han sido de gran ayuda, ya que poco a poco ha mejorado las condiciones de vivienda para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Ernesto M. has been an employee of the Chichigalpa municipal government for one year. He is employed as a security guard, is married, and has two children of school age. He has been granted 2 loans which have been for the improvement of his dwelling. He tells us that they have been a great help since little by little he has improved his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for repairing the roof of his home (zinc, wood, and nails).

loans.name: Tatupu

texts.en:
"Tatupu M. is 53 and married with 4 children (ages 17 - 28).  She owns a business venture, selling puletasi (Samoan formal wear).  Tatupu has many years of experience in this business.  Tatupu needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tatupu joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tatupu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tatupu M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch L. K. is a 44-year-old married man who lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. He is a temporary construction laborer often hired by neighbors to build or mend their houses. His wife farms a small plot of land where she plants different kinds of crops. The couple has three teenage children who work at various occupations. Touch L. K. would like a loan of $600 which, with his savings, he will use to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Srey Chou's Group

texts.en:
This group loan, consisting of eleven people, is located in Preak Ta Choar village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Chou C. is a 27-year-old married woman and the village bank president selected by all the members. Each member of this village group will use the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Srey Chou C. and her husband, Mr. Hoeun Hieng, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate vegetables. Mrs. Srey Chou C. is also a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her vegetable selling is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. This couple has three children: two attend the local school while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Constance sells charcoal in Naguru Kasenke Zone in Nakawa Division, one of the divisions in Kampala District. She incurs transport costs to and from buying charcoal in the villages of Masindi in southwestern Uganda. She uses public transport to and from buying charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years now. Besides this charcoal business, she also owns a lorry for hire. She wants to use this loan of 1,500,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. Constance sells at both wholesale and retail and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week.  Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season, which makes roads impassable. As a single mother, she wants to educate her children up to the university and also to build rental rooms. Constance resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Constance joined MCDT because the services are at the grassroots.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita T., already widowed at 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is blessed with a child from her marriage, and she makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own eatery while overseeing her variety store and video rental business.

Amelita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the future success of her business, Amelita has applied for a PHP 9,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients needed for her recipes. She also will invest some of the loan to purchase groceries for the variety store.

She dreams that she will have her own stall so she won’t have to rent a place where she will sell her products.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her recipes and purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 35, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Her husband appears in the photograph.

S. sells food for an income of USD 2.50 per day while her husband is a motorcycle repairman, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase motorbike spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Kalpani

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana K. is 35 years old and lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati with her husband and two children. Her husband's name is Buddha Ratna K. and he is a house painter. Her son is studying in grade 6 and her daughter is studying in grade 1. The economic conditions of her family were not good because her husband's income was not enough to fulfill the family's needs.

So Mrs. K. started goat farming three years ago. At present she has four goats. She sells goat milk in the local market daily in the morning and in the evening. Now, she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk. So she is requesting a 20,000.00 Nepal Rupees loan to buy more baby goats for her business.

loans.use: To buys baby goats

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie T. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 34 years old. Elvie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as some food for snacks, sardines, candies, shampoo, soap & toothpaste, in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace L. is from Purok Makugihon, Punta, Dipolog City. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Grace works in a family business venture providing motor-cab services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. In 2007, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 2,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Grace is requesting a new loan of PHP 3,000 which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Hassanatu Sheku

texts.en:
Hassanatu is 36 years old. She is married, and has a daughter aged 10 years. She has 4 additional dependents living with her, who are her relatives and lost their parents.

In 2001, Hassanatu established her maggie (soup product), salt, African dresses, and pans business. She began this business because she assists her husband by providing additional income for the home. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, she earns about 1,251,200SLL every month from her business. 

She needs a loan of 4,500,000SLL. Hassanatu requires a loan in order to buy tomato paste, shrimp, pans, and clothes for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 337,824SLL. In the future, Hassanatu plans to further her education and help her husband support the home from the proceeds of this loan. All categories of people buy from her, but the majority of her customers are women. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Yanjintsevel

texts.en:
Yanjintsevel Y., a widow, lives with her two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai Province in Central Mongolia.  Her oldest daughter currently attends university in Mongolia's capital city of Ulaanbaatar, and her younger son attends a local secondary school. 

Yanjintsevel operates a bookstore selling a variety of books in her town, a business she started in 2003 that has become very busy over the years.  A very kind and generous woman, she is in good health and looks forward to continuing to grow her business in the future.  Yanjintsevel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to pay her daughter's tuition and housing fees.	She says, " My main goal is to make sure my children can receive a higher education."

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition and housing fees.

loans.name: Jorge Ricardo

texts.es:
Jorge de 20 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Cuando murió su papa el se hizo cargo de la tienda que mantenía a toda su familia, desde ese tiempo el la ha administrado bien, vende todo tipo de víveres como arroz, aceites y azúcar. Esta incluyendo en su tienda artículos para casa y productos de uso personal. 

El quiere seguir con su negocio para seguir ayudando a su mama y hermanas, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y azúcar. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y poder comprar un automóvil.
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old. He has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in an urban area called Guasmo. It is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are informal merchants. When his father dies, he took over the store that supported his whole family. Since then, he has managed it well, selling all types of groceries such as rice, oil, and sugar. He is inlcuding all types of household items and person use products. He wants to continue with his business to keep helping his mother and sisters. That it why he wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil and sugar. In the future, he wants to increase his business and be able to buy an automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve part of the roof of his house

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina V. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 28 years old. Angelina is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Angelina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is from Lebanon. She has owned her small grocery store since 2006. She features all types of food, dairy products, detergents, etc. Her business income is vital to help her husband who works as a farmer. Today, she is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her business and increase her shop inventory. She expects that her business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships is an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: increase her shop inventory

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan P. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is a salesperson in a grocery store and has a monthly salary of 200,000 MNT, while his son, age 3, stays at home. Since 2008, he has been operating sewing and wood product making businesses in his home. He also worked in the organization for project between 2009 and 2010, after completing university with a degree in accounting and economics in 2009. Currently, he plans to start operating a taxi service after purchasing a car, until he gets a new decent job. In the future, he plans to work as his occupation. Jargalsaihan is a modest and open minded man and says, "I want to save more money in order to buy a house for my family." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new car that will be used as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 29 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 7 years old.  His wife is a teacher and he runs a hair salon.  The salon is well-organised and well-established.  Janvier has had his business for 12 years and employs 3 people.  His salon is open from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day of the week.

Janvier has requested this loan from the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials for the salon, such as items required to do hair braiding.  He plans to reinvest any profits back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for hair salon

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a single man. He lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

He has operated his barber shop for the past two years. Neighbors and passers-by are his potential customers. Bonface faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During holiday season, he gets a lot of customers, but during the month of January to May, he gets fewer customers. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase a hair-cutting machine and hair oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a hair cutting-machine and hair oil.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en: Gerardine is 38 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children and one orphan she cares for. Currently, three of her children attend school. Gerardine owns a beauty salon, which she has had for 13 years. She will use this loan to purchase hair products and cosmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gerardine plans to expand her salon business and build another house to rent. She would also like to start a chicken farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.es: Reynilda, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Américo (31)  y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo Reynilda ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a comercializar hasta el mercado de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.Este es el segundo préstamo de Reynilda con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.Reynilda tiene planeado invertir  los mil  soles solicitados, en contratar peones para que  limpien  sus chacras, para que la ayuden en el cultivo de sus tierras, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Reynilda is 27 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Américo (31) and her three small children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Reynilda has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows coffee and bananas which she later takes to sell wholesale in Pichanaki market.  What she most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in this business for 12 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products to the city since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and they make her very tired.  In the future, Reynilda plans to buy new land to expand her plantations.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

This is Reynilda's second loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual in making her previous loan repayments and she hopes to continue this.  She takes an active part in her community bank and is always up to date with the agreements that have been reached in her group.  Reynilda plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in hiring laborers to weed her plantations to help her cultivate her land.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to cultivate her land

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: La señora Emilia tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que es una madre muy responsable y quería que sus hijos obtuvieran la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo que desde la edad de 26 años Emilia inicio este negocio, ella con el poco capital que obtenía por medio de su esposo logro ahorrar algo de dinero. Ella tenía que buscar el medio de sobrevivir con sus hijos y su familia. Y así Emilia no se rindió y ahora tiene este negocio. En la actualidad solicita este financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de mercancías para aprovechar el incremento de las ventas en los meses venideros. Su sueño es crecer en su negocio de tal forma que con el tiempo le permita llegar a establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Señora Emilia is 48 years old. She is married and has two adult children. She sells general merchandise. Because she is a very responsible mother who wanted her children to have the opportunity to go to school, she began this business at the age of 26, using the little capital that she obtained from her husband, and she managed to save some money. She had to look for a means of surviving with her children and her family. And thus Emilia didn't give up and now she has this business. 

Now she is applying for financing that will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to take advantage of the increase in sales in the coming months. Her dream is to increase her business in such a way that in time she will be able to establish a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: Working capital to stock merchandise.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe JIGUISSEME (5 mariées et 1 veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait la vente de pomme de terre à travers  de MARIAM D. . 
MARIAM D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  450 Kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO auprès des grossistes. La pomme de terre est revendue en famille et au marché de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguisseme group (five are married, one is widowed) are on average 42 years old and have two children.  They live mostly in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their second joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso because they want to be able to meet the demand of their clients. This group of women sells potatoes, as does Mariam D..

With her loan, Mariam D. plans to buy 450 kg of potatoes.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Sikasso from wholesalers.  The potatoes are resold within the family and at the market in Hamdallaye in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to meet daily family expenses.  

She aspires to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a 66-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a fishing business. She lives in Bais City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Felina is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Felina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org
.
"

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 27-year-old accomplished and hardworking young woman from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She lives in a small house in the suburbia with her husband and two kids. Her husband works at furniture manufacturing company and daughter goes to a kindergarten while her son attends local public school. 

She started running a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, in 2006 with 200,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in her working capital. At the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. At this time her stall had 1 million MNT in working capital. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.
However, in 2007, Ms. Odgerel had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. As a result of her hard work, today she has 2,500,000 MNT in her working capital. Besides that, with the profit of her business, she managed to build new small house for living and bought two yards to extend. Moreover, she has just bought a car, which is used for couple years, which has become essential need for her family. 

Altantuya is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT. With this loan, she wants to import more clothes for spring from Beijing, China. Her long term objective is to buy an apartment where her family can have a better living condition. Altantuya and her husband are trying their best to achieve their goals.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring

loans.name: Nasibahon

texts.ru: Нарзуллоева Насибахон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем. имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для вспашки земли, то есть берет в аренду трактор и для закупа семян.
texts.en: Nasibahon N. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years.  Nasibahon has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for land plowing, i.e. renting a tractor, and for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to plow land and purchase seeds

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 35-year-old Chhea S.'s daily duty at the garment industry. She has been engaged in her job for over one year and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a blacksmith in Phnom Penh city. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their four kids. All of the kids are attending school. 

Recently, their living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is surrounded by pollutants, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Chhea S. would like to request a loan to build a toilet for her family. She hopes to use the rest of the funds to repair her old kitchen.

loans.use: to build a toilet for her family and mend her old kitchen.

loans.name: Juana Catalina

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar. , Juana pudo estudiar la secundaria pero no la culminó.
La señora es una socia nueva, ella requiere un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de golosinas, comprará  una nueva carreta, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas etc., sus hijos la ayudan con el negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda bien abastecida y así superarse más.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el ahorro y el apoyo de las socias.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 41 years old and a single mother of five school age children.  She was able to go to secondary school but did not complete it.

She is a new member and needs a 500 new sol loan to invest in her snack selling business.  She will buy a new cart, cookies, chocolates, candy, soft drinks, etc.  Her children help her in the business.  Her dream is to have a well stocked store to improve herself even more.  What she likes about the communal bank is the savings and the support from the members.

loans.use: to buy a new cart, cookies, chocolates, candy, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Femme d’un chauffeur et maman de 03 enfants, Afi  a 43 ans et exerce une activité de revendeuse de condiments de premières nécessité à savoir  le piment ,de la tomate fraîche………elle fait cette activité depuis 1990 et par ce second crédit voudrait associer un peu d’alimentation générale(riz ,huile végétale…..). Mme revend au marché de Hédzranawoé après  avoir acheté au Grand marché de Lomé.
texts.en: Wife of a driver and the mother of three children, Afi is 43 and sells daily-use condiments, i.e., hot peppers, fresh tomatoes, etc. She has been in this business since 1990 and, using this second loan, she would like to branch out and sell some other food items such as rice, vegetable oil, etc. She resells at the  Hédzranawoé open-air market after buying her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé.

loans.use: to buy daily-use condiments.

loans.name: Lobiko Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie-Josée, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Lobiko Plus”, which is composed of 16 microentrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Marie-Josée is 63 years old. Her main activity is to sell pagnes, which are women’s wrapping clothing, in DRCongo. She buys the pagnes in bulk and resells them, at a profit. She sells her products daily at the market in his area, located north-east of Kinshasa. 

Marie Josée started her business in 1991. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to buy 25 pagnes, to increase her sales, in order to make a better profit. Marie-Josée makes a profit of about US$100 per week. The aim of this loan is mainly to increase Marie Josée's profit so she can buy food and also reinforce her business. She is a widow and the mother of eight children, aged between 23 and 40 years old.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying 25 pagnes and reselling them at profit.

loans.name: G.s. Mexico Group

texts.es: La señora Yamileth Del Socorro, tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos de pan que elabora en su casa, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Aduce que ha logrado mantener su negocio con ganancias y que su mayor obstáculo ha sido que cada día hay más competencia, debido al desempleo del país. Solicita el crédito para la compra de  en insumos para elaborar pan, como es harina, huevo, mantequilla, entre otros. Desea continuar vendiendo y abrir una nueva ruta de distribución para ampliar el nivel de ventas.
texts.en: Yamileth Del Socorro sells home baked bread.  She has two minor children.  She relates that she’s managed to stay in business with profits and that her greatest obstacle has been that every day there is more competition due to unemployment in the county.  She asks for the loan to buy bread making ingredients like flour, eggs and butter, among others.  She wants to continue selling and open up a new distribution route to expand her sales level.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and butter, among others.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been selling groundnuts and cereals in Naivasha town to retail shops for the last six years. He is 37 years old, married to Mary, and they have two children.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy three sacks of ground nuts to sell. He will repack them into smaller packets and distribute them to shops for sale.

In the future, Julius hopes to open up a shop from which he will be selling the groundnuts.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem, 42 years old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife is working in the garment factory. Their income is $4 per day. They have six children. Five are studying and one is working in the factory with $3 per day for her income. 

Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $10 on school fees and $10 on electricity. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to help his daughter to open a small grocery shop. For the rest of the children who are studying right now, he will try to support them in school at least through high school. 

He hopes that all of his children will get their own careers in the future.

loans.use: To help his daughter to open a small grocery shop.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masirika, leader du groupe d’affaire « Miujiza »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 25 ans, jeune mariée, mère de 1 enfant encore bébé. Elle est vendeuse d’articles divers. Son mari est un enseignant, instructeur. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une petite boutique (kiosque), près de son domicile. Il y a une année qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  2 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 casiers de Fanta, 1 box de sel de cuisine, lotion de beauté, biscuit, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne  acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Miujiza » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client, Masirika, is the leader of the business group called "Miujiza". She is 25 years old, a newlywed and the mother of one child who is still a baby. She is a salesperson for a variety of goods. Her husband is a teacher and an instructor. 

She sells her merchandise from a small store, or kiosk, close to her home. She has been in this business for a year. She has completed two loan cycles with the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan will be used to purchase two cases of Fanta, one box of kitchen salt, beauty creams, biscuits and so on. Additionally, her ambition is to purchase a plot of land so that she can build comfortably. 

She would like to thank Hekima for its work helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. It should be noted that the members in the business group "Miujiza" are mostly women.

loans.use: To purchase two cases of Fanta, one box of kitchen salt, beauty cream, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Juan Leonidas

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, fabrica aproximadamente tres hamacas por mes, en su casa de habitación, las comercializa y de ahí mantiene a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio como son hilos de seda de diferentes colores, también necesita comprarse láminas para el techo de su vivienda, con esta compra el préstamo no solo suplirá una necesidad del negocio sino que también una necesidad familiar, para que estén más protegidos.
El propósito de él es mejorar la vivienda actualmente, aunque para el futuro su proyecto es cambiar la estructura de la vivienda, ya que es de lámina y  la quiere reconstruir de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children.  He manufactures hammocks; he makes about three of them per month at home that he sells to support his family.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy supplies for the business like silk cord in assorted colors.  He also needs to buy sheeting for his house’s roof.  With this purchase, the loan won’t only cover his business needs but also a family need so that they will be better protected.

His goal short-term goal is to improve the house although in the long term he wants to redo its structure because it’s made of metal sheeting and he wants to rebuild it with bricks.

loans.use: to buy silk cord in assorted colors and also to buy metal sheeting for the roof.

loans.name: Bolivar

texts.es: Bolivar, tiene la edad 53 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa. El pretende con el crédito dar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con una plantación de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar una buena plantación  para obtener una buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su esposa y crecer con el proyecto de producción café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: Asistencia de cafe

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina is a 37-year-old entrepreneur with three years of experience in livestock breeding. She sells cattle for meat. She usually sells animals to the local vendors at a profitable price. She buys pregnant cows or small calves, raises them, and after 5-6 months sells them in the central bazaar at profit. Zamina is married and has two children. Her monthly income is about $120 US. She would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose she applied for 500 Azerbaijani manats.

loans.use: to purchase one cow

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, es comerciante de verduras, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja, aprendió el comercio por unos amigos, tiene su propio local y no posee horario fijo para vender.
Actualmente necesita invertir en la compra de verduras, como güisquiles, papas, plátanos, tomates, cebolla, esta compra le permitirá crecer con mercadería y atender la demanda de los clientes.
El propósito de José es tener éxito en su negocio, pues su familia depende de él, por lo mismo busca alternativas de inversión.
texts.en:
José sells vegetables. He lives with his wife and two children and he, alone, works. He learned the trade from some friends and has his own stall and does not have a fixed schedule for his sales.

Currently, he needs a loan to purchase vegetables such as güisquiles [also known as chayote squash or vegetable pear], potatoes, bananas, tomatoes and onions. This purchase will permit him to expand his merchandise and meet the demands of his customers.

José’s goal is to have a successful business since his family depends upon him. Consequently, he is looking for this funding opportunity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as güisquiles [chayote squash], potatoes, bananas, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Vivian has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cues. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making banana cues.
Vivian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making banana cues

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
LLos socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Elena; ella es soltera y tiene 53 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de compra y venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares o al público en general, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, polos y pantalones al por mayor.
 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de ferretería, negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de transporte y negocio de llamadas telefónicas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “KILLA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. 

This member's name is Bertha Elena. She is single and 53 years old. She has 4 children. She has her own business buying and selling clothing. She sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses. She sells independently taking the clothes to different places or to the general public. With this business she gets her family ahead. Bertha Elena wants to grow and improve her business selling clothes. She is asking for the loan to buy pants, blouses, polo shirts wholesale.
 
The members work in selling artisanal crafts, food, hardware, sweaters, in transportation, and providing a telephone calling service.

Bertha Elena is thankful to those who are taking a part in her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, polo shirts wholesale.

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosini; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia sigue con sus negocios de venta de helados y venta de repuestos de carros y tractor,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el negocio de venta de helados y venta de repuestos lo realiza en el distrito de Anta,la socia quiere ampliar y seguir mejorando en su negocio de venta de repuestos de carro y venta de helados . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestosb al por mayor y comprar insumos para preparar los helados como frutas.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosini is 40 years old and lives with a partner. She has 3 chilldren. The member continues with her business of selling ice cream and selling spare parts for cars and tractors from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Both the ice cream business and the spare parts business are based in the district of Anta. The member wants to expand and continue improving her car spare parts business and her ice cream business. The member is asking for a loan to buy spare parts wholesale and supplies such as fruit to make her ice cream. 

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts wholesale and buy supplies such as fruit to make ice cream.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from the village of Manglisi, Kartli Region. She is 47 years old and lives with her family: husband, Shota, her 17-year-old daughter and 86-year-old mother-in-law. Maria’s daughter goes to school. Her mother-in-law is retired. Maria and Shota earn a living with agricultural activities. They have two milk cows and sell milk in the village. 

Maria requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. She will get 50% more milk and increase the income of the family. 

The family members plan to use the increase in income for purchasing household goods in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 41 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Javier, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos ellos menores juntos los crían en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Tambo. Como madre responsable, se ocupa de la educación y cuidado de sus hijos. Pero como mujer emprendedora, abrió una fuente de soda, donde vende jugos, hamburguesas, pasteles y toda clase de bebidas. Su principales clientes son los vecino que trabajan en el hospital y los que visitan el complejo deportivo. Trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo sin descansó, pues su principal meta es ampliar su negocio y hacerlo conocido; sabe que lo logrará pues recibe el apoyo de su hijo quien comparte con ella todas la responsabilidades. Además de recibir el sueldo de su esposo, quien trabaja en una muna como topógrafo. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Sara de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de panetones variados, para vender en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Sara, 41, is a wise woman.  She lives with Javier, her husband of 17 years.  Together they have four minor children whom they raise in their own home, located in the area of Tambo.  As a responsible mother she takes care of her children's education and care.

As a woman entrepreneur, however, she opened a soda fountain where she sells juice, hamburgers, pastries, and all types of drinks.  Her main customers are the neighbors who work in the hospital and those who visit the sports complex.  She works every day without rest, from Monday through Sunday, since her main goal is to expand her business and make it known.  She knows she will achieve this since she has the support of her son who shares all the responsibilities with her.  She also has her husband's salary; he works as a surveyor in a mine.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She also likes being part of her association because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

When Sara receives her loan she will invest it in buying various types of "panetón" [holiday sweet bread] to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy different brands of "panetón" [sweet bread] to sell during the holidays.

loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en: Byambajargal is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her two daughters are college students. She started her animal raw hides resell business in 2010. She travels across the  countryside to collect raw hides. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she already has several regular customers; however, due to money problems, her business is very limited. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I have two kids who are in college. I was a cook in a small cafe, however I have to act agressively in order to support my children." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more animal raw hides to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more animal raw hides.

loans.name: Rosadilla

texts.en: Rosadilla is 40 years old and married with seven children. She is from Capucao. Rosadilla owns and operates a farm.  She earns 7000 PHP a month from planting and selling fruit and vegetables. In 2008, Rosadilla joined GDMPC to gain access to to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosadilla is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosadilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, se ha decidido por solicitar otro prestamo, para la compra de maiz, leña, condimentos, quesillo, aceite, para la preparacion de las pupusas, quiere continuar fortaleciendo el negocio con la esperanza de mejorar las ventas.
Ella esta contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de crecimiento que se le dá en cada prestamo, ya que le permite seguir en pie con las ventas, proveyendo para su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Luz has decided to request another loan in order to buy corn, firewood, condiments, cheese, and oil to make pupusas. She wants to keep strengthening her business in the hope of improving sales.
She is happy and grateful for the opportunity for growth that each loan gives her as this enables her to keep up her sales and provide her family with what they need.

loans.use: to buy corn fire wood, condiments, cheese, and oil.

loans.name: Agacito

texts.en:
Agacito is 51 years old and married with three children. His primary source of income is from rice farming. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice from his field. Last season, he earned PHP 10,000 and did not have enough profit to support the necessities of his family. He felt sad about that, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to develop his business and provide more income. 

He is determined to provide for the needs of his family so he is working patiently on his business. In the future, he knows that he can produce enough profits for the betterment of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to develop his business

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, 37, is single and resides with her mother and a sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister are garment workers. She has been working in the garment factory since 2005 and earns less income. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a plot of farming land to grow agricultural crops to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Rosita has a retail shop and she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Duo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Duo Damas Laboriosas. Doña Vilma como la Conocen en la comunidad donde Vive, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y vennta de calzado de segunda mano, ella no pierde tiempo siempre esta ofreciendo su productos en cada reunion que tiene eso la a syudado a darle buelta al poco capital que tiene y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito ya que el poco capital que tiene no le alcanza, desde ya agradese a Fape y kiva por la ayuda que le puedan brindar.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y calzado de segunda mano

loans.name: Gs Shadai Group

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, de 49 años de edad, es casada, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle. Doña Gregoria  por  ser la persona que siempre esta pendiente de sus compañeros y que el grupo funcione, fue elegida por sus compañeros de grupo como la líder del grupo solidario SHADAI, se dedica desde hace vario tiempo a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su venta es en su casa ahí llegan sus clientes a comprar sus tortillas.
Doña Gregoria esta solicitando 7,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz y leña que son la materia prima que mas utiliza para hacer las tortillas.
El sueño de Doña Gregoria es mejorar su casa y salir bien con sus préstamos.
La Señora Celina, se dedican a venta de abarrotaría y pescado.
Doña Lesly, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz y leña para su negocio

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 36 лет. Она из района Дж.Руми. Гулбахор замужем и мать 5 детей. Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности на районе. Дети учатся в средней школе. Гулбахор честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды уже 2 года, и она параллельно занимается земледелием у себя во дворе. Ей в работе помогает муж. Сейчас она решила, посадит картофель, морковь и помидоры. Гулбахор хочет обработать земли минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный и богатый урожай. Для купли  достаточного количества минеральных удобрений, у нее нет денег. По этой причине Гулбахор обратилась за кредитом. У нее нет другого варианта кроме кредит. Гулбахор надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Gulbahor is 36 years old.  She is from the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of five children.  Her husband is involved in crop farming, in his own district.  The couple's children attend secondary school.  Gulbahor is an honest and hardworking woman.  She has been sewing women's dresses from home for two years already and she also works in agriculture, at home.  Her husband helps her with her work.  She has now decided to plant potatoes, carrots and tomatoes.  She wants to prepare her land with mineral fertilizers, so that she can get an abundant and high-quality harvest.  However, she doesn't have the money necessary to buy enough mineral fertilizers.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  This loan is her only option.  She is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and use them to prepare her land.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: JOSE ALBERTO: Es joven afable, trabajador, trabaja como distribuir de gas, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 25 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposa trabaja de manera informal, como costurera. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y digna, solicita su primer financiamiento para construir un anexo de madera que será utilizado como cuarto. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: madera, clavos y zinc. Él sueña con brindarle a su familia una vivienda de concreto.

loans.use: para construir un anexo de madera

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth O., a 35 years old woman sells food item to people in her environment in Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promise to effectively use the above amount to expand he business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Comlan

texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Cotonou, Mr. Comlan B. is married and has three (03) children. As a mechanic, his job barely supports him, and he meets the needs of his family through pain and suffering because of a lack of work.

So, to avoid staying inactive during times when he is not working, he has decided to begin an income-generating business to make ends meet.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorcycle taxi. The fares obtained will allow him to repay this loan and will also give him the means to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1969 à Cotonou, Monsieur Comlan B., est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Mécanicien de profession, une activité qui ne lui sourit guère, il arrive avec peine et souffrance à subvenir aux besoins elémentaires de sa famille par manque de travail.

Aussi, pour ne pas rester inactif pendant que son travail ne marche pas, il a décidé d’entreprendre une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir joindre les deux bouts.

C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un financement de $800 pour s’acheter un taxi moto. Les recettes réalisées permettront de rembourser ce financement et aussi lui donneront les moyens de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling processed cereals

loans.name: Nghoun

texts.en:
Mrs Nghoun S. is 37 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She runs a small grocery and her husband is a policeman. They earn 5 dollars a day. They have 3 children who are still students. 
Mrs Nghoun S. would like to purchase goods to expand her grocery store. In the future, she would like to own a big store with a wide variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase more products to expand her grocery

loans.name: Hesret

texts.ru:
Hesret M. was born in 1966 in Aksu where he lives today. Hesret is a good family man and a father of 3 children. In 2005, he took $300 loan from Aksu branch of Normicro to start a mobile sales business. Now, Hesret M. drives a taxi. He asks for a loan to repair his taxi car.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хесрет Мамедов. 1966 год.рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Аксу.Хороший семьянин, имеет троих детей. 2005 году взял в кредит 300$ из Нормикро Аксунского филиала и начал заниматься передвижной торговлю. Теперь Хесрет занимаеться таксовкой. Он нуждаеться в кредите , чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
My name is Isabel M.. I'm a business woman and I count on my used clothing business, which I run in my community's center. This business generates income for me to contribute to my home's expenses, and which has helped me stabilize my home. Recently, the demand for used clothing has increased, since new clothing is so expensive, and it is for this reason that I wish to supplement my clothing supply in order to offer better variety and prices to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Isabel M. y soy comerciante cuento con negocio de venta de ropa usada, que esta ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esa forma mejorar nuestro nivel de vida. actualmente la demanda a crecido en vista que el costo de la ropa nueva es mayor la mayoria de las personas optan por comprar ropa usada, actualmente necesito sutir mas mi negocio y asi ofrecer mayor varedad y mejores precios a mis cliente.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing (children's, men's and women's) for sale

loans.name: Bose
