texts.en: A. Bose is 35 years old, married, and hails from Afromedia in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells books to students in  school.  She requests a loan to buy more textbooks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more textbooks

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem T., 38, is married and works as a housewife cooking food for her entire family. To supplement her household, her husband, 35, works as a mobile construction foreman, and earns about $4 a day. Also, one of her children works at construction, another one is a dancer, and the other children are unemployed.

Mrs. Hem T. requests a loan to purchase more construction tools for her husband’s business so he can work faster and more efficiently.

loans.use: Purchase more construction tools to improve her husband's business.

loans.name: Raci

texts.en: Raci, 46, is married to K. and has 2 children. She has a playstation (game) rental at her house, earning about $7 a day. Previously, she sold fried snacks but because of lack of capital she quit that business. Now she is asking for a loan of $125 to continue her food business and expand the rental business and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To continue her food business and expand their rental business

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim Y., 35, is a mother of two children and, together with her husband, works as a construction laborer. Every day they can earn about $5. The cost of their commute is high so now they are requesting a loan from Kiva to own a motorbike. Before they rode to their work place by motor-taxi so it cost them a lot. (Mrs. Chim Y. took a picture with a motorbike that she is going to buy).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for their commute

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda J., age 40, is married and has four children (ages 22, 20, 17, and 13). She has a salon and a charcoal business which she started 3 years ago. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $121.

Matilda has taken out two previous loans from Tujijene Tanzania to start a charcoal business. She hopes for a new loan to open a stationery shop.

loans.use: to open a stationery store

loans.name: Lucia Soledad's Group

texts.es:
Rita and Lucia have belonged to the Anabella Communal Bank for one year.

Rita is married, is 55 years old and has five children. She sells coats, handbags and shoes that she buys in the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa and sells them to company workers, friends and acquaintances.

Lucia is married, 43 years old and has four children. She has a gift, clothing and CD shop in the city of Cangallo which is located 4 hours from Ayacucho. Her products are purchased in Lima and Tacna. In addition, Lucia weaves sweaters on a machine.

Rita and Lucia need a loan of $500 to purchase leather bags, shoes, dishes, blouses, and clothing.

Rita dreams of her children becoming professionals, having a stable business, and being with her family; while Lucia dreams of expanding her business and building her home.

Translated by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Rita y Lucia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Anabella hace 1 año.

Rita es casada, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, Rita venD. abrigos, carteras y zapatos que compra en las ciudades D. Juliaca y Arequipa, sus ventas lo realiza a trabajadores D. instituciones, amigos y conocidos.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Lucia tiene una tienda D. regalos y Cds, ropa en la ciudad D. Cangallo que se ubica a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima y Tacna. Además Lucia teje chompas a maquina.

Rita y Lucia necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sacos D. cuero, zapatos, platos, blusas y ropa.

Los sueños D. Rita son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio estable y estar junto a sus hijos, mientras que los sueños D. Lucia son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.

loans.use: To purchase leather bags, shoes, dishes, blouses, and clothing.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Purchase flour, yerba mate, sugar, rice, milk products, meat, soft drinks, etc Santiago F. Maidana is married and has two adult children. Both go to the university.

The couple started working in different companies, but due to the low salary they received they resigned and launched a new venture. They opened two microenterprises: a small grocery store and a polyethylene factory. Both work together in both businesses.

The money from the requested loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for the small store, for example flour, rice, oil, noodles, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago F. Maidana esta casado y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Ambos van a la universidad.

La pareja empezó a trabajar en diferentes compañías y debido al salario bajo que recibían decidieron renunciar e iniciar un nuevo emprendimiento. Fue así como abrieron dos microempresas: una despensa y una fabrica de polietileno. Los dos trabajan conjuntamente en ambas empresas.

El dinero del préstamo solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercaderías para la despensa. Por ejemplo: harina, arroz, aceite,fideo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase flour, yerba mate, sugar, rice, milk products, meat, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Jesusa Natividad

texts.es:
Jesusa is very consistent and hardworking. It was more than 15 years ago when she made the dicision to create her own source of income and she did it by setting up a general store in her own home. Since then, that has been her family’s most important source of income and she dedicates herself to it tirelessly day after day.

Jesusa keeps in mind all the time that that the money is necessary in order for her children to continue studying. Her big dream is to increase the size of the store and to stock it with a greater number products in order make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesusa es muy constante y trabajadora, hace ya más de 15 años que ella tomó la decisión de proporcionarse sus propias fuentes de ingreso, y lo hizo a través de una bodega que instaló en su propia casa. Desde entonces esa es la fuente de ingreso más importante para su familia, dedicándose a ello día tras día, sin descanso. Jesusa tiene en mente todo el tiempo que es necesario ese dinero para que sus hijos continúen estudiando. Su gran sueño es agrandar su tienda, surtirla con más productos y así obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Acquire new and better merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in beauty and bath products for a small business.

loans.name: Ache

texts.en:
Ache is a 29 year old single woman with 2 children ages 11 and 8. She has been selling fruit since 2005. She works everyday from 10am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Ache now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for re-sale.

loans.name: Dionicia Timotea

texts.es:
Dionicia tiene 51 años D. edad, estudió primer año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. siete hijos. Actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado D. Imicate, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, Puno.

DesD. hace 04 años es socia del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” – Yunguyo. Con su crédito inicial D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles, compró papa, quinua y chuño para ser comercializado en la ciudad D. Tacna. 

Doña Dionicia manifiesta que desD. los15 años D. edad se dedica a este negocio, a los 18 años D. edad formó su hogar. Continuó con el negocio e incrementó la venta D. ropa que llevaba a la ciudad D. Tacna, pero al ver que la ganancia en casacas era poca, lo dejó. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, chuño, papa, etc. 

Con este crédito D. S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.1,700.00, el cual será comercializado en la feria D. Yunguyo. Y con el resto del capital comprará 01 quintal D. quinua (S/.315.00), 05 arrobas D. chuño (S/.200.00), 10 arrobas D. haba (S/.200.00), etc., los cuales serán comercializados en la ciudad D. Tacna. 

Su meta es tener un cobertizo, que su hija menor, D. 11 años D. edad, estudie y sea una profesional ya que sus hijos mayores sólo estudiaron quinto D. secundaria por falta D. medios económicos.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 51 years old, completed the first year of primary school, is married and the mother of seven children. She currently lives in the town of Imicate, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She has been a member of the "Fe y Alegria" Communal Bank of Yunguyo for the past four years. With her first loan for S/.300 nuevos soles she bought potatoes, quinoa and chuño (a freeze-dried potato product traditionally maD. by Quechua and Aymara communities of Peru and Bolivias) which she sold in the city of Tacna. Dionicia says that she has been in traveling sales since she was 15 years old and at 18 she began her family. She continued in this business and increased the amount of clothing which she took to Tacna, but when she realized that earnings from clothing were low she gave it up. She currently buys and sells cattle, chuño, potatoes, etc. With a loan for S/.3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she plans to buy 1 head of cattle for S/.1,700 nuevos soles, which will be sold at the Yunguyo market. With the rest of the money she will buy a hundreweight of quinoa (S/.315), 5 sacks of chuño (S/.200), 10 sacks of fava beans (S/.200), etc., which will be sold in Tacna. Her goal is to build a shed and that her youngest daughter, who is 11 years old, studies and becomes a professional, unlike her older children who only studied up to fifth graD. of secondary school because there was no money.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle, quinoa, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five children: one son and four daughters. Her eldest daughter is in 3rd standard. Her son is in 2nd standard. The younger to him is in kindergarten. Her last two daughters are not of a school-going age.

Musarat baji’s husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Musarat baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim baji wants a loan to expand her shampoo selling business. Tahira baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy artificial flowers for her decoration business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Le Thi H. is 32 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Hung Nguyen district.  Her husband is a worker.  In 2006, she joined TYM and borrowed a loan to invest in raising pigs and chickens and small trading. Now she owns a fertilizer shop.  This business is developing well and is her family’s main income.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND ($600 US) to invest in fertilizer.

loans.use: To invest in fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Jannet Milagros

texts.en:
Jannet is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 19 years old and lives at home with her parents. She administers her father’s inter-provincial taxi business, since her parents travel a lot to buy car parts in other cities and bring them to Lima to sell. Jannet handles all of the money, pays the driver and the payment collector, and checks up on the taxi to see if it needs any work done. Jannet knows a lot about cars and enjoys working with them; she wanted to study to be a mechanic or a heavy machinery operator, but her father felt that these were not suitable jobs for a woman, so instead she is studying Administration. 

Jannet is requesting a loan of 1500 Soles to reupholster, paint, and buy new tires for her father’s taxi. She will also use part of the loan to pay her school fees. 

Jannet’s goal for the future is to have her own line of taxis or to sell cars.

loans.use: Reupholster, paint, and buy new tires for taxi; pay school fees

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Kiều Thị Sơn  27 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn- Hà Nội. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi và  kinh doanh hàng giải khát. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi, kinh doanh hàng giải khát gia đình chị  còn mở rộng buôn bán thêm hoa quả và kinh doanh dịch vụ đám cưới( phông bạt, bát đĩa...) với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị Sơn mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thức ăn để phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kiều Thị Sơn - 27 years old - she is living with her husband and young child in the district of Sóc Sơn in the city of Hà Nội (Hanoi - capital of Vietnam). In 2005, she joined TYM Fund to borrow funds for the businesses of rearing livestock and selling beverages. Currently, outside of raising livestock, her family has added fruits and wedding celebration items to their beverage retail business providing an income of 5,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle, Sơn hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to purchase more animal feed for their livestock rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase for raising livestock

loans.name: Victoria Ridina

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Victoria es soltera, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Victoria trabaja como auxiliar de educación en el puericultorio de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Victoria los días domingos vende comida típica en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, maíz y carne.
Victoria sueña con que su ultimo hijo sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 58-year-old single mother of six. She works as an education assistant at a daycare center in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, on Sundays Victoria sells typical regional meals out of her home, an activity made possible thanks to the help of her daughter. Victoria is requesting a loan of 600 soles, money which she plans to invest in the purchase of firewood, corn and meat. Her dreams are for her youngest son to be a professional and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn and meat

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita P. is 46 years old and married to Valeriano. He works as a farmer and manages their own land which is their primary source of income. They have five children: Felipe - 20 years old, college student; John - 17 years old, also a college student; Teodoro - 15 years old, second year high school; and the twins: Reynalyn and Renante - 13 years old. Unfortunately, the twins did not pursue their high school education due to a lack of financial support; instead, their parents prioritized the education of those in college level.

Anacita has been operating a sari-sari store (a community-based store) since 1984. However, her stocks are still limited. Her income of PHP 1,400 a week is being used for their daily expenses, not to mention the school allowance of their children. Her business is really a big help for their family for it sustains their daily needs like food and the allowance for her children. She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks for further development of her store that she can offer to her customers. She says, “Life would be easier if everybody faced the trials and problems in life together."

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Набиев Сафарали проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 30 леть, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Покупает , откармливает и перепродает бычков. Для данного вида бизнеса планирует получить кредит и купить бычка. Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота . Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safarali N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 30 years old, is married and has four children. He raises livestock. Safarali buys, fattens and resells cattle. He plans to take out a loan for this business and to purchase a calf. This will help him to increase his cattle headcount. He plans to pay back the loan over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are in school. According to her, both of them are in junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Agnes works hard to make some income to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. Agnes procures the goods from wholesale dealers in the regional capital and sells in her community. She does not own a shop in which she sells but hawks in her community. Apart from the provision business, Agnes also trades in footwear.

She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase her stock.

loans.use: Procure provision

loans.name: Djamadjigui  (L’Espoir Des Hommes) Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Djamadjigui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, et sont  mères d’au moins 6  enfants .Elles vivent dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou
Elles mènent différentes activités telles, la restauration et la  vente de  condiments alimentaires. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant de ce  sixième  prêt solidaire  (prêt de groupe)  est  de 200.000 FCFA par cliente et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement  remboursé. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz et toutes sortes de condiments alimentaires. Les femmes du groupe Djamadjigui vendent du riz bien cuisiné au carrefour de  Kimparana. Elles ont des tables pour la vente de condiments devant les gargotes. 
Elles se procurent des marchandises à partir de Sikasso et de San auprès des grossistes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune  160 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle. En plus  du remboursement des prêts elles  feront face  aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djamadjigui are all married and average 37 years of age. They are the mothers of at least 6 children and live in the village of Kimparana, in San prefecture, Segou region. They do different kinds of work, such as food catering and selling condiments.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amount of the sixth solidarity loan (group loan) is 200,000 francs CFA per client. All five preceding loans were correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice and all sorts of condiments. The merchandise is acquired from Sikasso and San from wholesalers. The group members sell nicely-cooked rice at the crossroads of Kimparana. There, they have tables for selling condiments in front of the eateries.

The women of the group each plan to realize 160,000 francs of profit in the course of this cycle. In addition to the loan payments, they will address common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments for catering

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr.C. , el se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulperia tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el esta casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta casado y el otro estudia. el desea surtir mas su negocio para poder incrementar su clientela asi permitiendole generar mayores ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su negocio ha crecido un poco ya que los productos que el vende son de primera necesidad y para este credito que esta solicitando espera poder hacer crecer su negocio en un 30% ya que invertira su credito en la compra de mercaderia. su meta es tener un mercadito grande en el cual pueda vender de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is a businessman who has been running a grocery store for more than 2 years. He is married, has 2 children, one of whom is married and the other is studying. He wants to expand his business so that he can increase his number of customers which will allow him to earn a better income and improve the living conditions for his family. His business has grown a little since the products that he sells are basic necessities and, by way of this loan that he is asking for, he hopes to be able to grow his business by 30% by using the money to buy merchandise. His aim is to have a big market from which he can sell all manner of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoo, creams, lotions and spare parts for the repair of a mill

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 52 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Mhamad has owned a butcher shop. Mhamad requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new refrigerator and change the décor of his shop. This is his fourth cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Mhamad is special in his work because he does it well and is clean in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as he likes it. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mhamad will use the loan to purchase a new refrigerator and change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: mr guangué est un commerçant de profession qui a ouvert une alimentation générale au quartier cité senghor de thiès;il dispose d'une forte clientèle qu'il souhaite satisfaire,c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret  pour renforcer son stock de marchandises
texts.en:
Mr Guangué is a serious merchant who has opened a general store in the Cité Senghor neighborhood in Thiès. He has numerous customers whom he would like to satisfy. For that reason he is requesting a loan so that he can add to his inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of groceries

loans.name: Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es: “Franz Tamayo” es una Asociación Comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal  “Panamericana”, con 13 integrantes. A la cabeza de su presidenta  Nicolasa Q., se organizan para llevar a delante su reunión. Nicolasa tiene el negocio de tejido de chompas y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como  lana. Al igual que Nicolasa las demás integrantes tienen sus respectivos negocios como la confección de ropa, tejido de mantillas, venta de comida y  tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
“Franz Tamayo” is a Communal Association of 13 members that belongs to the “Pan-American” Focal Center. At the top is President Nicolasa Q., who is organizing them to move forward with their group. Nicolasa has the business of woven sweaters and needs the loan to buy raw materials like wool. Like Nicolasa, the other members have their respective businesses such as the preparation of clothing, woven blankets, food sales and neighborhood stores.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods and raw materials

loans.name: Начминисо

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шарипова Начминисо женщина, которая работает в средней школе учительницей математики. Она кроме своей мало оплачиваемой работы, занимается откормом скота. А продаёт её муж.На следующий кредит Начминисо хочет купить две коровы и корм для них. Сейчас у неё три коровы и маленький телёнок.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Ngeleli Group

texts.en:
Fidelia is a member of the Ngeleli borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 16 and 11 years.She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Fidelia started her own clothing business selling clothes 4 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Fidelia first loan from BRAC.She requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Fidelia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Lucia is another member of the same borrower group she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Lidia es divorciada, tiene 59 años y 9 hijos, Lidia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes y panes y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y cereales.
Los sueños D. Lidia son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank, "El Sol." She is divorced, is 59, and has 9 children. She travels to different markets in the region where she sells groceries and bread. At the markets, she buys cereals, which she later sells at the food market in the city of Ayacucho. Lidia needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and cereal. Lidia's dreams are to improve her business and to proviD. her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and cereals

loans.name: Edo

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans la vente de produits congelés, que ce soit la viande de dindons ou de poulets. Elle est seule actuellement à élever ses 02 enfants. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2004 dans le quartier d’Akodessewa à Lomé. Elle a loué une boutique de vente de produits congelés ; et ce commerce lui permet de payer les frais de location de sa boutique et de subvenir à tous les besoins de sa famille. Elle a ouvert sa boutique sur une route très fréquentée, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bonnes affaires. Elle reçoit même des demandes lors de certaines fêtes dans le quartier ; beaucoup de personnes l’apprécient beaucoup parce que ses viandes ne sont pas avariées. Elle a besoin en ce moment de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 cartons de viande de poulets et 25 cartons de viandes dindons. Elle est convaincue qu’elle remboursera son crédit à temps.
texts.en:
Edo specializes in selling frozen food products, such as turket and chicken meats. She is a single mother of 2 children. She started out in 2004 in the district of Akodessewa in the city of Lome. She rents a frozen food store, and this business allows her to cover the store rent costs and to provide for all of the needs of the family. She set up her store in a well-travelled road, which is why she sees good business. She even receives orders for certain holidays in the district. Many people look to her because her meat are of good quality. She is currently in need to restock her supply, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase 25 boxes of chicken meat and 25 boxes of turkey meat. She is determined to pay off the loan on time.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase frozen food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de chapeaux - foulards

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian C.’s hands are always full attending to her array of businesses. She is 45 years old and lives along Leveriza Street in Pasay City with her husband Edwin, aage 40, and their nine children.

Vivian's general store is her largest source of income. She also rents an extension of their house to student boarders and transients, she sells cosmetics and apparel, and she sells electronic load credits for mobile phones. She juggles all these business activities. Her combined monthly income reaches P 68,000.00 per month. She budgets her profit for her family’s daily basic needs, especially the education of her children.

Vivian is now on her 6th loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is applying for a new loan of P 25,000.00 to use as additional capital for her businesses. She will use part of the loan proceeds to purchase grocery items for her general store. Some will be used for her mobile phone electronic load credits.  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M., 52, is a widow who lives with her three children in Ascoville, Tala, Caloocan City.

Angelina is an all-around beautician and runs a small beauty salon in the comfort of her home. Upon the request of customers, she also provides home service doing manicure, pedicure, haircut, hairdressing and make-up. She also sells cosmetics offered by direct selling companies like Avon and Sara Lee. She has been enjoying this kind of work for the last fifteen years and she now earns close to P13,000 a month. She uses her earnings to answer for her family’s daily needs.

Angelina joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007 and is now on her 11th loan. She has recently applied for a new loan in the amount of P20,000. She will use the funds to purchase supplies for her parlor/salon.


About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon/parlor

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes A. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 48 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Lourdes owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ann Mary Mugisha‘S Group

texts.en: Ann Mary is a 65 year single mother of eight children aged between 30 and 43 years. They all completed school. She owns and lives in a four room house with seven people. AnnMary takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying merchandise from Kikuubo (one of the busiest places in Kampala city). She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Ann Mary owns a retail shop in Nsooba Kyebando and doesn’t pay for rent because she owns the business premises. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Besides this retail shop, she also owns a poultry farm with 200 laying chicken. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, and school fees for her grand children. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like boxes of soap, jerrycans of cooking oil and chicken feed. She aspires to see her business grower bigger and to start selling on wholesale only and also owning 1000 laying chickens.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en: Faustine is a married woman and mother to five children. She is the sole owner of a mini-retail shop which deals specifically with essential items most commonly used in the community such as sugar, bread, kerosene, soap, and many others. She initiated this in 1998 from her small savings. Faustine has applied for her first loan of Kenya Shillings 30,000 which she will use  to buy additional stock of commodities not currently stocked. Faustine's dream is to expand into a wholesale store.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of commodities

loans.name: Rammaiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. The majority of people living in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Ram Maiya M.'s family has five members including herself. She has two sons and one daughter. Both her sons are studying at the secondary level and her daughter is in pre-school.

Her husband's name is Dharma Lal M.. He is a carpenter, and opened his furniture shop four years ago. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled from the shop's income. Mrs. M. is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 NPR to buy lumber to use in building furniture. Her husband makes a variety of different furniture: beds, tables, chairs, wardrobes, and so on.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr: FAty K. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Avec son crédit elle fait de la transformation de produit local, elle extrait de l'huile d'arachide pour le commercialiser en suite au niveau de son village et dans le marché. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Faty K., 50, is a widow and the mother of 5 children, for whom she is still responsible. She has been a member of the Village Bank of SIWAL for 2 years and has received four loans which she used wisely and reimbursed in full. With this loan, she will be extracting peanut oil from local peanuts to sell in her village and at the market. Her profit will allow her to support her children and save a bit more money.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. SA. A. is a 36-year-old married womA.. She earns her daily income by selling grocery items to the neighbors who live near her home. She is able to generate $2 each day to meet the needs of her family.  SA.'s partner and husband is a fishermA. who currently fishes in and around Tunle Sap River. The family is blessed to two teenage children who are students in the local public school. SA. is looking for A. assistant to help with her business. She will improve her business by purchasing a larger inventory for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: I. Salimatou est née le 24 Mai 1988 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SAGBOHAN Ambroise, Salimatou est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Salimatou a un autre enfant à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. La famille vit depuis sept ans au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Salimatou vend depuis 5 ans, divers produits (des cannettes, mêches, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Salimatou se ravitaille. C'est la première fois que Salimatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Salimatou I. was born on May 24th, 1988 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Ambroise Sagbohan, Salimatou is a mother of two schooled children. She also has another child in her care, in addition to her own children. The family has been living in the Avotrou quarter, in Cotonou for the past seven years. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. To account for her own needs, as well as for the needs of her children, Salimatou has been selling various products (canned goods, hair extensions, etc.) directly from her house. It is in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, where Salimatou gets her supplies. This is the first time that Salimanou is requesting a loan from ALIDE – a loan that will help her strengthen her business and better respond to the requests of her customers.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canned goods (sweet soda drinks and beer)

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia con sus tres hijos, quines son menores de edad y le ayudan en lo que pueden para salir adelante juntos.

Cada día se despierta muy temprano para preparar a sus hijos para el colegio, posteriormente empieza a elaborar la comida que venderá en el día. A partir de las 4 de la tarde, con ayuda de sus hijos acondiciona un espacio fuera de su casa para vender sus platillos hasta las 12 de la noche. Lo que más le gusta cocinar son papas rellenas, tortillas y pollo frito, pues estos platillos se venden muy bien entre sus vecinos y clientes, ya que la prefieren por su sabor, buenos precios y la porción de arroz adicional que les brinda. Este negocio le es muy rentable porque las ganancias le permiten mantener a sus hijos y brindarles educación; lo que no le agrada es esperar hasta altas horas de la noche para lograr vender toda su comida. En adelante, tiene planeado mejorar y ampliar las instalaciones de su puesto para vender con mayor comodidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al dinero del crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Marcela tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de comestibles; como arroz, aceite y azúcar, en grandes cantidades, para seguir cocinando y vendiendo sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her three dependent children. They all help one another so that they can succeed together.

Each day Marcela wakes up early to get her children ready for school. Afterwards she begins preparing the food that she will sell for the day. Starting at 4pm and with the help of her children, she begins setting up the space outside of her home where she sells her dishes until midnight. What she enjoys cooking the most are stuffed potatoes, tortillas, and fried chicken since they sell very well among her neighbors and customers. They prefer the taste of her food, the good prices, and the extra serving of rice that she offers. Her business is very profitable because the income enables her to support her children and provide them an education. What she dislikes is waiting until the late night hours before all of her food is sold. Therefore, she has plans to improve and expand the facilities at her kiosk so that she can sell more comfortably.

This is her third loan with MFP. Marcela is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access a loan so that she could continue working. She plans to buy food items such as rice, oil, and sugar in large quantities so that she can continue cooking and selling her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in growing rice on her own plot of farmland, earning an income of USD 0.6 per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband operates a business refilling gas for lighters and earns an income of USD 3.3 per day. The standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute easily for his current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San N., 31, and her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Khoeun, 31, have been married for ten years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of them attends school and other three are still too young.

San has been selling pork for six years. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., age 23, is married and resides with her husband and six-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer who grows rice. She earns an income of about USD $3.00 per day. Her husband is often hired to pick fruit and is also a farmer. He earns an income of USD $5.00 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine to start a home tailoring business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a home tailoring business

loans.name: Gulya

texts.en:
N. Gulya is 41 years old. She is married, and a loving mother of 4 children. Gulya started her business 19 years ago because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home. She began selling kids’ clothing and shoes, and because she always liked sales, things went well for her after the business was started. She has continued selling clothing since then. Gulya is requesting a loan of 4500 Somoni in order to expand her business. She hopes to earn more money and to cover all of her children’s expenses. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchas new goods for selling in order to expand the business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer J., 34, is making sure that her family is provided with enough for their daily needs. Married to Bonifacio J., a factory worker, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own bike rental business for quite some time now.

Jennifer has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her bike rental business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more bikes to expand her bike fleet.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more bikes to expand her bike fleet

loans.name: Munawer's Group

texts.en: Munawer lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband does hosiery works, while Munawer runs a grocery shop in her home. While her earnings are reasonably good, she wants to expand her business by carrying more grocery items.  Her shop is the only one within the area and there is the potential to make a good income from her business.  Munawer has applied for a loan to buy more grocery products, hopeful that with the help of her increased income, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan D. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal in a store and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Juan is 43 years old and is married with a husband who is a telecom director. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to hire a car to carry more bags of charcoal to her store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en:
Froilan F. is from the town of Banga. He is 31 years old. Froilan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Froilan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Froilan has been engaged in his business for over 14 years. He also raises chickens and hopes to acquire piglets that he could also raise.

Froilan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Froilan has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Froilan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the chickens. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Froilan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor F. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Eleonor is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eleonor owns & operates a business selling personal products such as ready-to-wear clothes and used clothing in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene B. N.  es una señora  de 79 años de edad, Viuda que vive solamente con su sobrino de 19 años en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería

Doña Irene se ha dedicado toda su vida a la lechería, desde muy pequeña acostumbraba a levantarse todos los días a las 4 am para ordeñar sus vaquitas. 
Hoy ella con la ayuda de su sobrino  vende los productos lácteos a toda su comunidad quien se muestran muy satisfechos con su calidad, en especial la natilla.
Ella necesita un préstamo de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro  mil colones) para la compra de 3 vacas que ella necesita para incrementar la oferta de  leche y mejorar su negocio.

Doña Irene forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  sexto crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Irene B. N. is 79 years old. She is a widow who lives alone with her nephew who is 19. They live in a rural community of Costa Rica called San Gabriel located in Yolillal, Upala in the province of Alajuela. It is a rural community with a relatively large area of land with a semi-mountainous topography. Their principal economic activities are growing essential grains and small scale ranching. Irene has dedicated her whole life to dairy farming. Since she was young she has been accustomed to waking up every day at 4am to milk her cows. Today, with the help of her nephew, she sells dairy products to the whole community. Her customers are very satisfied with the quality of her products, especially the custard. She needs a loan of ¢604.000 (six hundred and four thousand colones) to buy 3 cows which she needs to increase her milk production and grow her business. Irene is part of the Empressa de Crédito Comunal of San Gabirel, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her sixth loan and she says that with this she hopes to be able to continue to grow as a micro-entrepreneur and take her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 milk cows

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 24 years old and married.  For six months, she has been operating a retail shop.  She is a member of GNLD group in Faulu Kenya, from whom she wants to obtain her first loan of 20,000 KES.  With the loan, Caroline will increase her stock of soda, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.  She hopes to invest in her business using her savings.  She sees herself opening a wholesale shop in ten years.  She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to increase her stock of soda, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Diana Esther

texts.es: Diana Esther C. es una mejer esforzada de 37 años quien tiene un auto lavado. Este negocio lo inicio en el 2004 para mejorar su casa y sacar a delante a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con el cual piensa aumentarle al negocio y trabajar arduamente para conseguir sus metas que es mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana Esther C. is a hard-working 37 year old woman. She has a car wash. She started this business in 2004 in order to improve her house and get her family ahead. This is her first loan, and she plans on increase her business. She will work arduously to reach her goal, which is to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like cleaning products for her car wash

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa V. González, esta trabajando por primera vez con nuestra institución, y para ella es su primer crédito de lo que va de su larga trayectoria comercial ella  hace tortillas para vender,  ella tiene su propia materia prima, pero es una persona muy proyectada y viendo mas hacia el futuro por lo que ella realiza su crédito para garantizar su trabajo en el transcurso de estos meses, ella obtiene utilidades de la venta de su negocio, es una señora muy luchadora porque tiene 20 años existencia en este ramo lo que le permite tener estabilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa V. González is working with our institution for the first time.  This is her first loan in her long commercial history selling tortillas.  

She has her own raw materials but, being a forward looking person, she sees that a loan can guarantee her work for the next few months.  She earns profits from her sales.  

She’s a tenacious woman who has worked in this field for 20 years thus having stability.

loans.use: To buy 8 quintales (1 quintal=46 kilos) of corn and firewood.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 29 years old. Lorna is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca Estela U. ella se dedica al negocio del destace de res y cerdo, tiene veinte y dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les entrega la carne, es acompañada y  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y   cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de cerdo y res para ampliarle a su negocio y poder abastecer a sus clientes, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Estela U. has been in the business of butchering cows and pigs for twenty-two years. She has customers who purchase meat from her. Blanca has a son who works with her and is of school age.

She has had five loans with CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy pork and beef so that she could expand her business and satisfy her customers. Blanca has benefited greatly from these loans because they have helped improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase a cow & two pigs

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar I. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. At first, she started her business in 2008 by selling a variety of clothes and household products with help of her sister. Since then, she has found success with her business, and she has been selling a variety of underwear and socks selling business by herself in the local market while her sister still manages their previous business. For the future, she would like to expand her business by enlarging her pavilion and increasing her product amount. Otgonbayar says, " I want to continue grow my business and buy my own plot of land with a fence in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more socks and underwear to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more socks and underwear to resell in the market

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel B. est tailleur à Gisenyi.  Il est marié, et il a un enfant qui a 2 mois. Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter une machine à coudre pour son atelier.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter les matériels de technologie, et le recrutement de personnels.  Avec ses affaires, il cherchera sa propre maison commerciale, et il enseignera les autres personnes ce projet.  Cet affaire lui permettra à accéder toujours au bien être de sa famille, et minerval pour ses enfants.  Emmanuel est aussi éleveur de 3 vaches et 5 chèvres à Nyagatare.
texts.en: Emmanuel B. is a tailor in Gisenyi. He is married and has one child who is two months old. He is going to use his loan to buy a sewing maching for his workshop. His strategy for expanding his business is to increase his technical equipment and to recruit staff. He is planning to find his own commercial premises for his business and he will teach other people his trade. This business will allow him to look after his family and pay his children's school fees. Emmanuel is also raising three cows and five goats in Nyapatare.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication. 

She has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week, selling her products from home, at retail prices. She generates additional income through rental rooms.

Prima has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges are seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 64 year old married woman from Baalbeck.  She is the owner of a used clothes and shoes shop.  She sells old shoes and clothes exported from Europe since 2003. 

Fatima is requesting her first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra winter clothing.  Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, and people passing by. Her prices are affordable to most people and she believes she has to do so to help everyone dress properly.  Fatima would like to do some decorations to her shop but she believes she could do it when she pays back the requested loan, and requests another one.

loans.use: To buy extra winter clothing.

loans.name: Ernesto Alonso

texts.es:
El joven Ernesto Alonso L. esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, pero tiene los gastos de la inscripción y pagos de los exámenes, en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir este gastos y terminar su correrá profesional. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así pagar en la universidad y terminar de estudiar. 
Planea pagar el crédito  con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una agencia de seguros, en el puesto de repartidor. Ya que es soltero y solo vive con su mama
texts.en:
Ernesto Alonso L. is a young man who is studying for a degree in business administration.  However, he has to pay registration and exam fees.  Right now he does not have the money he needs to cover these expenses and to complete his course.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay his university fees and to finish his studies.

Ernesto plans to pay back his loan with the money that he makes from his work in an insurance company, working as a assessor.  Ernesto is single and lives with his mom.

loans.use: To cover his university registration fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Allah Walie Ii Group

texts.en:
In this photo are members of the “Allah Walie II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT and Kiva lenders, and with it, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu C.. Kadiatu is age 35; she was born in the town of Kabala, where she currently resides with her husband and 3 children. For twenty years now,  Kadiatu has been a businesswoman. Currently, she sells cooked rice, shoes, cosmetics, etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy uncooked rice, cooking ingredients, shoes, cosmetics, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Keaya Grace

texts.en:
Keaya Grace K. is from Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast where she sells fabrics. Married to a farmer, she has 5 children. Her income helps pay for school fees and some household expenses. 
To grow her business, she intends to use the loan to purchase more fabrics to boost sales volumes. Extra profits from this will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: she intends to use the loan to purchase more fabrics to boost sales volumes.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar casado, su esposa sabe de repostería la cual practica siendo un ingreso extra, sus cuatros hijos estudian, el objetivo que se profesionalicen. Trabajo como taxista desde hace tiempo siendo el medio de sustentar a su familia. Su mayor proyecto es realizar mejoras poco a poco en su vivienda para ofrecerle a sus familia seguridad, comodidad.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su desarrollo en lo personal. Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedra cantera, alambre de amarre, hierro, azulejos para construir la parte de la cocina que requiere de remodelarlo ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Cesar is married; his wife knows a lot about dessert making, which she does to bring in extra income.  Their four children study with the objective of becoming professionals.  He has worked for awhile as a taxi driver, which is how he sustains his family.  His big project is making improvements little by little to their home to offer his family security and comfort.

He is grateful to the bank for the support in his personal development.  With the loan he will buy construction materials: cement, sand, granite, fastening wire, iron, and floor tiles to build the part of the kitchen that needs remodeling since it is in bad condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal, 28, is married and lives with his wife and son in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. Otgonjargal began selling clothes in 2010. He started his business with 1,300,000 MNT of working capital. His wife helps him with the business. He sells goods by traveling from one place to another place, while his wife operates a stall at the market. Their monthly sales volume fluctuates between 750,000 and 1,200,000 MNT. Otgonjargal is planning to expand his business and start making woodcraft items at home. He is a hardworking person who says, "I pay attention to the quality of the service that I offer to others." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase wood and necessary equipment for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and equipment for woodcraft business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 26 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children; one lives with her and the other with his grandmother in Ghana. She was not able to attend school but now both of her children are currently attending school. 

Patience has a business selling water and soft drinks in the Waterside market, which she has had for one year. She started with her own money and with the hot weather in Monrovia she says drinks are easy to sell. Patience has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks and water. 

In the future, Patience hopes to be a prominent business-woman and have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and water

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nilda; es conviviente; la socia tiene 31años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 11, 8, 5 años de edad, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el poblado, ella administra y atiende su tienda ubicada en su casa en el primer piso, la socia es nueva miembro en el grupo y la invitaron a participar sus amigas porque ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y de buena fama en los créditos, la socia requiere el crédito para poder invertir en la implementación de abarrotes y necesita el préstamo para comprar, arroz, harina, aceite, manteca, fideos y otros víveres de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” communal bank, which is located in Oropesa village, in the Quispicanchis province of the Cusco department.  Nilda lives with a partner, is 31 years old and has three children who are 11, 8 and 5 years old.  

Nilda has a small grocery store in the village.  She manages and attends to her store, which is located on the first floor of her house.  She is a new member to the group.  Her friends invited her to participate because she is a very enterprising woman with a reputation for having good credit.

Nilda needs this loan so that she can invest in setting up her grocery store, and to buy rice, flour, butter, noodles and other basic needs products.  She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of products.  Nilda is very thankful for the loan and is committed to completing the loan payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: set up her grocery store.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 42 años edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Fernanda vive en la ciudad Taray en la casa de un compadre porque perdió su casa en el desastre que ocurrió en el mes de febrero del año 2010, ella nos cuenta con mucha pena la ciudad de Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Su actividad económica principal de Fernanda es la venta de comida, cerveza y pollipapas, ella volvió abrir el restaurante hace un año y está empezando de nuevo. Por las tarde ella vende pollipapas de 4 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. Fernanda también se dedica a la agricultura ósea compra y vende maíz. En esta oportunidad Fernanda requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, pollo y muchas cosas más.  
    
Fernanda pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio de año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fernanda was born in the city of Cusco, Cusco Department, Perú.  She is 42 years old, married and has three children.  Fernanda currently lives in the city of Taray in a house of a compadre (the word by which the godfather and godmother address the father of their godson or daughter, and by which the father and mother address him) because she lost her house in the disaster that occurred in February, 2010.  She tells us with much sorrow that the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster when the river overflowed its banks and residents lost their businesses and their houses were destroyed.  (Taray is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for having beautiful scenery and for being a tourism, livestock raising and framing zone.)

Fernanda’s main economic activity is selling food, beer and pollipapas (potatoes and chicken).  She reopened the restaurant a year ago and is starting over.  In the evenings she sells pollipapas from 4pm until 9 at night every day.  Fernanda also works in agriculture that is, she is a corn merchant.  On this occasion, Fernanda needs the loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, chicken and many more things.

Fernanda is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” communal bank.  It’s at the four and a half years of operation mark and is doing quite well.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, chicken and several more things.

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women in Action” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is age 45; she was born in a village call Rotifunk but she is currently residing in Kenema city with her husband and five children. Her husband is a driver and two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. For 11 years now, Kadiatu has been selling smoked/dried fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets of smoked/dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets of smoked/dried fish to add to her business.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 29, is a driver. He also supplements his income with another business – buying cows and oxen and selling them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his house. His wife, Srey Oun plants small mango trees and sells them from home.  The couple lives in a village off National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.   They have been married since 2008 and just had a young daughter. 

Sophea is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more cows and oxen for sale.

loans.use: purchase more cows and oxen

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice is married with three children between the ages of two months and eight years. She is a farmer in Kitale town of Western Kenya and has been in farming for the last six years. She produces and sells milk, maize, and beans at the local market. 

Fanice is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct both a poultry unit for 30,000 KES and a dairy unit for 20,000 KES. She will use the rest of her funds to purchase poultry. Fanice is optimistic and focuses on having at least 1,000 birds on her farm. She says the high cost of artificial insemination is the main undoing of dairy farming. Fanice knows her loan will enable her to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to construct poultry and dairy pens and buy poultry

loans.name: Soklis

texts.en:
Soklis, 31 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a worker making hand grinding products. Their income is $9 per day. They have 4 children, 2 are studying and the other two are staying with their aunt in Phnom Penh. 

Each month, Soklis spends $40 on food, $10 on school fees and $8 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery items and pigs to feed. Her family is depending on her income the most. She needs to make more income to support the children, who are studying.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and pigs to feed.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay is a farmer with her husband and their income is $2 per day. She has two children who both work in the factory earning $5 per day each. Every month, Lay has to spend $55 on food, $20 on transportation and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy pigs for feeding. With this loan, she can make other benefits for her family. In the future, she plans to feed more animals and to repair her house when she have enough money.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Seyni

texts.fr: Implantée en face de la route nationale, la petite pièce qui sert d’atelier de couture à l’emprunteur devient de plus en plus étroite. Ayant démarré avec une seule machine, ce dernier en dispose actuellement de  trois. Il est marié et a huit enfants  qui fréquentent tous l’école. L’emprunteur exerce sa profession depuis prés de 24 ans. Il est assisté de deux apprentis à qui il apprend le métier. Parallèlement à son travail, il pratique durant l’hivernage l’agriculture et l’élevage. Les revenus tirés de ces activités lui permettent de s’occuper de sa famille. Il a déjà obtenu et rembourse six prêts à l’IMCEC et sollicite un autre prêt de  200000F destiné à l’achat d’une machine à coudre cornière pour la diversification des ses produits. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un grand magasin de couture et de mieux renforcer son équipement.
texts.en: Facing the national road, the small room set up as a tailor's shop for this borrower is becoming more and more cramped. Having started with a single machine, he currently has three of them. He is married and has eight children, who all attend school. This borrower has been working in this trade for nearly 24 years. He is attended by two apprentices whom he taught how to sew. Concurrently with his trade, he works in agriculture and livestock farming during the winter. The revenues derived from these businesses enable him to take care of his family.
